loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita B. is from the village of Dampalan, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Carmelita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling daily home products. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Carmelita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for the business

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en: Shiela M. is from the town of Panta-on, Ozamiz City. She is 33 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Shiela owns and operates a "sari-sari" (variety) store, selling soft drinks and daily use products such as soap, shampoo, toothpaste etc., in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Shiela joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Shiela is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: David

texts.en: David C. is from the village of Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 50 years old and is single. David owns and operates a business raising crops. He has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, David joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to raise additional crops. This loan will be his first from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To raise additional crops

loans.name: Léontine Stella Télé

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et mère de 1 enfant, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce des produits de première nécessité et de pagnes Baoulé dans sa propre boutique. Elle réalise de bons chiffres d’affaire tous les jours cela est dû à sa qualité d’écoute et d’accueil. Voulant agrandir sont stock de pagnes avec de nouveaux modèles de pagnes, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 25 pièces de pagnes baoulé et divers produits de premières nécessité.
texts.en:
This woman is married and the mother of one child. She earns a living selling staple foodstuffs and Baoulé "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth) in her own store. She makes a good turnover every day, due to the fact that she welcomes and pays attention to her customers. Wishing to expand her stock of "pagnes" with up-to-date styles, she is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 25 lengths of Baoulé "pagnes" and various grocery items.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of staple foodstuffs and Baoulé "pagnes"

loans.name: Mahsuda

texts.ru: MLF
texts.en:
Mahsuda T. is a loving wife and caring mother. She is 28 years old and lives with her family in the city of Istaravshan. Since she was 18 years old, Mahsuda helped her father with animal husbandry. Since her marriage, she continued working in the field but independently. She has one cow and two sheep that she feeds at home. Well-fed livestock brings good profit for Mahsuda. Mahsuda’s brother is a baker and makes flat bread. She helps her brother by selling the flat bread at a market. Mahsuda is requesting a loan in the sum of 1200 somoni for livestock feeding.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock feeding

loans.name: Kosiwa Nicole

texts.fr: Marié et mère de 02 enfants, cette femme habite avec son mari et ses enfants dans le quartier d’adidogomé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. Son mari est un chauffeur, le revenu de son mari n’arrive pas à couvrir toutes les charges de la famille, pour l’aider elle  s’est lancé dans le commerce de pagnes. le commerce de pagnes est très développé à Lomé, ce qui fait qu’elle réalise de  bonnes recettes tous les jours. Sa clientèle s’agrandit elle veut par conséquent agrandir son stock de marchandises pour mieux vendre, ayant déjà obtenu de WAGES un crédit qui lui a permis de démarrer son commerce, elle sollicite un autre crédit pour acheter 25 pièces de pagnes.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of 2 children, this woman lives with her husband and children in the Adidogomé neighborhood which is an outlying district of the city of Lomé. Her husband is a driver, but his income is not sufficient to cover all the family's expenses. To help him, she began selling "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth).

Selling "pagnes" is big business in Lomé, so she brings in a good income every day. Her clientele is growing so she would like to expand her inventory so as to sell more, having already obtained one loan from WAGES which allowed her to set herself up in business. She is requesting a second loan to buy 25 lengths of "pagne".

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing "pagnes" for re-sale

loans.name: Kheim

texts.en:
K. Kheim, 37, has been involved in her business since 2005. She sells groceries and produces a kind of cleaner made from fabric to clean car mirrors. She lives with her husband and three children, two of whom are students, and another one is employed as a construction builder.

Her husband sells blankets and nets, not only in his province but also in other places. His business is more profitable than hers, so she has decided to take a loan from Kiva of $1,000 to invest in his business for more income generation. She thinks that she will be able to give all of her children the chance to study at a good university for a good future occupation.

loans.use: To buy blankets and nets for her husband's business

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia D. was born in the month of October in the year 1969. She hails from the beautiful island village in the Municipality of Binagonan, Rizal Province in the Philippines. She is married to Reynaldo, a 50-year-old fisherman. She is the mother to three: a daughter and two sons. The eldest child, Sandra, is a 14-year-old high school student while the youngest John Rovic is an elementary pupil and is 9 years old.

In 1995, Amalia joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines. She and her husband have been partners in their business since the time they first had access to capital. For the almost nine years of her membership, they have ventured in fishing since they have a fish cage (a small fish trap). They deliver fish from their fish cage into markets with their regular customers.

Now on her 8th loan, Amalia is requesting 19,000 pesos as additional capital for their current business. She is optimistic that her business will grow and will expand the size of the cage and be sustainable. With the profits she gets from her business, she dreams of savings for their future.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for their fish cage

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en: Wilfredo R. is from the village of Taboc Norte, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. He is 54 years old, married, and has one adult child. Wilfredo owns and operates a business selling fish to the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over twenty years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Wilfredo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC. Wilfredo is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be his third from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria N. is from the village of Calabayan, Ozamiz City. She is 59 years old, married, and has five adult children. Gloria owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting corn for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over two years. In 2007, Gloria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase organic fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and to sustain the needs of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase organic fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Habibullo

texts.en: B. Habibullo lives in the town of Isfara along with his family. Through much effort he dedicates himself to the production of potatoes, onions and watermelons. He tends to his crops himself, with the help of one brother. One of Habibullo’s biggest problems is the marketing of his product and, due to distance, he sells his crop piecemeal which reduces his income to support the family. He has asked for a loan of 2,500 Somoni that will be spent on the purchase of seeds and fertilizer. This would allow him greater earnings which, in turn, would improve his family’s standard of living. His biggest desire is to participate in this future venture so he can improve his profits and provide a better life for his family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est un jeune célibataire, pour subvenir à ses propres charges, il s’est lancé dans la fabrication de savons, cette activité lui réussit bien car il dispose d’un statut de monopole dans son quartier, beaucoup de femmes revendeuse viennent acheter du savon chez lui pour revendre. Actuellement son activité a ralenti car les matières qu’il utilise dans la fabrication de savons sont épuisées. Il veut les acheter. Il sollicite alors de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 10 bidons de 25 litres d’huile de palme, 04 sacs de soude costiques, 04 sacs de colorants, 04 sacs de parfums et divers.
texts.en:
This gentleman is young and single and in order to support himself, he has gone into making soap. This business is going well for him because he has a monopoly in his neighborhood. Lots of women who want to re-sell his soap come to buy it from him. Presently, his business has slowed down because he has run out of the raw materials he uses to make the soap. He wants to buy these ingredients, so he is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 10 jerrycans of 25 liters of palm oil, 4 sacks of caustic soda, 4 sacks of coloring agent, 4 sacks of perfuming agents, etc.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of raw materials for making soap

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en:
E. Manzura is 47 years old and has raised three children. She has been raising cattle for three years, and the business income allows her to provide for the basic needs of her family. Her husband and children all take part in the farm work and help Manzura pour water and cut grass for the animals. Manzura has been delighted with the recent growth in her cattle farm and is enthusiastic about investing further. She is seeking a loan to buy more young cattle in order to expand her business and earn more.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes: its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchasee young cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Pich

texts.en:
S. Pich, 33, produces carpets for the small income of $1 per day. Together Pich and her husband have eight children.

Pich's husband is involved in the business of selling blankets and nets in all the nearby provinces and places and earns a daily income of $6. She really wants to take a loan from Kiva of $1,200 to expand her husband’s business by purchasing more blankets and nets to sell. When more income is generated, she wants to eliminate the great difficulty with her family expenses.

Pich and her husband are photographed together with a pile of door carpets.

loans.use: To buy blankets and nets for her husband's business

loans.name: Gaibillo

texts.en:
G. Gaibillo is a 36-year-old married father of two children. His mother and father are living with him, and he is responsible for their living expenses too. The owner of a butcher shop who has sold meat for four years now, Gaibillo is requesting a loan of $1350 in order to buy additional meat. Due to the profitability of his business, the determination of this micro entrepreneur and his experience in the business, he is qualified to receive this loan. Gaibillo is counting on your help. Your support will really help him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes: its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy meat to expand his business.

loans.name: Gnanta

texts.fr:
Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de charbons de bois, elle a associé à cette activité la vente de maïs. Les charbons de bois sont très utilisés pour préparer la nourriture au togo. Cette femme vend bien, elle vend même à crédit à certains de ses plus fidèles clients et récupère l’argent dans les 8 jours. Son stock étant épuisé elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 7 sacs de charbons de bois, 4 sacs de maïs et 2 sacs d’haricots.
Elle est mariée et a à sa charge 03 personnes.
texts.en:
This woman earns her living by selling charcoal; she also sells maize. Charcoal is much used to cook food in Togo. This woman sells a lot, even selling on credit to some of her most faithful customers and recuperating her money within a week. Her stock is low so she is asking for a loan from WAGES to buy 7 sacks of charcoal, 4 sacks of maize, and 2 sacks of dried beans.

She is married and responsible for 3 people.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of charcoal and cereals for resale

loans.name: Virginie

texts.fr:
D.  Virginie est agée de quarante (40) ans et est née à  Cotonou, Capitale Economique  de la République du Bénin. Virginie est mariée à GNANSOUNOU Emmanuel, un commerçant. Virginie et Emmanuel ont quatre (04) enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Virginie vit avec sa famille à  Sènadé 2 un quartier peuplé de la ville de Cotonou. 

Virginie vend des divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, piles, bougies, etc.) depuis un peu plus de neuf (09) ans. Virginie a commencée cette activité grâce au soutien financier de son mari. Avec cette activité, Virginie à son tour arrive à soutenir son mari en ce qui concerne les dépenses de la famille. Pour renforcer son activité et mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Virginie s’est adressée à ALIDé pour avoir de prêt.
texts.en:
D. Virginie, 40, was born in Cotonou, economic capital of the Republic of Bénin. Virginie is married to Gnansounou Emmanuel, who is a merchant. Virginie and Emmanuel have four children who are all enrolled in school. Virginie lives with her family in Sènadé 2, a working-class neighborhood of the city of Cotonou

Virginie has been selling assorted goods (candy, cookies; tins of milk, sardines, tomatoes; sugar, pasta, detergent, dish and toilet soap, batteries, candles, etc.) for a little more than 9 years. She was able to bigan this business thanks to her husband's financial support.

With her business, Virginie herself now manages to help out her husband as far as supporting the family is concerned. In order to bolster her business and better respond to the needs of her clientele, Virginie has come to ALIDé to request a loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 2 cases of candy, 3 cases of cookies, and some toiletries

loans.name: Mubin

texts.en: J. Mubin is 43 years old, married, and has a son. His wife is a housekeeper and she supports him in everything he does. Mubin is a hardworking person and he has been providing taxi services for the past five years. The most important thing to him is that his son, in future, enters university and successfully finishes it, so that he will be professional and have a better tomorrow. Mubin wishes to keep his taxi business growing, and for this he needs to have his working tools in good working order. He needs to buy spare parts to improve his taxi and that is why he is requesting a loan. Thanks to this work he has been able to stabilize his quality of life. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for repairing his taxi

loans.name: Chhim

texts.en: M. Chhim, 29, produces artificial trees used for decorating holy Buddhist shrines, earning a daily income of $3.30 while her husband, a mechanic, is able to generate a daily gross of $26.60. M. is requesting a Kiva loan of $1200 to buy spare car parts for her husband’s business to enable him to make a profit when customers need to change their old spare parts. Because she wants to allow all of her children to pursue higher education at a good university when they are old enough for schooling, she has to save more money and establish a good business early.

loans.use: To buy spare car parts.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.en: K. Jamshed is 30 years old, married, and has two children. He was born in a simple rural family and has worked with livestock from his childhood. He is very experienced and has the special skills in livestock care that help him to develop his business. He raises and sells livestock and sells meat and milk. Jamshed is requesting a loan of $500 to enable him to purchase a second dairy cow. The second cow will enable him to increase the milk produced and will provide income security to the family when one of the cows is in calf. The income will enable him to provide for his family, take good care of his cows, and supply his neighbors with quality milk. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase a second dairy cow

loans.name: Leonor Paulo

texts.pt:
Leonor Paulo M. de 41 anos nasceu no distrito de Manjacaze, província de Gaza, estudou até sétima. Casada e mãe de cinco filhos com idades compreendidas entre 22 – 10 anos de idade, para além do marido e filhos vive com um neto.

Leonor saiu de Manjacaze com os pais para cidade de Maputo quando era criança, tendo se formado como professora primária, ela trabalha 8hrs por dia e tem como salário mensal 6,300.00MT e vive na casa própria, embora ainda em obras.

A situação de acomodação na família não é das melhores, os cinco filhos compartilham dois quartos, sendo desafio construir mais dois quartos para proporcionar mínimas condições aos filhos.
 
Com o empréstimo de 15,000.00MT, pretende comprar cimento e outros materiais de construção para dar seguimento com os trabalhos de construção e no futuro sonha terminar com as obras e mobilar a residência.
texts.en:
Leonor Paulo M., 41 years old, was born in the district of Manjacaze, Gaza province. She studied until seventh grade. She is married and has five children aged 10 to 22 years, and lives with a grandchild as well as her husband and children. When she was a child, Leonor left Manjacaze with her parents for Maputo city. She graduated as an elementary school teacher. She works eight hours a day and earns a monthly salary of 6,300 MT. She lives in her own house, although it is still under construction. Accommodations for her family are not the best. The five children share two rooms, and they feel the need to build two more rooms to allow minimal living conditions for them. With the loan of 15,000 MT, she plans to buy cement and other construction materials to allow for the continuation of construction work on her house. In the future, she dreams of finishing construction and furnishing her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build family home.

loans.name: Koko

texts.en:
Koko L., currently in the business of selling bread, is requesting a loan to purchase baking materials. Koko, who is 28 years old and married to a peasant, has two children who both attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bakery.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase baking materials.

loans.name: Oromidin

texts.en:
Oromidin K. is married and has a little son. Two years ago, he started a business of processing and selling dried apricots to be able to earn enough money to pay for his son’s schooling. His experience in this business has enabled him to expand his clientele day by day, and now Oromidin is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more apricots to process and sell. With your help, Oromidin will be able to feel proud that through much effort, his son went to school and is an honorable person.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes: its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy apricots to expand his business.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet M. is from the village of Bay-bay, Balatacan, Tangub city. She is 55 years old. Juliet is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Juliet operates a family member's business selling fish. Juliet has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Juliet joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Juliet is requesting a loan of 7000 PHP to be used as additional capital to purchase fish to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Juliet from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement the needs of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Laurinda Isaura

texts.pt:
Laurinda Isaura B. de 42 anos nasceu na cidade de Maputo, estudou até nona classe e teve de interromper os estudos por ter ficado grávida. Solteira e mãe de um filho que ainda é estudante. 

Laurinda viveu no distrito de Moamba e depois veio para Boane por motivos de trabalho, onde passou a trabalhar até hoje, tendo passado por várias empresas. Vive na casa própria e nunca viveu com o pai do filho. Trabalha numa empresa pública como dactilografa e aufere como salário mensal 2,900.00MT.

É terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e sempre pagou sem grandes dificuldades. Com o valor de 12,000.00MT, tenciona comprar cimentos, pedra e areia para dar continuidade com a construção da moradia familiar.

No futuro assegura que vai solicitar outros empréstimos para terminar com as obras da moradia familiar.
texts.en:
Laurinda Isaura B. is 42 years old and was born in the city of Maputo. She went to school through ninth grade and had to interrupt her studies when she became pregnant. She is a single mother of one child, who is still a student.

Laurinda used to live in the Moamba district, then came to Boane for work. She found work and still works here today, having been at several businesses. She lives in her own home and has never lived with the father of her child. She works as a typist in a public company and makes a monthly salary of 2,900 MT (meticais).

This is Laurinda's third loan with Hluvuku (Kiva's Field Partner), and she has always paid without much difficulty. In the amount of 12,000 MT, this loan is intended to purchase cement, rocks, and sand to continue the construction of a family home.

In the future she will apply for other loans to complete the work on her family dwelling.

Translated from Portuguese by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a family house

loans.name: Sanoat

texts.ru: MLF
texts.en:
When Sanoat O. first started her entrepreneurship, she sold women’s shoes. Once she became our client and received a loan, she used it to expand her business. Since 2008, Sanoat transitioned into another, more profitable business – selling food products. Her product assortment includes sausage, cheese and milk products. Sanoat likes our financing terms and wants to obtain another loan in the sum of 2700 somoni in order to expand her product assortment. She wants to add butter and three other types of cheese. Sanoat is married and has 4 children: 3 sons and a daughter.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand product assortment

loans.name: Rafokat

texts.en:
K. Rafokat is a woman of great courage and dedication who struggles to put food on the table for her children. She is a diligent mother who has always strived for the health and well-being of each member of her family. Throughout this season, she directs herself towards the fields where she plants potatoes. She sells the fruits of her labor at various local markets. In addition, as an extra income, Rafokat raises cattle at her house. She plans to commercialize her crops at a much greater scale, but for this she needs a loan that will allow her to invest in such a project. Let’s contribute to this great effort done by a mother who wants the best for her beloved family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer and young cattle.

loans.name: Adiye

texts.en: Adiye C. is currently in the business of selling and brewing alcohol and is requesting a loan to buy sugar and yeast for brewing. Adiye is 25 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy sugar and yeast for brewing.

loans.name: Maulyne Aketch

texts.en:
Maulyne is 27 years old and married with one child. Before her current business (paper sales), she used to run a small food kiosk in the Kisumu neighbourhood.

She and her husband are on their first loan at Kadet. Her husband had  tried to get a loan from a local commercial bank earlier, but could not meet the requirements. Through her fellow women friends, Maulyne got to know about Kadet and that she could access a loan much more easily. With this loan, Maulyne intends to expand her business by procuring more stock and, eventually, she intends to diversify into a cyber-cafe.

loans.use: To purchase new printing materials including bank papers

loans.name: Zubaida Benedito

texts.pt:
Zubaida Benedito V. de 22 anos nasceu no distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, estudou até décima primeira classe e teve de interromper devido as dificuldades financeiras da família. Casada maritalmente e mãe de um filho de dois anos. 

Zubaida nunca viveu fora de Boane, distrito onde nasceu, mas teve de deixar de viver com os pais quando ficou grávida, passando a viver com o marido, mas como havia aprendido o tratamento de cabelo junto com o marido juntaram algum dinheiro para investimentos de salão de cabeleireiro.

A receita diária varia entre 1,500.00MT – 2,500.00MT, ela trabalha das 8:00 – 18:00hrs e presta de serviços de tratamento de cabelos, pedicure, manicure, entre outros.

Com o empréstimo de 11,000.00MT, pretende comprar produtos diversos para garantir que as clientes encontrem todas as soluções para sua beleza.

No futuro pensa juntar algum dinheiro para adquirir um meio de transporte familiar.
texts.en:
Zubaida Benedito V. is 22 years old and was born in the Boane district of Maputo Province. She studied until tenth grade and had to interrupt her studies on account of her family's financial difficulties. She is married and the mother of a two-year-old child.

Zubaida has never lived outside of Boane, the district where she was born. She moved out of her parents' place and moved in with her husband when she became pregnant. As she and her husband had learned hairdressing together, they put together some money to invest in a hair salon.

Her daily income varies between 1,500 MT (meticais) and 2,500 MT. She works from 8:00am to 6:00pm and provides hair services, pedicures, and manicures, among other services.

With the loan of 11,000 MT, she plans to buy a diversity of products to make sure that her clients find the solutions for all their beauty needs at her salon.

In the future she is planning to put some money together to acquire trasportation for her family.

Translated from Portuguese by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase variety and stock at her beauty salon

loans.name: Sanavbar

texts.en:
K. Sanavbar has been selling a big variety of foodstuff in her grocery store for the past 5 years. She is married and has a son. A true entrepreneur, she studies the market to determine client needs and preferences. Industrious and enterprising, Sanavbar is focused on expanding her business. Presently, she has a monthly income of about $ 200. Sanavbar is currently seeking a loan for $1350 USD. She plans to use the loan to increase her assortment of fresh merchandise and expand her business. With the increased sales and profits, Sanavbar hopes to expand her grocery and improve the living standards of her family.     

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase an increased of range of goods.

loans.name: Pascaline

texts.fr:
S.  Pascaline est née vers les années 1970. Pascaline est mariée à S. Toussaint. Pascaline est mère d’enfants tous scolarisés. Pascaline vit avec sa famille à la zone industrielle d’AKPAKPA, un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Economique  de la République du Bénin. 

Pascaline vend depuis 1995 des beignets faits à base de haricot, de farine de blé et de banane. N’ayant pas suffisamment de moyens financiers, Pascaline achetait une partie du nécessaire dont elle a besoin pour son activité à crédit. Mais depuis que Pascaline a connu ALIDé, elle a cessé d’acheter à crédit ; ce qui lui permet de faire plus de bénéfices sur ses ventes. En effet, Pascaline a eu déjà six prêts de ALIDé ; prêts qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu amener son activité à un stade supérieur. Pascaline sollicite un septième prêt de ALIDé pour renforcer son activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
S. Pascaline was born around 1970. She is married to S. Toussaint and is the mother of several children, all enrolled in school. She lives with her family in the industrial zone Akpakpa, a district of Cotonou, economic capital of the Republic of Bénin.

Since 1995, Pascaline has been selling fritters made out of beans, wheat flour, and bananas. Not having sufficient financial means, Pascaline was buying part of the raw ingredients she needs for her business on credit. However, since Pascaline found out about ALIDé, she has ceased to buy on credit. This has allowed her to make more profit on her sales.

In fact, Pascaline has already received 6 loans from ALIDé, loans which she reimbursed correctly and with which she was able to take her business to a higher level. Pascaline is requesting her 7th loan from ALIDé to further bolster her business so as to better respond to the needs of her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a sack of 50 kg of granulated sugar, 4 sacks of 50 kg of wheat flour, a jerrycan of 25 liters of peanut oil, and 5 sacks of charcoal

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Cette dame exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de tubercules et de céréales, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2004. pour réaliser une plus grande marge bénéficiaire sur ses ventes elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays. Actuellement le stock de marchandise dont elle dispose ne lui permet pas de couvrit les charges du foyer, elle s’adresse alors  WAGES et sollicite son premier crédit pour acheter 30 tas de tubercules, 15 sacs de maïs et 5 sacs d’haricots.
Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants.
texts.en:
This is a woman who earns a living in the commerce of tubers and grains. She has been in this business since 2004. To realize a bigger profit margin on her sales, she supplies herself from inland locations. Currently, her stock of merchandise doesn’t allow her to cover household expenses. She therefore inquired with WAGES and is requesting her first loan to buy 30 piles of tubers, 15 sacks of corn, and 5 sacks of beans. She is married and the mother of three.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grains and tubers

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria R. hails from the island village in the Municipality of Binangonan, Rizal Province in the Philippines. She is a 54-year-old woman and is married to Ricardo, a 56-year-old fish vendor. They are blessed with five children: three sons and two daughters. Their eldest son, Jerry, is 31-years-old and a college graduate working in a factory. The youngest daughter Myla is 26-years-old and a factory worker also.

Gloria is a member of Rizal South Branch of ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines. Since before she entered ASHI, they were already engaged in selling fish and maintain a fish cage (small fishpond). Now on her 3rd loan, she proposes the amount of 15,000 pesos as additional capital for her business: the selling of fish from their own fish cage. They harvest fish from the fish cage and deliver or sell it to the markets.
She is hopeful that her business will grow and will give them profit for its sustainability. With her business, she is looking forward to having bigger savings for their future and also to help her grandchildren in their school expenses and to get away from the cycle of poverty.

loans.use: Additional Capital for Fish Selling and some for Fish Cage.

loans.name: Marília Ivone Simeão

texts.pt:
Marília Ivone Simeão M. de 52 anos nasceu no distrito de Manjacaze, Província de Gaza, estudou até quarta classe. Solteira e mãe de dois filhos maiores todos vão a escola, sustenta um netinho. 

Veio viver em Boane em 2000, tendo antes vivido na cidade de Xai-Xai Província de Gaza com o ex marido. Actualmente vive na casa própria.

Trabalha 15 hrs por dia para suprir as necessidades básicas da família, este é o terceiro empréstimo com a Hluvuku e nunca trabalhou com outra instituição financeira. Com o empréstimo de 13,000.00MT pretende aumentar o stock no seu negocio e esperar que a renda também aumente. 

Sendo única actividade de sobrevivência da família, no futuro pretende reforçar mais a sua capacidade e volume de negocio para poder aguentar a concorrência que cada dia vai crescendo.
texts.en:
Marília Ivone Simeão M. is 52 years old and was born in Manjacaze, in Gaza Province. She studied through fourth grade. She is single and the mother of two young adults who both go to school, in addition to supporting a young grandchild.

She moved to Boane in 2000, previously having lived with her ex-husband in the city of Xai-Xai in Gaza Province. Now she lives in her own home.

Marília works 15 hours a day to meet the basic needs of her family. This is her third loan from Hluvuku (Kiva's Field Partner), and she has never worked with another financial institution. With the loan of 13,000 MT (meticais), she intends to increase the stock at her business and hopes that the profit will increase as well.

Having only this one income-generating activity to support the family, Marília intends in the future to increase the business's capacity and volume in order to withstand the competition that is constantly growing.

Translated from Portuguese by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory in her business

loans.name: Happy Rose

texts.fr:
SEMINGNAN  Happy Rose est née vers les années 1959 à ABOMEY-CALAVI, une Commune du Département de l’ATLANTIQUE.  Happy Rose est mariée à GBETE Paul, un pêcheur. Happy Rose  est mère de quatre (4) enfants tous scolarisés. Happy Rose réside avec sa famille depuis 10 ans  à Xwlacodji, un quartier peuplé de la commune de Cotonou, Capitale Economique  de la République du Bénin. 

Happy Rose vend des chaussures depuis cinq (5) ans à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Happy Rose a eu déjà deux prêts de ALIDé ; prêts qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu amener son activité à un stade supérieur.  Happy Rose sollicite actuellement un troisième prêt de ALIDé pour mieux répondre aux besoins de ses clients.
texts.en:
SEMINGNAN Happy Rose was born around 1959 in ABOMEY-CALAVI, a community in Atlantique County. She is married to GBETE Paul, a fisherman, and is the mother of four children who are all in school. For ten years, Happy Rose has been living with her family in Xwlacodji, a populated district of Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. Happy Rose has been selling shoes for five years at Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin. She has already had two loans with Alidé and has repaid them. She was able to use them to raise her business to a higher level. She’s currently requesting a third loan from Alidé to respond better to customer needs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ten dozen shoes

loans.name: Apolo

texts.en:
Apolo J. is currently in the business of selling beans, rice and tomatoes and is requesting a loan to open up a shop. Apolo is 40 years old and is married with a husband that is a driver. She has 4 children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a shop

loans.name: Bozoma

texts.fr:
Cette femme s’est lancée en 2006 dans le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, très vite elle a réussit à conquérir des clients. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Sa clientèle grandit de jour en jour, voulant les satisfaire convenablement elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 5 cartons de spaghetti, 5 cartons de détergents « OMO », 7 sacs de riz « PATRON », 05 cartons de tomates en boîtes de conserve, 5 bidons d’huiles de palme et divers produits d’alimentation générale.
Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants
texts.en:
This is a woman who got started in the commerce of grocery items in 2006. She soon was successful in winning over her customers. Her merchanidise comes from the grand marketplace of Lomé. Her customer base is growing from day to day. Wanting to satisfy her customers appropriately, she’s requesting a loan from WAGES to buy: five boxes of spaghetti, five boxes of OMO detergents, seven sacks of PATRON rice, five boxes of canned tomates, five drums of palm oil, and various grocery items. She is married and the mother of two.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Zulhayo

texts.en:
Tajik housewives are usually active in helping their husbands in earning income. There are many occupations that were traditionally male dominated are now done by women. K. Zulhayo is an example. She has been farming cattle for the past 3 years. Her earnings even surpassed her husband's who works as a farmer. Her elder son (pictured) helps Zulhayo with the business. So her farm really helps her family's finances tremendously. With a loan from IMON International Zulhayo expects to buy young cattle. She really hopes that she can produce more cows to be sold so she earns more than last year.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy young cattle to raise

loans.name: Hakima

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Хакима  Рахимова в свои 27 лет осталась без мужа. Она вдова. 
    Раньше муж Хакимы занимался животноводством, а она ему в этом помогала. Сейчас она продолжает деятельность мужа и откармливает домашний скот.
Ее корова дает молоко, которое она продает соседям. Из молока изготавливает домашний кефир. 
 Хакима кредитуется в нашей организации впервые, от своих друзей она узнала, что на полученный и использованный  с целью кредит можно увеличить уровень своего дохода. Поэтому Хакима обратилась к нам, у нее не хватает средств чтобы  купить дополнительно дойную корову, для производства и продажи молока и кефира в больших количествах.
Она проживает в Ганчинском районе вместе со своим отцом.
texts.en:
Hakima R. in her 27 years of age is alone without a husband. She is a widow. Her husband used to do animal husbandry and she was helping him. Right now she continues her husband's business and feeds the cattle. The cow gives milk which she sells to the neighbors. She makes buttermilk from it too. Hakima is taking out a loan for the first time, she found out from her friends that she can use the purposely spent loan to increase her income. This is why Hakima has turned to us because she does not have enough means to buy another milk cow to make buttermilk and milk for resale in larger quantities. She lives in the Ganchinsk region together with her father.

MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Agnès

texts.fr:
D.  Agnès est née vers les années 1968 dans la Commune de Cotonou,  Capitale Economique de la République du Bénin. Agnès a pour époux OLOWOLAGBE Antoine.  Agnès est mère de quatre (4) enfants  tous scolarisés et respectivement âgés de 18 ans, 15 ans, 12 ans et 12 ans (jumeaux). Agnès réside à Cotonou au quartier Enagnon, un bidonville depuis plus de 25 ans. 

Depuis cinq (5) ans Agnès est dans le secteur de la restauration. Agnès s’approvisionne en différents produits dont elle a besoin pour la restauration à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin  et en produits de brasserie dans les dépôts de Cotonou. Agnès a eu déjà six prêts de ALIDé ; prêts qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu amener son activité à un stade supérieur.  Pour répondre au mieux aux besoins sa clientèle, Agnès sollicite un septième prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
D. Agnès was born around 1968 in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. She has OLOWOLAGBE Antoine for a husband and is the mother of four children, ages 18, 15, 12, and 12 (twins), who are all in school. For over 25 years, she has been residing in Cotonou in the Enagnon district, a shantytown. For five years, Agnès has been in the restaurant field. She supplies herself with different goods needed for her business from Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin. Her drinks merchandise is gotten from Cotonou outlets. She has already had six loans with Alidé and has repaid them. She was able to use them to raise her business to a higher level. To respond best to customer needs, she’s requesting a seventh loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two 25-liter drums of peanut oil, a 100-kg sack of corn, three 50-kg sacks of rice, a sack each of cassava chips and yam chips, and ten 6-packs of soft drinks.

loans.name: Lucas António

texts.pt:
Lucas António R. de 39 anos nasceu no distrito de Inhassungue, Província de Inhambane, estudou até terceiro ano do ensino técnico e teve de parar por problemas de saúde - vista. Casado maritalmente com um filho menor, sustenta outra criança enteado.

Veio viver em Boane em 1987 e vive em casa própria junto com esposa e dois filhos. Comerciante de profissão e do dono do seu negocio, ainda sem empregados. Vende produtos de primeira necessidade e adquiri os produtos nos armazéns locais, seu rendimento diário varia entre 500.00MT – 2,000.00MT.

É seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku, nunca teve crédito com outras instituições. Com o mesmo pretende aumentar o volume da mercadoria e em simultâneo aumentar sua renda.

Seu sonho é de melhorar as condições do local onde exerce a actividade.
texts.en:
Lucas António R. is 39 years old and was born in the Inhassungue district, Inhambane Province. He studied through the third year of technical school and then had to stop because of problems with his eyesight. Married with one young child, he also raises a stepchild.

Lucas came to live in Boane in 1987 and lives in his own home together with his wife and children. He is a professional merchant and runs his business, without any employees. He sells basic necessities and gets the products from local warehouses. His daily income varies between 500 MT (meticais) and 2,000 MT.

This is Lucas's first loan with Hluvuku (Kiva's Field Partner). He has never had a loan with another institution. With the loan, he intends to increase his volume of merchandise and simultaneously increase his revenue.

Lucas's dream is to improve the conditions of the place where he does business.

Translated from Portuguese by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock in his shop

loans.name: Matchi

texts.fr: Marié et père de 03 enfants, ce monsieur vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d'adidogomé à  Lomé. Afin de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, ce monsieur s’est lancé en 2004 dans le commerce de charbons de bois, étant le seule à exercer cette activité dans son quartier, il vend bien et réalise ainsi des bénéfices considérables sur ses ventes. Son stock actuel ne lui permet pas de bien satisfaire ses clients, pour mieux les satisfaire il veut agrandir son stock. Il sollicite donc de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 25 sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en:
Married and the father of three, this gentleman lives with his family in the Adidogomé district in Lomé. In order to provide for his family, he got started in the commerce of charcoal in 2004 and is the only one in this business in his area. Sales are good, so he is realizing considerable profits. His current stock doesn't allow him to satisfy his customers. To do better in satisfying them, he wants to expand his stock. He's therefore requesting his first loan from WAGES to buy 25 sacks of charcoal.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Sekina

texts.en:
Sekina J. is currently in the business of selling bread and tea and is requesting a loan to open up a resturant. Sekina is 30 years old and is married with a husband that is an accountant. She has 2 children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a resturant

loans.name: Tutiniso

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Тутинисо женшина- 44 лет. Замужем имеет 4-х детей.Она и её муж торговали небольшим ассортиментом запасным запчастей и сантехникой. Теперь они торгуют большим ассортиментом, в этот ассортимент входят : хна, расчески, иглы и различны кремы. Её муж ездит за товаром. Он привозит товар из Уратюбе. В зависимости от продажи муж  ездит за товаром.Тутинисо хочет увеличить свою прибыль для семейного положения: выдать дочь замуж, сделать ремонт.
texts.en:
Tutiniso is a 44 year old woman. She is married and has four children. Together with her husband they used to sell a small assortment of spare parts and plumbing parts. Right now they have a larger assortment which includes henna, hair brushes, needles and lotions. Her husband travels for the merchandise which he brings from Uratube. He travels depending on the sales. Tutiniso wants to increase her profit for their family's livelihood, she wants to make a wedding for her daughter and make renovation at home.

MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina V. is from the village of Bobontugan, Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 37 years old. Lina is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Lina owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Lina is just starting this business.

In 2009, Lina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Lina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 pesos which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the store

loans.name: Antionette

texts.fr:
H.  Antoinette est née le 07 Février 1976 à PORTO- NOVO, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. Antoinette est mariée à GBEMENOU Timothée, un forgeron de profession. Antoinette est mère de quatre (4) enfants dont les noms sont respectivement Carlos, Mémoire, Azaria et Anania.  Seulement deux de ces enfants sont scolarisés. Depuis 10 ans Antoinette réside avec sa famille à Midombo un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Economique  de la République du Bénin. 

Antionette vend des pâtes dentifrices, des brosses à dents et des détergents depuis quatre (4) ans. Antionette achète ses produits à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Mais c’est de façon ambulante que Antionette vend ses articles. Antionette a eu déjà trois prêts de ALIDé et elle a bien remboursé ces prêts. Pour mieux développer son activité et mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Antionette sollicite de ALIDé un quatrième crédit.
texts.en:
H. Antoinette was born on February 7, 1976 in PORTO- NOVO, the administrative and political capital of the Republic of Benin. She is married to GBEMENOU Timothée, a blacksmith by profession, and is the mother of four children, whose names are respectively Carlos, Mémoire, Azaria, and Anania. Just two of the children are in school. For ten years, Antoinette has been residing with her family in Midombo, a district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Antionette has been selling toothpaste, toothbrushes, and detergents for four years. She makes her purchases at Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin. But she sells her goods door-to-door. She has already had three Alidé loans and has repaid them. To improve her business and to respond better to customer demand, she's requesting a fourth loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 4 dozen tubes of toothpaste, 8 dozen toothbrushes, and 4 boxes of detergents

loans.name: Bahriddin

texts.en:
Bahriddin is a responsible father of 5 children. From the time he was a boy, he learned the honorable work of raising livestock, activities which were passed down from his parents and which today bring him satisfaction. Thanks to his valuable knowledge of the livestock trade, he has been able to obtain good results from his sales. This enterprising gentleman’s wish is to invest more capital in young animals. Bahriddin hopes to continue his dedication to his work, believing that by improving his stock and feed, his cattle will bring better prices. For this reason, he is turning to you for the support that would permit him to continue developing his business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle to raise

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia A. sells provisions in her retail store to her customers. She is married with two children and she is 41 years old.

Felicia is requesting the loan of N150,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en: Isabel L. is from the village of Bobontugan, Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 48 years old, widowed, and has three adult children. Isabel is just starting a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. In 2009, Isabel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gulom

texts.en: Since 2004, K. Gulom has been a livestock farmer. He breeds calves, cows and sheep. He is married and has three children whom he needs to support and give a proper education. Gulom has improved his financial situation because his father is also a cattle breeder and, from childhood, Gulom has gained a rich experience in the livestock business. Nowadays, his biggest dream is to expand his business and to also offer animal derivates (such as dairy products) in the surroundings of his community. Therefore, his biggest need is to get a loan in order to buy more cows. Gulom is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to improve his living. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.
