loans.name: Atoma

texts.en:
Atoma A. is currently in the business of selling fruit at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more fruit to sell. Atoma is twenty-eight years old and married. Her husband is a security guard. She has two school-age children. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a machine for crushing fruits into juices.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more fruit to sell

loans.name: Askar

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Сатторов Аскар -мужчина 1977 года рождения,женатб имеет двоих детей.Около шести лет Аскар вместе со своей женой торгует на колхозном рынке Джаббор-Расуловского района продуктами питания.Два раза в неделю он приезжает в город Худжанд за товаром. Самыми ходовыми товарами в настоящий момент являются сахар-песок и макаронные изделия.Так как начался сезон фруктов все хозяйки заготавливаются на зиму кампотами и вареньем.Кроме того идёт сезон полевых работ и многие жители переезжают на свои земельные участки.Чтобы каждый раз не ездить на рынок они запасаются продуктами питания,в том числе макаронами.Поэтому на полученный займ Аскар решил закупить сахар-песок и макароны.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Askar S. is a man who was born in 1977, is married and has two children. For about six years Askar with his wife have been selling food on the farmer market in the Djaboor-Rasulov region. He travels to the town of Khujand for the goods twice a week. The goods that sell well at this time is sugar and pastas. The season for fruits has begun and the women are getting ready and stocking up for the winter for jams and compotes. Besides that it is the season when farmers work on the land and many residents have relocated to their farms. They stock up with food such as pasta so that they don't have to travel to the markets too often. This is why Askar decided to use the loan to buy sugar and pasta.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy six bags of sugar and three bags of pasta

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: La Sra. Felipa A. empezó a trabajar con crédito en Emprender el año 2002 con el grupo Gladiolos en seis secuencias, luego descanso un buen tiempo, retornando el año 2006 con credito individual, ella vive en la zona de Rosales, su esposa tiene una panaderia, viven en casa propia, tienen hijos mayores que se sustentan a si mismos , solo un hijo pequeño que todavía mantienen,la señora se encuentra en su cuarto crédito individual, no tiene deudas en otros bancos, trabaja en la venta de verduras desde hace 24 años, es buena cliente.
texts.en:
Felipa A. started to work with a loan from Emprender in 2002. She worked for six loan cycles with the Gladiolos Group. Then she rested for a good while, and she returned in 2006 with an individual loan. She lives in the Rosales zone. Her husband has a bakery. They live in their own house. They have grown children who take care of themselves. They only have one small son who they still take care of. This is her fourth individual loan. She does not have debts in other banks. She has sold vegetables for 24 years. She is a good client.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en: Ngozi is 29 years old and is married with four children. She sells provisions and foodstuffs, and is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more products to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Arminda

texts.en: Mrs Arminda M. F. is a long-time client of Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya. She runs a hair salon where she is hard-working and gives each customer personalized attention. Arminda also provides manicure and pedicure services and sells dyes and cleaning products from her business. Her main customers form a well-established clientele which she has had for many years, but she has casual clients as well. With this job and help from her parents, Arminda has been able to buy a house as well as fund her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase tools and articles for her hair salon

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine E. is 55 years old and is married with six children. He sells cosmetics in his shop in Asaba, Delta State. Justine is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more cosmetics to sell. He sends his thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Rodrigo Andres

texts.es: Cliente joven, que logró comprar un minibus con la ayuda de sus padres mismo que le sirve como  herramienta de trabajo ya que pertenece al sindicato Litoral de  transporte público,  Con los ingresos que el percibe por dicha actividad paga sus estudios y ayudar con la manutencion de su casa y tambien aporta  para los gastos de  la ampliación de su vivienda. El dinero le servirá para hacer el cambio de su herramienta por otro mas moderno ya que el que actualmente tiene piensa venderlo.
texts.en:
With the help of his parents, this young client was able to buy a mini bus. This serves as his working tool; he belongs to the Litoral public transportation union. With his earnings from this work he pays for his studies, helps with the maintenance on his house, and also contributes to the expansion of his home. The money will be used to change his tool for another more modern one since he is currently thinking of selling it.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovation of his vehicle

loans.name: Ikodu

texts.en:

Ikodu is currently in the business of selling used sandles and shoes, and is now requesting a loan to purchase clothes to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to buy a sewing machine for clothes decoration.

About BRAC

texts.en: Esther D. is 63 years old and is married with eight children. She sells native sarongs in the traditional cloth of the people of Asaba in Delta State, Nigeria. She is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more native sarongs to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more native sarongs to sell

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian H. is from the village of Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 43 years old, and married with six school-aged children. To make a living, Vivian owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and selling bananas, corn and vegetables. She also sells copra product from her coconut farm. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling agricultural crops such as copra, bananas, corn and vegetables to her local community. Vivian has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Vivian joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vivian has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to to purchase farm pesticides. Vivian is now requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used as additional working capital. This loan will be her third from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nkechi

texts.en:
Nkechi E. sells sarongs of various colors. She is married with four children and she is 34 years old.

Nkechi hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Juliann

texts.en: Juliann O. is married, 32 years old and has five children. She sells sarongs, a business she loves because she makes a lot of sales. Juliann has applied for this loan to buy more sarongs to sell, and wants to offer her thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Tembiapora Group

texts.en:
The Committee Tembiapora (which means “good work” in Guaraní) has worked with the Fundación Paraguaya for three years and has 17 participants. Its leader, Mrs. Beatriz B., owns a small convenience store that she started six months ago with the help of her husband. She sells candy, juices, sodas and cold foods, makes a steady income and hopes to expand her small business. Her commitment to success is shared by the other members of her loan group:
1	Beatriz B. --	Food sales 
2	Pabla P. --	General store 
3	Teodora G. --	Dressmaker 
4	Irma P. --	Hair salon 
5	Cinthia S. --	Teacher 
6	Jorgelina G. --	Cleaning product sales 
7	 Andrea B. --	Domestic employee 
8	Rosa V. --	Interior Decorator 
9	Elida C. --	Clothing sales 
10	Mirian M. --	Dressmaker 
11	Guillermina M. --	Clothing sales

13	Verena B. --	Cleaning product sales 
14	Silvia A. --	Hair salon 
15	Silvia M. --	Cosmetic sales 
16	Atanacia B. --	Food sales 
17	Maximiana B. --	Food sales

loans.use: The buy more merchandise and raw materials.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella makes a living selling items for babies, such as clothes, diapers and nappies. She is 32 years old, married and has four children. Stella has applied for this loan to buy more items to sell to her customers, and extends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more baby items to sell

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: Anthony makes a living selling bags of cement and various kinds of building materials. He is married and 30 years old. Anthony has applied for this loan to buy more bags of cement to sell to his customers, and wishes to extend his thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cement to sell to his customers

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en:
Bernardo B. lives in the village of Tuburan, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 42 years old, married and has five school-aged children. Bernardo makes a living as a gold miner. While this is not his sole means of support, selling gold dust to members of his community generates most of his income. Bernardo has been in this line of work for five years.

Last year, Bernardo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services, improve his living conditions and increase his ability to engage in business activities. Bernardo has successfully repaid two previous loans from HSPFI, and is applying for this new one to buy school paraphernalia for his children and to pay other educational expenses. We know he is determined to work hard and join with others to lift his family from poverty.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy school items for his children

location.town: Tuburan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Pierrette

texts.fr:
A.  Pierrette est âgée de 38 ans.  Pierrette est née à Ekpè dans la Commune de SEME-KPODJI. Pierrette  est mariée à KISITO AHOUANSOU. Depuis huit (8) ans Pierrette réside avec sa famille à xwlacodji kpodji, un bidonville de la ville de Cotonou, Capitale Economique  de la République du Bénin. Pierrette est mère de trois (3) enfants dont un est décédé ; les deux autres sont âgés respectivement de 7 ans et de 5 ans et ils sont tous au cours élémentaire.

 Pierrette est couturière de formation mais depuis cinq (5) ans elle vend en plus des produits vivriers dans son atelier de couture. Pierrette s’approvisionne  en produits vivriers à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Pierrette a eu déjà sept prêts de ALIDé ; prêts qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu amener son activité à un stade supérieur.  Pour répondre de mieux en mieux aux besoins sa clientèle, Pierrette sollicite un huitième prêt de ALIDé afin d’augmenter le volume de ses produits vivriers.
texts.en:
A. Pierrette, age 38, was born in Ekpè in the community of SEME-KPODJI and is married to KISITO AHOUANSOU. For eight years, Pierrette has been living with her family in Xwlacodji Kpodji, a shantytown of the city of Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. She is the mother of three children, one of whom died; the other two are ages 7 and 5, and they are both in elementary school. For five years, Pierrette has been a trained seamstress. In addition, she sells staple foods in her workshop. Her supplies of staple foods come from Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin. She has already had seven loans with Alidé and has repaid them. She was able to use them to raise her business to a higher level. To respond better and better to customer needs, she's requesting an 8th loan from Alidé in order to increase her volume of staple goods.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy five 100-kg sacks of corn and two sacks each of cassava and yam chips.

loans.name: Milicent

texts.en: Milient is a 26-year-old married mother of two school-aged children. She lives with her family in Likoni Mombasa. Her husband works with a filling station. She is the proprietor of two enterprises: one dealing with sale of cosmetic items, initiated in 2007, and the other being sale of clothing materials. She gets her merchandise, to sell, both within Mombasa town and, at times, travel to Kampala Uganda. She deals in fast-selling items which are well-liked by her customers. She has applied for US$ 550 to help her to get more supplies (especially clothing materials) from Kampala Uganda.

loans.use: To buy stock of clothing materials.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita A. sells provisions and bottles of wines in retail. She is married, has 2 children and she is 35 years old. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN100, 000 to purchase more provisions and bottles of wine to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and bottles of wine to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph M. is a farmer and he has a cassava farm. He is married, has 5 children and he is 52 years old. He hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN100,000 to purchase more cassava stems to plant. He says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava stems to plant.

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Carmen Lopéz formed this committee. The group is made up of 17 participants. One participant is Mrs. Ninfa C. who is 27 years old and has one son that stays with his grandmother while his mother works selling medicinal remedies in the Lambare zone. She purchases her merchandise in Market 4 in Asunción and then sells it in order to gain a profit to pay her living expenses. She has a small house made of pieces of wood and cardboard.

1 Carmen Lopéz de T.- Cleaning product sales 2 Ninfa E. C. M.- Medicine sales 3 Lorena M.D..- Food sales 4 Blanca L.I. C.- Used clothing sales 5 Sirley F. C. C.- Cleaning product sales 6 Gloria R.M. deC. - Cleaning product sales 7 Miguela S. R.- Empanada sales 8 Gladis G. Aranda de L.- Fruit sales 9 Felicia R. D..- Clothing sales 10 Alberta B. P - Recycling 11 Margarita V. L.- Beverage sales 12 Cirila R. de L.- Smalll grocery sales 13 Teresa D. R. P.- Food sales 14 Maria Z. C..- Lottery ticket sales 15 Lourdes P. G. S.- Dressmaker 16 Maria C. S. E.- Dressmaker 17 Lidia C..- Jewelry and accessories sales

loans.use: To buy cleaning products for resale

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en: Mildred N. was born in 1988 and married while still quite young to a man who works as a mechanic in Likoni, Mombasa. They are blessed with one school-age child. N. went into business last year as supplier of industrial chemicals used in making detergents such as soap. She has applied for a loan for $600 to improver her business.

loans.use: To buy more industrial detergents.

loans.name: Francoise

texts.fr: S.  Françoise est née le 10/03/1962 à N’guigmi  au NIGER, un pays frontalier au Bénin. Françoise  est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Françoise  réside avec sa famille à Irédé à AKPAKPA un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Economique  de la République du Bénin. Françoise vend des fournitures de bureau et des fournitures scolaires ainsi que des produits de beauté et des cartes de recharge téléphonique depuis six (06) ans dans sa boutique située à Scoa Gbéto, un quartier populaire de Cotonou. Françoise grâce aux revenus de son activité, vient en aide à son mari dans les charges familiales. Françoise a eu déjà un prêt de ALIDé et elle a bien remboursé ce prêt. Pour mieux développer son activité et mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Françoise  sollicite de ALIDé un second crédit.
texts.en:
S. Françoise was born on March 10, 1962 in N’guigmi in NIGER, a country bordering Benin. She is married and the mother of three. She lives with her family in Irédé in AKPAKPA, a district of Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. For six years, Françoise has been selling office and school supplies, as well as beauty products and mobile phone recharge cards, in her shop located in Scoa Gbéto, a working-class district of Cotonou. Thanks to the revenues from her business, she helps her husband to cover family expenses. She has already had a loan with Alidé and has repaid it. To improve her business and to respond better to customer demand, she's requesting a second loan with Alidé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy office and school supplies, and beauty products and phone cards

loans.name: Gelien

texts.en:
Gelien D. lives in the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 19 years old, married and makes a living selling fish in a stall in the local market. This is not her only source of income, but most of the money she makes comes in this way. The business is new but off to a good start.

In 2009, Gelien joined HSPFI in order to gain access to financial services, help improve her life and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Gelien is requesting this loan, her first, to expand her business and better support her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand her business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es: La Sra. Benedicta C., se dedica actualmente a la venta de estuco, también tiene una pequeña tienda, pero se dedica más a la venta de estuco, ella trabajo el año 2007 con dos secuencias de crédito, luego descanso un tiempo y retornó solicitando dos mil bolivianos para compra de estuco y para compra de semilla, ya que al margen de sus actividades ella posee tierras de cultivo en Palca, poblado cercano a la ciudad de La Paz, donde siembran productos alimenticios como verduras. Ella tiene tres hijos en edad escolar, el esposo es albañil, tiene domicilio en alquiler, aunque tiene terrenos de su propiedad pero sin edificaciones, ella es una persona responsable y de buena actitud.
texts.en:
Sra. Benedicta C. operates a business selling supplies of stucco. She also owns a small store, but she spends more time working at stucco sales. She worked in 2007 with two consecutive loans, took some time off, then came back with a request for two thousand bolivianos to buy both stucco and seeds. In addition to her other businesses, she owns farmland in Palca, a town near the city of La Paz, where she grows food crops such as vegetables. Benedicta has three school-aged children and her husband is a construction worker. She has a rented house and land, without buildings, that she owns. She is a responsible person with a great attitude.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy stucco for construction supplies business.

loans.name: Eucharis

texts.en: Eucharis O. makes a living selling provisions and foodstuffs. She is married, 35 years old and has three children. She has applied for this loan to buy more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. Eucharis wishes to extend her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuffs to sell to her customers

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella D. is 25 years old and single. She lives alone in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in Ghana's Western Region, where she makes a living as a professional hair dresser in a shop located alongside a road. She has some apprentices who are currently being trained, and buys materials such as artificial hair, shampoo, pomade, lotion and other items from the town of Kumasi. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy supplies in bulk so that she can provide quality service to her cherished clients. Sarah hopes that this will allow her to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a beauty salon

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.en:
Mrs. Hilaria G. is single and lives in her own home with her two daughters, one of whom works in Spain. This daughter also helps support the family.

Mrs. G. has a business in one of the busiest markets in downtown Asunción, and has applied for a loan to buy more items to sell -- fruits, vegetables sweets and medicine. She also sells traditional teas which are grown locally, honey and cheese. Mrs.G. starts work in the early hours of the morning (at around 4:00 a.m.), when she goes out to buy the items she needs to run her business. One of her biggest goals is to be able to expand her business and open a store in which she can offer a more comfortable and enjoyable environment for her clients.

loans.use: The buy fruits, vegetables, cheese, honey and sweets to sell to her customers

loans.name: Léonie

texts.fr:
A. Léonie a 52 ans. Léonie est mariée et mère de trois filles toutes scolarisées. Léonie et sa famille résident depuis cinq (5) ans à  Akpakpa  PK10, un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Economique  de la République du Bénin. Depuis 10 ans Léonie est dans le secteur de la production et de la distribution d’eau de pompe en sachet de 50 millilitre, localement appelée pure water. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Léonie distribue ses produits aux semi-grossistes. 

Les sachets d’emballage que Léonie utilise pour son activité, elle va les acheter au Nigeria un pays voisin du Bénin. Léonie a déjà  bénéficié de prêts de ALIDé. Et Léonie a toujours respecté ses engagements de remboursement de prêt. Pour satisfaire au mieux sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Léonie sollicite actuellement un nouveau crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Léonie is 52 years old. She is married and the mother of three girls who are all in school. She and her family have been living for five years in Akpakpa PK10, a district of Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. For ten years, Léonie has been in the field of producing and distributing pump water in 50-milliliter bags, locally called "Pure Water". Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin, is where she distributes her products to semi-wholesalers. The bags as packaging, which Léonie uses for her business, are gotten from Nigeria, a country bordering Benin. She has already benefited from Alidé loans. And she has always honored her commitments for repaying loans. To do better in satisfying her burgeoning customer base, she's now requesting a new loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic bags for packing water

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort N. is 28 years old. She is married and has given birth to two girls who are currently in primary school. She lives with her two daughters and husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase, which is in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, which is the district capital. She is a food vendor. Comfort prepares and sells rice and stew. She sells from a tabletop by the side of the road. She sells in the mornings. Comfort wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk. She buys her goods from Kumasi. She has been in business for five years. Comfort aspires to expand her business and provide her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Lucia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Niño Jesús de Praga” ubicado en el distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chuchito, Departamento de Puno, tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y  madre de 05 hijos todos a su cargo, posee estudios de primaria completa y vive en el Barrio Santa Bárbara.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 10 años, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual lo utilizo en el negocio de venta de comida (ceviche). 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 2,200.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su actual negocio de venta de comida (ceviche), ella comprara los insumos para la preparación del ceviche como son pescado, verduras, camote, limón y otros. Lucia vende todos los días en el mercado de Yunguyo.

Su deseo es ver profesionales a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan las reuniones, los encuentros, la forma del préstamo y las charlas de su banco comunal.
texts.en:
Sra. Lucia belongs to the Nino Jesus de Praga ["Baby Jesus of Prague"] community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Puno. She is 43 years old, married and the mother of 5 children, all still living at home. She finished elementary school and lives in the Santa Barbara neighborhood.

Lucia has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for 10 years, beginning with a S/.300 [300 new soles] loan which she used for her ceviche sales business. She now needs a S/.2,200 loan to invest in the same business. She will buy supplies for making ceviche such as fish, vegetables, sweet potatoes, lemons and so on. She goes to the market in Yunguyo every day to sell.

Lucia's greatest hope is to see her children settled in professional careers

Lucia enjoys her community bank's meetings and get-togethers, the way it grants loans and chatting with the other bank members.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for catering business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret Y. is 46 years old. She is a divorced mother of two children: a son and daughter. Both of her children are still in school.  They are in senior and junior high schools, respectively. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, in the Western Region of Ghana. She is a seamstress by profession. Margaret designs and sews for clients and also for sale. She has a workshop by the roadside in her community. She says she has some apprentices under training. Margaret has been in business for over 25 years and wants a loan to buy textile materials and other sewing accessories. She desires to expand her business and give her children the best of education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy textile materials

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie S. is from the village of Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 40 years old. Rosie is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosie owns and operates a business venture in which she retails charcoal and firewood. The main source of revenue for the business is selling charcoal and bundles of firewood to the local community, however this is not the only source of income. Rosie has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month for these activities. 

In 2009, Rosie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services so as to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used for additional working capital. Rosie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more firewood and charcoal to retail. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rosie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional income generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood and charcoal to sell

location.town: Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La señora Hilda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Semillas del Futuro”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Puno, Provincia D.  Puno, Departamento D. Puno, tiene 45 años D. edad, es casada y madre D. 3 hijos, posee estudios D. primaria completa y vive en el Barrio San Martín.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 5 años, con un préstamo inicial D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, para su negocio D. compra y venta D. frutas. 

Actualmente solicita un préstamo D. S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su actual negocio y así poder comprar frutas como: plátanos, naranjas, mandarina, manzanas y otras.

Su deseo es seguir trabajando y darles una educación a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan las reuniones y las charlas que se dan en su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Sra. Hilda belongs to the Semillas del Futuro ["Seeds of the Future"] community bank in the Peruvian "departmento" of Puno. She is 45 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. She finished elementary school and lives in the San Martin neighborhood. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for 5 years, starting with a S/.300 [300 new soles] loan for her business buying and selling fruit. She is now applying for a S/.500 loan to invest in the same business so that she can buy fruits such as platanos, oranges, tangerines, apples, etc. Hilda's greatest hopes are to go on working and to give her children good educations. She likes the community bank meetings and discussing bank matters with the other members.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en: Mavis F. is 26 years old. She is married and has given birth to two children: a son and a daughter. Both of her children are currently in primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, which is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Mavis is a trader who sells ice water. She sells at the lorry station in her community. She buys sachets of water from the distributers who come in vans to sell at wholesale prices. Mavis has been in this business for four years and wants a loan to buy sachets of water on larger scale. She desires to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy sachets of water

loans.name: Joana

texts.en: Joana F. is 35 years old. She is not married but has given birth to three children: one girl and two boys.  Her children are in junior high and primary school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana. Joana is a trader who deals in utensils. She buys her goods from Kumasi at affordable prices and sells at the market square in her community. She treks to other markets to sell as well. She also deals in textile materials. Joana has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and take good care of her children.

loans.use: To buy utensils

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa O. is twenty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to two children: one girl and one boy who are both in the primary school at the moment. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana.

Theresa’s husband is a farmer while she is a trader. She trades in utensils. She buys her goods – sets of utensils from Kumasi – at affordable prices and sells at the market square in her community. She hawks (sells door-to-door) and treks to other markets to sell as well.

Theresa has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy utensils in bulk

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida D. is from the village of Taglimao, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 52 years old, married, and has five adult children. Nida owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She also has a piece of land were she raises bananas. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Nida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as additional working capital. Nida is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business and also used for her small farm. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business and for farming

location.town: Taglimao, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
La señora Marleny, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Señor de Los Milagros” ubicado en la Comunidad de Imicati, distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, tiene 26 años de edad, es casada y madre de 01 hijo, posee estudios de primaria incompleta (3er. grado) y vive en el centro poblado de Imicati Sector Caracotani.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 7 años, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cuál fue invertido en su negocio de compra y venta de tarwi. 

Actualmente solicita un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su negocio de compra y venta de tarwi.

Su deseo es poder dedicarse a la elaboración de yogurt.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y la facilidad en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Sra. Marleny belongs to the Senor de Los Milagros ["Lord of Miracles"] community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Puno. She is 26 years old, married and the mother of 1 son. She left school after the third grade and lives in the town of Imicati.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for 7 years, starting with an initial loan of S/.300 [300 new soles] which was invested in buying and selling tarwi [a grain crop cultivated in the Andes]. She's applying for a loan of S/.500 now so that she can invest in the same business.

Marleny hopes to one day set up a yogurt manufacturing business.

When we asked what she likes, she answered savings and being able to borrow easily.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret M. is fifty years old, widowed, and has given birth to four children: a daughter and three sons. Some are currently in the senior high while others are in the tertiary institutions and the junior high schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region.

Margaret is a trader, trading in cereals such as maize, beans, millet, etc. She buys her goods from nearby communities at affordable prices and sells at the market square in her community. She supplies to food vendors and retailers. Margaret also treks to other markets to sell. She has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. Margaret aspires to expand her business and to sponsor all her children in school to the apex.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. is thirty-five years old, married, and has given birth to two children: a boy and a girl. They are currently in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Her husband is a farmer.

Ama trades in vegetables. She sells vegetables such as onions, garden eggs (eggplant), pepper, tomatoes, etc. on a table at the market square. She buys her goods from nearby farming communities and in Kumasi. She treks to other markets to sell as well.

Ama has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha O. is thirty-eight years old, divorced, and has given birth to two children: one girl and one boy who are both in school – junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana.

Agatha is a trader. She trades in jewelry such as earrings, necklaces, chains, rings, etc. She buys her goods from Kumasi at affordable prices and sells at the market square in her community. She hawks (sells door-to-door) and treks to other markets to sell as well.

Agatha has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy jewelry in bulk

loans.name: Daria

texts.es:
La señora Daría, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Señor de Los Milagros”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Imicati, distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, posee estudios de educación primaria completa, y vive en la Parcialidad de Unumani.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi medio año, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, para aumentar el capital de su negocio de compra y venta de productos de la zona. 

Actualmente solicita un préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su negocio, comprando papa, ocas, quinua, cañihua, etc. Ya que están en plena cosecha en las comunidades de la zona.

Su mayor sueño es seguir trabajando para poder alimentar y educar a sus hijos menores.

A ella le gustan los ahorros, y las charlas de su banco comunal.
texts.en:
Sra. Daria belongs to the Senor de Los Milagros ["Lord of Miracles"] community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Puno. She is 30 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. She finished elementary school and now lives in Unumani.

Daria has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for almost half a year. She started with a first loan of S/.500 [500 new soles] for her business buying and selling local products. She's now applying for an S/.800 loan so that she can further invest in the business by buying potatoes and other local products such as quinoa and canihua. It's the harvest season in Peru and now is the time to buy.

Daria's greatest hope is to continue working so that she can feed and educate her young children.

When asked what she most likes, she answered savings and discussions with other community bank members.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy B. is the mother of three children, all daughters, who are all currently in the primary school. She is thirty years old and married. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband works with a local sawmill firm while she is a food vendor.

Mercy fries doughnuts in her community. She supplies to other retailers and sells the rest by hawking (selling door-to-door). Mercy buys bags of flour from nearby towns. She has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients, such as cooking oil, in bulk. She desires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys G. is the mother of two children, both boys, who are currently in the senior high and the primary schools. She is thirty-six years old and divorced. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana.

Gladys is a food vendor. She fries and sells doughnuts in her community. She supplies other retailers and sells the rest by hawking (selling door-to-door). She buys bags of flour from nearby towns.

Gladys has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients such as cooking oil, sugar, etc. in bulk. She desires to expand her business and to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is married and has four dependents. She did not receive any formal education. Her husband is a casual worker with Ghana Education Service.

Mary is a food vendor who operates a chop bar in Ekuase (locally, "chop" means "eat", so a "chop bar" is a place where you go to eat). Mary sells banku (a food made out of fermented corn cassava dough), fufu (pounded boiled cassava with boiled plantain) and boiled beans and fried ripe plantain, which she has done since 1997.

Mary uses all her income to assist her husband in the housekeeping and other financial commitments. Mary will use the loan to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and resell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and resell

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita Q. is 28 years old. She is a married mother of two children, a son and daughter. Both of her children are still in primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Rita’s husband is a professional teacher while she is a seamstress by profession. Rita designs and sews for clients and also for sale. She has a workshop by the roadside in her community. She says she has three apprentices under training. 

Rita has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to buy textile materials and other sewing accessories in bulk. She desires to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy textile materials

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina A. is twenty-five years old, married, and has given birth to two children, girls, who are both in the primary school at the moment. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region.

Faustina is a professional hairdresser. She has some apprentices who are currently under training. Her shop is located by the roadside. She buys her working materials such as artificial hair, shampoo, pomade, cream, lotion, etc. from Kumasi.

Faustina has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy supplies in bulk to be able to render quality services to her cherished clients. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy artificial hair and other supplies in bulk

loans.name: Jena Mae

texts.en: Jena Mae E. is from the village of Bulihon, Misamis Oriental. She is 33 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Jena Mae owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, primarily selling a variety of products like pre-packaged snack foods, noodles, chicken eggs and daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Jena Mae joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Jena Mae is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Rebeca Noemi

texts.es: La señora Rebeca se dedica a la venta de flores en el mercado Rodriguez, un mercado muy conocido en la ciudad, ella sale desde muy temprano, vendiendo una variedad de flores como claveles, rosas, retamas, margaritas. Vive en la casa de sus suegros con su esposo y su pequeño hijo, su esposo le ayuda con los gastos de la casa trabajando como chofer asalariado. Ambos se colaboran mutuamente ya que son un matrimonio joven. El crédito será invetido en la compra de mas variedad de flores para el puesto.
texts.en:
Sra. Rebeca operates a business selling flowers in the Rodriguez market, a market well known in the city. She heads out early to sell a variety of flower types, carnations, roses, Spanish broom and daisies. She lives with her husband and young son in the house of her parents-in-law. Her husband works as salaried driver and helps with the family's expenses. She and her husband help one another because they're a young couple. The loan will be used to buy flowers to resell.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en:
Mavis A. is thirty years old and the married mother of three children – all sons. She says they are all in the primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town in the Western region called Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso. Mavis is a hardworking woman. She works to support her husband financially. Her husband is a farmer while she trades.

Mavis sells drinks made form Milo (a milk beverage) and other provisions. She hawks (sells door-to-door) to sell the iced cocoa drinks with bread in her community and also treks to other markets to sell. Mavis buys groceries such as Milo, sugar, milk, etc. to make the beverage.

Mavis has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy more provisions to expand her business. She is hopeful to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fish and provisions for resale to expand her business

loans.name: María Reinalda

texts.es: María Reinalda E. reside en Ciudad Delgado junto a su esposo, un nieto y su yerno. Ella posee una venta de granos básicos, como arroz, frijoles y azúcar; así también comercializa otro tipo de productos perecederos y jabón para la ropa. María posee su negocio en el mercado de Ciudad Delgado desde ya hace muchos años, y solicita un préstamo ya que desea poder comprar al mayoreo todos sus productos, debido a que percibe muy buenas ventas, desea aumentar sus productos para incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
María Reinalda E. lives in Ciudad Delgado with her husband, a grandson, and her son-in-law. She sells basic grains like rice, beans, and sugar. She also sells other kinds of perishable products and clothing detergent. María's business has been located in the market in Ciudad Delgado for many years. She is requesting a loan because she wants to be able to buy her products wholesale. Since she thinks she can make good sales, she hopes to increase her merchandise to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products wholesale

location.town: Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San  Salvador

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora Maria Magdalena, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Señor D. Los Milagros” ubicado en la Comunidad D. Imicati, distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno. Tiene 70 años D. edad, es viuda y madre D. 04 hijos, no tiene estudios y vive en la comunidad D. Imicati.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace muchos años, estuvo trabajando en otro Banco Comunal, luego se cambio para el Banco Comunal Señor D. los Milagros con un préstamo inicial D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, tiene su negocio D. venta D. productos D. la zona.

Actualmente solicita un préstamo D. S/. 700.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su negocio comprando variedad D. productos que se producen en la zona como: papa, quinua, habas, ocas, etc.

Su mayor sueño es seguir trabajando.

A ella le gustan las facilidades D. los préstamos.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Magdalena belongs to the communal bank, "Señor D. los Milagros," which is located in the community of Imicati, in the district of Yunguyo, in the province of Chucuito, in the department of Puno. She is 70, a widow, and the mother of 4 children. She didn't go to school and lives in the community of Imicati. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for many years. She used to work with another communal bank and later switched to "Señor D. los Milagros" with an initial loan of 300 PEN. She has her business in the area. Currently she is requesting a loan of 700 PEN to be able to invest in her business and to purchase a variety of products that are produced in the area like potatoes, quinoa, beans, geese, etc. Her biggest dream is to keep working. She is pleased with the ease of receiving a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, quinoa, beans, geese, and other products from the area

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva E. is from the village of Bulihon, Misamis Oriental. She is 32 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Eva owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, primarily selling biscuits (cookies), chicken eggs and daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Eva joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as additional working capital for her variety store. Eva is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace B. is thirty years old and married with two sons who are in junior high school and primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband works for a sawmill firm in the area, while she is a trader. Grace trades in textiles such as printed fabrics, linings and other materials as well as school uniforms and other clothing. She sells in a shop located by the roadside in her community. Grace buys her goods from Accra and Kumasi. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy textiles in bulk. Grace desires to expand her business and to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy textiles in bulk

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita L. de 41 años, reside en La Libertad junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. Ella posee una pequeña tienda en su propio lugar de habitación. Margarita solicita un préstamo, ya que ella quiere incrementar todos los productos de su tienda, debido a que ella desea percibir más ganancias para contribuir a su hogar. Entre los productos que desea comprar están: embutidos, golosinas, jugos, y otros más, ya que estos son los que más demanda perciben de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Margarita L. is 41 and lives in La Libertad with her husband and 2 children. She has a small store in her home. Margarita is requesting a loan because she wants to increase her merchandise. She thinks she can earn more income to contribute to her home. Among the products she would like to buy are: sausages, candy, and juices. These are the products that are most in demand by her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more products for her business

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort A. is a married mother of three children, two sons and one daughter, who are all currently in school – junior high and the primary schools. She is thirty-five years old. Comfort lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband is a commercial driver. Comfort is a baker in her community, supplying bread to retailers and beverage sellers, and she also hawks to sell. She buys bags of flour from nearby towns. She has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk. Comfort desires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy flour and other ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Christina Q. is a widow and has three children. She did not receive any formal education. Christina sells fabrics in Ekuase, including lining, African-made batiks and tie-dye. She has been in this business since 1992. Christina is in financial difficulties because she is solely responsible for her finances, both for her own expenses and for the children. Christina will use the loan to purchase more fabrics to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Christina plans to re-invest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fabrics to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La señora Vilma, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Señor de Los Milagros” ubicado en la Comunidad de Imicati, distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno. Tiene 22 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 02 hijos, posee estudios de secundaria completa y vive en el Barrio José Carlos Mariategui.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 1 año, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, para su negocio de compra y venta de ropa.

Actualmente solicita un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, el cuál lo utilizará en su negocio, comprando mayor cantidad de ropa por docena, logrando así poder tener más clientes y obtener más ganancias.

Su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando para poder darles una buena alimentación y educación a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los encuentros y las charlas que se dan en su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Señora Vilma belongs to the communal bank, "Señor de los Milagros," which is located in the community of Imicati, in the district of Yunguyo, in the province of Chucuito, in the department of Puno. She is 22, is married by common law, and is the mother of 2 children. She studied through secondary school. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 1 year and used her initial loan of 500 PEN for her business of buying and selling clothing. Currently she is requesting a loan of 1000 PEN, which she will use to buy a larger quantity of clothing items by the dozen. She will then be able to have more clients and to receive more profits. Her biggest dream is to continue working to be able to give her children a good education and good nutrition. She likes the meetings and chats that she has at her communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase items of clothing by the dozen

loans.name: María Santos

texts.es: María Santos A. D. M. D. 47 años D. edad resiD. en La Libertad, vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos menores D. edad. Ella posee una venta D. CD´s, DVD´s, juguetes, ropa entre otros productos más los cuales los comercializa en la afueras D. una escuela, donD. venD. la mayoría D. sus productos con los estudiantes D. ese lugar. María solícita un préstamo ya que desea comprar más productos para el negocio, ella desea aumentar sus ventas debido a que este es la única entrada económica que posee ya que su esposo trabaja junto a ella.
texts.en:
María Santos A. D. M. is 47 years old. She lives in La Libertad with her husband and their three young children. She sells CDs, DVDs, toys, clothes, and other products outsiD. a school. She sells most of her products to the students in that area. María is requesting a loan because she would like to buy more products for her business. She wants to increase her sales because, as her husband works alongsiD. her, this is the only source of income for the family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying more products for her business

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita D. is a married mother of two children - a son and a daughter - who are both currently in primary school. She is thirty-two years old. Rita lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Rita’s husband is a trader. She deals in agrochemicals. Rita sells agricultural chemicals such as herbicides, insecticides, pesticides, and fertilizers. She sells in a shop by the roadside. Rita supplies farmers in her community and treks to other markets to sell as well. She has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to buy agrochemicals in bulk. Rita wants to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy agrochemicals in bulk

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Señor de Los Milagros”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Imicati, distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno. Tiene 35 años de edad, es casada y madre de 04 hijos, posee estudios de secundaria completa y vive en el Centro poblado de Villa Santa Rosa en Jr. Independencia s/n.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 5 años, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, para comprar ropa para su negocio.

Actualmente solicita un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, para comprar ropa y así aumentar el capital de su negocio de compra y venta de ropas, tiene su puesto en el mercado de Yunguyo.

Su mayor sueño es poder darles una educación a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan las facilidades de los préstamos que ofrece su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the communal bank "Señor de Los Milagros”, which is located in the Imicati Community, Yunguyo district, Chucuito province, department of Puno. She is 35 years old, married, and mother of 4 children. She has completed secondary studies and she lives in El Centro Poblado de Villa Santa Rosa on Jr. Independencia s/n.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for almost 5 years. She started with a loan of S/. 300 nuevo soles, which she used to buy clothes for her business.

Now she is requesting a loan of S/. 10000 nuevo soles to buy clothes and in this way increase working capital for her business of buying and selling clothes. Her stand is in the Yunguyo market.

Her greatest dream is to be able to provide her children with an education.

She likes the terms of credit offered by her communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort O. is twenty-eight years old and single with no children. She lives alone in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Comfort sells agricultural chemicals such as herbicides, insecticides, pesticides and fertilizers. She sells in a shop at the lorry station in her community. She supplies farmers in her community and treks to other markets to sell as well. Comfort has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy agrochemicals in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy agrochemicals in bulk

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A. is widow and has three children. She did not receive any formal education. Ama sells smoked fish in small quantities in Agona Sekondi, which she has done since 1999. She is solely responsible for her finances and that of the three children. Ama will use the loan to purchase more fish to smoke and sell. Ama plans to invest the new profits back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to smoke and sell.

loans.name: Wendy Xiomara

texts.es: Wendy Xiomara V. M. de 23 años de edad reside en Cojutepeque junto a su madre, padrastro, un hermano y su pequeño hijo. Ella junto a su madre poseen una venta de carne en el mercado municipal de Cojutepeque, en el cual hace ocho años invierte su tiempo para obtener los recursos necesarios para vivir de una manera digna. Wendy solicita un préstamo, ya que necesitan comprar más carne para que de esta manera las ventas puedan incrementarse y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Wendy Xiomara V. M. is 23 years old and she lives in Cojutepeque with her mother, stepfather, one brother and his young son. She and her mother run a business selling meat in the market of Cojutepeque. She has invested her time in this business for eight years to earn a decent living. Wendy is requesting a loan because she needs to buy more meat. This way, she can increase sales and increase earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more meat

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita P. is from the village of Bulihon, Misamis Oriental. She is thirty-two years old and single. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a business, selling leafy vegetables from her garden to the local community. Teresita wants to open up a small variety store, which is the main reason why she started with the program and services of HSPFI.

In 2009, Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Teresita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used as working capital for her variety store. This will be the first loan taken out by Teresita from HSPFI. She plans to use the revenue generated from the business to supplement her income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For working capital

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia K. is twenty-six years old and married, and currently has no children. She lives with her husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Felicia’s husband is a professional teacher, while she is a seamstress. She designs and sews for clients and also creates clothing to sell. Felicia has a workshop on the street in her community. She says that at the moment she has two apprentices under training. Felicia has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy textiles and other sewing accessories in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies in bulk

loans.name: María Gladis

texts.es: María Gladis C. D. V. D. 65 años D. edad resiD. en mejicanos junto a sus dos pequeños hijos. Posee una tienda D. productos perecederos y uso personal en su casa y solicita un préstamo con el fin D. poder comprar más productos para su negocio, así también desea comprar un estante en el cual pueda colocarlos D. una manera más ordenada y que sean visibles para sus clientes, ya que ella espera mejorar sus ganancias y darle un mejor estilo D. vida a sus hijos los cuales dependen únicamente D. ella.
texts.en:
María Gladis C. D. V. is 65 years old and lives in Mejicanos with her two small children. She has a small store in her home where she sales perishable and personal use items and is requesting a loan in order to purchase more products for her business. She also wishes to purchase a shelf on which she can arrange the products in a more organized way so they are visible to her clients. She hopes to increase her earnings and give a better quality of life to her children who depend only on her.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a shelf and additional products to sell

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia C. is forty-four years old and married with seven children, three sons and four daughters. They are in the senior high, junior high and the primary school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Felicia and her husband run a chop bar business (outdoor food vending) by the roadside in her community. She has two hired hands who work for her. Felicia has been in business for twenty-one years and wants a loan to buy food stuffs and other ingredients in bulk. She desires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Kossi G. est un conducteur de taxi moto. agé de 31 ans, il est marié et père d’un enfant. avec ce premier crédit de FECECAV, kossi espère payer sa propre moto puisque celle qu’il conduit n’est pas de sa propriété. Cette aubaine lui permettra de mieux épargner pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kossi G. is a motorbike taxi driver. He is 31 years old, married, and the father of one child. With this initial FECECAV loan, he hopes to buy his own motorbike, since the one he drives isn't his. This great opportunity will enable him to save more money to support his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorbike taxi

loans.name: Carlos Caín

texts.es: Carlos Caín M. de 36 años de edad, reside en Santa Ana junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos. Él posee un negocio en el cual se encarga de fabricar y vender ladrillos para construcción. El solicita un préstamo ya que espera obtener el capital necesario para comprar mucha más materia prima y elaborar más ladrillos, ya que su demanda es muy alta y es necesario que elabore mas ladrillos para incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Carlos Caín M. is 36 years old and lives in Santa Ana with his life partner and two children. He owns a business that makes and sells bricks for construction. He is requesting a loan because he hopes to obtain the necessary capital to purchase much more raw materials and make more bricks because the demand is very high and he needs to make more bricks in order to increase his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials needed to make bricks

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en: Sabina A. is married and has eight dependents. She did not receive any formal education. Sabina sells firewood in small quantities in Esuase. She has been in this business since 1999. Her husband has a driving business from which he earns a very small income. Sabina uses all of her income for feeding their large family, and so she has financial difficulties. Sabina will use the loan to support her small capital for expanding her business. She will invest any new profits back into the business.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel O. is a nineteen-year-old young lady. She is single and lives with her mother in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana.

Mabel is a caterer and deals in pastries. She prepares and sells pastries such as chips (french fries), meat pies, doughnuts, etc. She hawks (sells door-to-door) to sell in her community. Mabel also supplies other retailers in her community. She buys bags of flour from Kumasi.

She has been in business for barely one year now and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk. She desires to expand her business and improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Claudia Maricela

texts.es: Claudia Maricela B. S. de 23 años de edad vive en Ahuachapán, junto a su pequeña hija de tres años de edad. Ella posee un comedor, en el cual vende bebidas, golosinas, desayunos y almuerzos y posee mucha experiencia en lo que realiza ya que desde que era una niña trabajo junto a su tía en dicho lugar. Claudia solicita un préstamo para comprar más granos básicos, así como también golosinas y bebidas, ella desea ver muy prospero su negocio, ya que como madre soltera debe trabajar muy duro para brindarle una mejor vida a su hija.
texts.en:
Claudia Maricela B. S. is 23 years old and lives in Ahuachapán with her young three year old daughter. She owns a small restaurant where she sells drinks, candy, breakfasts and lunches and has a lot of experience in what she does because she began working there with her aunt when she was a girl. Claudia is requesting a loan to buy more basic grains along with candy and drinks. She wishes to see her business thriving because as a single mother she must work hard in order to give a better life to her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, candy and drinks

loans.name: Emilita

texts.en: Emilita D. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 20 years old, married, and has one infant child. Emilita owns and operates a business making and selling viands, primarily selling viands like fried chicken parts, vegetables and noodles in the local community. She wants to improve her business given the fact that she has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Emilita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in improving her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Sunaya

texts.en:
Sunaya A. prepares and sells porridge. She sells by the lorry station in the mornings. She wants a loan to buy bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk. Sunaya buys her goods from nearby communities. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

Sunaya is 37 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: one son and three daughters. Some are currently in senior high while others are in junior high and primary schools. Her husband is a butcher. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in the commercial town of Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Sunaya's aspiration is to expand her business and sponsor her children in school.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk

loans.name: Justa

texts.es:
La señora Justa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Niño Jesús de Praga” ubicado en el distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chuchito, Departamento de Puno. Tiene 52 años de edad, es madre soltera y 5 hijos, 3 de los cuales están a su cargo, posee estudios de primaria incompleta y vive en el Barrio Jorge Chávez calle José  Carlos Mariategui  Nº 268.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace medio año, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, para aumentar el capital de su negocio de compra y venta de pollo. 

Actualmente solicita un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, para poder comprar pollos y luego venderlos en su puesto en el mercado de Yunguyo.

También trae tripas con sal del Cuzco y los lleva a la Paz - Bolivia.

Su deseo es poner un emporio grande y  bien surtido, tipo mini market.
A ella le gustan las reuniones,  los ahorros y los encuentros que se organiza en su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Justa belongs to the Niño de Jesús de Praga Communal Bank in the community of Yunguyo located in the province of Chuchito in the state of Puno. She is 52 years old and a single mother with five children, three of which are still under her care. She has an incomplete elementary school education and lives in the Jorge Chávez neighborhood at 268 José Carlos Mariategui Street. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos organization for six months. Her first loan was for 500 soles and it was used to increase the capital of her business which is buying and selling chickens. She is requesting another loan for 1,000 soles in order to purchase chickens and later sell them in her stand at the market in Yunguyo. She also brings salted intestines from Cusco and sells them in La Paz, Bolivia. Her desire is to open a big, well-stocked store like a mini market. She likes the meetings, saving money and the gatherings organized by the communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens and salted intestines

loans.name: Dora Margarita

texts.es: Dora Margarita M. V. de 36 años de edad, reside en Santa Tecla junto su esposo y dos hijos. Ella posee una tienda donde comercializa productos perecederos, y es así como a través de dicho negocio logra ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Dora solicita un préstamo ya que desea poder surtir mucho más su tienda de manera que pueda ofrecerle más productos a sus clientes  y así obtener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Dora Margarita M. V. is 36. She lives in Santa Tecla with her husband and two children.
