She has a store where she sells perishable goods; this business enables her to help her husband with the household expenses. Dora is asking for a loan because she wants to be able to stock her store more. Then she can offer more products to her customers and, in turn, get more earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perishable products for her store

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua B. is forty-six years old, married, and has given birth to six children: two daughters and four sons. Some are currently in the senior high while others are in the tertiary institutions and the junior high schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Her husband is a butcher.

Akosua is a trader. She trades in cereals such as maize, beans, millet, etc. She buys her goods from nearby communities at affordable prices and sells at the market square in her community. She supplies to food vendors and retailers. She also treks to other markets to sell.

Akosua has been in business for over thirteen years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and to sponsor all her children in school to the apex.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Lázaro De Jesús

texts.es: Lázaro de Jesús P. V. de 39 años de edad, reside en San Vicente junto su esposa y su único hijo. El posee un taller de estructuras metálicas, en el cual se dedica a elaborar, balcones, puertas, portones, entre otras cosas más. Lázaro solicita un préstamo con el cual pretende comprar más hierro, así también desea comprar nueva maquinaria para realizar su trabajo. Todo esto con el fin de brindar un mejor servicio y obtener mejores clientes.
texts.en:
Lázaro de Jesús P. Vaquerazo is 39. He lives in San Vicente with his wife and only son. He has a metal shop, and he makes balconies, doors, and gates, among other things. Lázaro is asking for a loan to buy more metal. He also wants to buy new machinery to do his work. He wants to buy these items in order to offer better server and get more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy metal

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. is fifty-two years old and the married mother of eight children: three sons and five daughters who are all currently in school – senior high, junior high and the primary schools. She says one is in the university. Grace lives with her children and husband in a family house in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband is a farmer.

Grace is a baker - she bakes bread in her community. She supplies to retailers and beverage sellers in her community and hawks (sells door-to-door) to sell. She buys bags of flour from Kumasi.

Grace has been in business for over twenty-five years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk. She desires to expand her business and to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.es:
La señora Lucrecia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Semillas del Futuro” ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de  Puno, Departamento de Puno. Tiene 41 años de edad, es casada y 2 hijos, posee estudios de secundaria completa y vive en el Barrio Ricardo Palma.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela R. hace 2 años con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles para su negocio de compra y venta de artesanías de cerámica. 

Actualmente solicita un préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su actual negocio, comprando artesanías de cerámica y además lana de diferentes colores para elaborar artesanías en tejidos a palito.

Su mayor sueño es darles una educación a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan las charlas de apoyo a las mujeres que realizan en su banco comunal.
texts.en:
Lucrecia belongs to the Semillas del Futuro Community Bank, which is located in the Puno district, Puno province, Puno departments. She is 41, married, and she has two children. She has a high school education. She lives in the Ricardo Palma neighborhood. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela R. for two years. She started with a loan of 300 PEN, which she used for her business of buying and selling ceramic handicrafts. She is currently asking for a loan for 800 PEN to buy ceramic handicrafts and different color wool to make the handicrafts that she knits. Her biggest dream is to give her children an education. She likes the chats that support the women, which are held by her Community Bank.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ceramics and different colors of wool

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A. is twenty-seven years old, married, and has given birth to two children: a boy and a girl. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband is a fitting mechanic while she is a seamstress by profession.

Comfort designs and sews for clients and also for sale. She has her workshop on the street in her community. She says at the moment, she has three apprentices under training. She has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy textiles and other sewing accessories in bulk. She desires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy textiles and other sewing accessories in bulk

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary E. sells local herbal medicines in Sekondi. Mary did not receive any form of formal education. She is married and has four dependants. Her husband is a fisherman who earns a little for a living. Mary has been selling herbal medicines since 2007. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying housekeeping and other financial expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more medicines to sell. She hopes to reinvest her profits into the business.

loans.use: To buy herbal medicines

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie O. has been working as a traditional gold miner for over 30 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from this activity. Her main source of income is from selling gold dust in her community. Elsie also raises livestock such as chicken and carabao (water buffalo). Her earnings from raising farm animals help a lot in supporting her family. Elsie wants to open up a simple food stall in which she'll be selling cooked rice and viand. Elsie is 41 years old, married and has eight school-aged children. They are from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City.

In 2009, Elsie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Elsie is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to start up her food vending business. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To start up a food vending business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Lamisi

texts.en:
Lamisi N. cooks and sells banku, a local dish made from corn dough. It is served hot with soup. She sells at the market square in the mornings. She has been in business for seven years. Lamisi wants a loan to buy bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk. She buys her goods from nearby communities at affordable prices.

Lamisi is 42 years old, married and has four children--two daughters and two sons. Some are currently in senior high while others are in primary schools. Her husband is a farmer. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in the commercial town of Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. She aspires to expand her business and sponsor her children in school.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina G. is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice and stew on a tabletop by the roadside in the afternoons. She has been in business for seven years. Angelina wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk. She buys her goods from Kumasi.

Angelina is 38 years old, divorced and has two children, a boy and a girl, who are currently in junior high and primary schools. She lives with her two children in a rented apartment in the commercial town of Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her goal is to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa I. sells phone credits for all networks. She sells on a tabletop by the roadside from morning til night. She has been in this business for two years. She buys the cards from Kumasi. Hawa wants a loan to buy phone credits in bulk. 
Hawa is 34 years old and divorced with one child--a boy who is currently in primary school. She lives with her son in a rented apartment in the commercial town of Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her goal is to expand her business and give her child a good education.

loans.use: To buy phone credit cards

loans.name: Osman B.

texts.en:
This is Osman B. T., age 38. Osman owns a small pharmacy at the centre of Magburaka town. He has been selling medicines for over nine years but his pharmacy had been growing at a very slow pace until two years ago when he became an SMT/Kiva client. His business has now experienced a vast improvement. Osman has just finished repaying his last solidarity group loan successfully and has applied for an individual loan of Le 2,500,000.

Osman B. T. was born in a village called Mangoro about five miles from Magburaka. He now resides in Magburaka together with his family. He has a wife and four children. One of his children just sat the West Africa Senior Secondary Schools Examinations (WASSE) and the others are still in primary schools.

loans.use: To invest in a pharmacy

loans.name: Oscar Moises

texts.es: El Joven Oscar Moisés Ampie, tiene la edad de 29 años, habita en el barrio Dennis Larios en la comunidad de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa, la cual le poya con las actividades del hogar, ellos tienen a su cargo un hijo, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, desde hace diez años se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas ,la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento ,   inicio esta actividad por cuenta propia , sus objetivos hacia su cultivo es diversificarlo ya que si le va mal en un producto se recupera en otro . Con el financiamiento obtenido va a comprar fertlitizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo y poder lograr una mejor cosecha.
texts.en:
Oscar Moisés Ampie is young man who is 29 years old. He lives with his wife and child in the Dennis Larrios neighborhood of the Ticuantepe community. She helps with the household chores. Having worked in the agriculture business for ten years, Oscar plans to improve the living conditions of his family.

He experienced great difficulty starting his business due to a lack of funding. As a farmer, his goal is to grow a variety of crops so that if one particular crop isn’t profitable, then he is able to recover his losses through the sale of his other crops. With the loan he received, Oscar will purchase fertilizers and other supplies to cultivate his land and achieve a better harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and farming supplies

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is Ibrahim C.. Ibrahim sells ready-to-wear-clothes and has been a businessman for over 15 years now. He has decided to apply for a loan in order to boost up his business. His business has been growing at a very slow pace, but with a loan he is sure to make more profit, expand his business and improve on his standard of living. This will be the first loan this entrepreneur is accessing from SMT/Kiva. He is requesting a loan of Le 2,000,000.

Ibrahim is age 50 and was born in Magburaka town, about 22 miles from Makeni City. He is married with five children. One of his children is in college and the rest are in secondary schools.

loans.use: To invest in clothing business

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia F. sells jewelry such as earrings, necklaces, chains, rings, etc. She buys her goods from Kumasi at affordable prices and sells in the market square in her community. Emilia hawks her goods and treks to other markets to sell as well. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

Emilia is 24 years old, married and has two children--one girl and one boy, who are both in primary school. Emilia’s husband is a commercial driver. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in the commercial town of Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana. Her goal is to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy jewelry

loans.name: Amidu

texts.en:
This is Amidu C.. Amidu is a local entrepreneur in Magburaka town who sells ready-to-wear-clothes, traveling bags, cottons, bed sheets, etc., right in the center of town. Amidu is among the earliest beneficiaries of the SMT/Kiva loans in Magburaka. With SMT/Kiva loans, his business has been growing steadily. Having made his last payment as a solidarity group member, Amidu now qualifies for an individual loan. He is applying for a loan of Le 3,500,000 to help him further develop his business.

Amidu is 50 years of age, married with five children all of whom are still in secondary school. He was born in the village of Kafe Semira, about 40 miles from Magburaka. Amidu has been a businessman for over 20 years now. With this loan, he is expecting to make enough profit to feed his family.

loans.use: To invest in clothing business

loans.name: Fuad M.

texts.en:
This is Fuad M. C., a local entrepreneur in Magburaka town. Fuad owns a provision shop right at the entrance of the Magburaka town market. He sells mayonnaise, cheese, butter, sugar, milk, eggs and much more. 

This is the first loan that this entrepreneur is accessing from SMT/Kiva. He chose to apply for a loan in order to help him develop his business at a faster rate. He is asking for a loan of SLL3,500,000. He would like to use this loan to buy ten cartons of cigarettes. He wants to introduce cigarettes into his business because he has discovered that cigarettes are a lucrative business.

Fuad is now forty years of age. He was born in Gbonkolenken village about twenty-nine miles from Magburaka town. Fuad is married to a businesswoman. They run the business together. They have eight children, some are in secondary schools and others in primary schools. Fuad has been a businessman for over twenty years. This loan, he says, will help him improve on his business, his life and that of his children.

loans.use: Invest in his business.

loans.name: Arsita

texts.en:
Arsita D. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 44 years old. Arsita is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Arsita owns & operates a business planting & harvesting coconut, cassava and bananas for sale. Arsita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years.

In 2009, Arsita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Arsita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Arsita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family and for the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Alie

texts.en:
This is Alie S., a local entrepreneur in Magburaka town. Alie sells miscellaneous items; he sells market food, clothes, tape recorders and tape cassettes, sneakers, slippers and so on. This is not the first loan this entrepreneur is accessing from SMT/Kiva. He was among the first entrepreneurs to benefit from the SMT/Kiva loan scheme in Magburaka town. Since he started accessing loans from SMT/Kiva, his business has improved a great deal. Having made his last repayment as a solidarity group member, he has now qualified to apply for an individual loan. Alie wants a loan of SLL 3,000,000 to help him further expand his business.

Alie S. is now aged thirty-two. He was born in Magburaka town. He is married to a businesswoman and they have four children together. One of his children in now in secondary school, two in primary and the last is not yet school aged.  Alie has been a businessman for over ten years now. This loan, he told me, will help him develop his life, educate his children and build his family a house.

loans.use: Invest in his business.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa S. is forty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: three sons and a daughter. All are currently in the senior high, junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Her husband works in a local sawmill firm. Theresa trades in vegetables and other food items. She sells vegetables such as onions, garden eggs, pepper, tomatoes, etc. on a tabletop at the market square. She buys her goods from nearby farming communities and Kumasi. She also treks to other markets to sell. Theresa has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Alhaji I

texts.en:
This is Alhaji Issa S.. Alhaji is a local entrepreneur in Magburaka town; he sells medicine at the town’s main market. This will the fifth loan Alhaji is accessing from SMT/Kiva. Previous loans have made a tremendous impact into the live and business of this entrepreneur. Having made his last loan repayment as member of a solidarity group, he is now asking for a loan of SLL1,000,000 as an individual client.

Alhaji was born in Magburaka town, fifty-four years ago. He is married to a businesswoman and they have eight children. Three of their children are in Senior Secondary School, three in Junior Secondary School and two in primary schools. Alhaji Isssa S. has been selling medicine for over twenty-two years now. This loan will go a long way in helping Alhaji, he told me. Being able to buy the drugs in wholesale alone has saved him enough money, when compared to receiving the drugs from wholesalers.

loans.use: To invest in his business.

loans.name: Aminata C.

texts.en:
This is Aminata C. S.. She is a local entrepreneur in Magburaka town. She sells market food: bulgur wheat, rice, beans, salt, pepper and even soap and charcoals right at the center of town. This will the forth loan this entrepreneur is accessing from SMT/Kiva. Aminata has benefited a lot from previous SMT/Kiva loans. Her business grew, enabling her start a new stall. Her level of income improves and her standard of living also improves. Aminata has made her last loan repayment as a member of a solidarity group, qualifying her for an individual loan. She is now asking for an individual loan of SLL2,000,000. With this loan, she will be able to travel to Freetown (404 miles round trip from Magburaka) to buy the goods she sells in wholesale.

Aminata is now forty; she was born in Magburaka town. She is married to a teacher and they have five children. Three of their children are in secondary schools and two are in primary schools. She has been a businesswoman for over ten years now.

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is Ibrahim B.. Ibrahim is a local entrepreneur based in Magburaka town. Ibrahim owns a shop at the Magburaka town market where he sells cosmetics. This is not the first loan this entrepreneur has received from SMT/Kiva. Previous loans have created a lot of meaningful impacts in the life and business of this entrepreneur. Having made his last loan repayment as a solidarity group member, he has now qualified for an individual loan. He is currently asking for a loan of SLL 3,000,000 to further strengthen his business. 

Ibrahim B. is now age thirty-five. He was born in Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone. He is married and he and his wife run the business. Ibrahim and his wife have five children, four in secondary schools and one in primary school. Ibrahim has been a businessman for over six years now.

loans.use: To invest in his business.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia N. is twenty-seven years old. She is single and has no children. She lives alone in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase, in the Western Region. Sophia is a professional hairdresser. She has three apprentices who are currently in training. Her shop is located by the roadside. She buys her working materials, such as artificial hair, shampoo, pomade, cream, lotion, etc. from Kumasi. Sophia has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy products in bulk to be able to render quality services to her cherished clients. She aspires to expand her business and to improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase artificial hair.

loans.name: Constance

texts.fr:
H.  Constance est  née vers 1965 à BOPA, le village lacustre du Département du Mono. Constance est Célibataire sans enfant. Constance réside à Irédé à AKPAKPA un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Economique  de la République du Bénin. 

Constance est enseignante de profession et de fonction. Mais depuis 16 ans Constance a une boutique de divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, piles, bougies, etc.) qu’elle supervise pendant ses heures creuses de service. 

Constance a déjà  bénéficié d’un prêt de ALIDé pour améliorer le niveau de son activité. Constance a respecté ses engagements de remboursement de prêt. Pour renforcer son fonds de roulement et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Constance sollicite actuellement un deuxième prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
H. Constance was born around 1965 in BOPA, the lakeside village of Mono County. She is unmarried and has no children. She resides in Irédé in AKPAKPA, a district of Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. Constance is a teacher by profession, and it is her job. But for sixteen years, she has had a shop selling various goods: candies, cookies, canned foods (milk, sardines, tomatoes), sugar, pasta, laundry detergents, dish soap, bath soap, batteries, candles, etc. She supervises the shop during her downtime. She has already benefited from an Alidé loan to improve the level of her business. She has honored her loan payment commitments. To boost her working capital and to do better in satisfying her burgeoning customer base, she's currently requesting a second loan with Alidé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of tomatoes, milk, sugar, candles, pasta, soaps, and sacks of rice and corn

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi A. is a widow and has 4 dependants. She did not receive any form of education. Esi has been a food vendor in Ekuase, near Cape Cost, since 1999. She sells Kenkey, a local food made out of corn dough that is cooked and wrapped in cornhusk. Esi uses her income for feeding the family. Esi will use the loan to buy maize to enable her to prepare the Kenkey for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to reinvest into the business.

loans.use: To buy maize to prepare for making Kenkey.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle O. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. Michelle is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Michelle owns & operates a business venture selling soft drinks, biscuits, candies and daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Michelle has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Michelle joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Michelle is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Michelle from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Francisca Antonia

texts.es: La señora Francisca Antonia M. , tiene la edad 63 años , habita en el barrio las conchitas , ubicado en el departamento de Masaya , junto a su esposo , el cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ella tiene tres hijos , ya todos casados , agricultores , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y poder comprar un terreno , para heredar a sus tres hijos , desde hace 20 años doña Francisca se dedica a la agricultura inicio el trabajo agrícola , con sus propios esfuerzos .Con el financiamiento obtenido va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo y poder obtener una buena cosecha para vender a mejor precio en el mercado. Da las gracia Afodenic por los beneficio de mejora para su cultivo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Francisca Antonia M. is 63 years old, and lives in the neighborhood of the shells, located in the Masaya department. She lives with her husband, who she helps with household expenses. She has three children that are already married and are farmers. She plans to improve their living conditions and to buy land to pass on to her three kids. Twenty years ago Mrs. Francisco began working as a farmer and has since been dedicated to agriculture, all through her own efforts. With the funding obtained she will buy fertilizers and inputs to apply to her crops, and to be able to have a better harvest to sell for a better price in the market. She thanks Afodenic for the profits made from crop improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inputs and fertilizers to apply to crops.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Kossiwa K. est revendeuse de céréales au grand marché de Lomé. Agée de 42 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Kossiwa désire avec ce crédit acheter des sacs de maïs, mils, haricots et riz pour la revente. Elle opère dans ce secteur depuis 6 ans.
texts.en:
Kossiwa K. is a retailer of grains at the grand marketplace of Lomé. She is 42 years old, married, and the mother of three. She would like to use this loan to buy sacks of corn, millet, beans, and rice to sell. She has been operating in this field for six years.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, millet, beans, and rice for resale

loans.name: Chinie

texts.en:
Chinie S. is from the village of Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 27 years old. Chinie is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Chinie owns & operates a business selling beverages including fruit juices & soft drinks in the local community. Chinie is just starting this business.

In 2009, Chinie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Chinie is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to be used as additional working capital. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Chinie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional working capital.

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es: Petronila H. D. R. D. 49 años D. edad resiD. en Verapaz junto a su esposo el cual se dedica a trabajar como motorista del transporte colectivo y junto a su hija y tres nietos. La señora Petronila posee una venta D. verduras, frutas, pan y pupusas. Su hija se encarga D. ayudarle en el negocio y juntas trabajan arduamente. La señora Petronila solicita un préstamo para poder comprar maíz y frijoles para las pupusas, ya que estas son las que más se venden en su negocio.
texts.en:
Petronila H. D. R. is 49. She lives in Verapaz with her husband, a driver for a transportation association; her daughter; and three grandchildren. Petronila sells vegetables, fruit, bread, and “pupusas” (a stuffed thick tortilla like El Salvadorian dish). Her daughter helps her with the business, and together they work arduously. Petronila is asking for a loan to be able to buy corn and beans for the pupusas, because that is what she sells the most.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn and beans

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth E. is a fishmonger in Sekondi. Elizabeth has not had any formal education. She is married and has four dependants. Her husband is a fisherman who lives on a small income. Elizabeth has been a fishmonger since 1996. She is responsible for all the financial needs of the family. Her loan will be used to support her business. She hopes to reinvest her profits into the business.

loans.use: To support her business.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
La señora Rufina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Semillas del Futuro” ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de  Puno, Departamento de Puno. Tiene 38 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 03 hijos, posee estudios de educación superior incompleta (técnico en Ingeniería civil) y vive en el Barrio Ricardo Palma.

Hoy se inicia con el movimiento Manuela Ramos con un préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, para su negocio de preparación y venta de jugos de quinua al paso, con el cual comprara quinua, azucar, leche y otros insumos.

Le gustaría mucho crear otro negocio como la  preparación de desayunos al paso. 

A ella le gustan las facilidades de pago y la forma de trabajo que se da en su banco comunal.
texts.en:
Rufina belongs to the Semillas del Futuro Community Bank, which is located in the Puno district, Puno province, Puno department. She is 38, in a common law marriage, and has three children. She has some upper level education as a civil engineering technician, but she has not finished. She lives in the Ricardo Palma neighborhood. She is starting now with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos with a loan for 500 PEN. The loan is for her business of making and selling quinoa juice. She will buy quinoa, sugar, milk, and other supplies. She would really like to start another business like making fast food breakfast. She likes her community bank’s ease of payment and the way they work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies (quinoa, sugar, milk, and others) to make quinoa juice

loans.name: Dorotea Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Dorotea del Carmen M. , tiene la edad 65 años , habita en el Barrio La bolsa , ubicado en el municipio de la Concepción , junto a su esposo , el cual le apoya con las actividades agrícolas , ellos tienen cinco hijos , ya todos casados , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y en un futuro poder comprar un terreno y heredar por partes iguales a sus hijos , desde hace 30 años se dedica  a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son las plagas que afectan al cultivo , por falta de insumos . Con el financiamiento obtenido va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo y poder lograr una cosecha mejor.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dorotea del Carmen M. is 65 years old, she lives in the neighborhood of La bolsa, located in the municipality of la Concepción. She lives with her husband, who she helps out with agricultural activities. They have five children, all are married. She plans to improve family living conditions and in the future buy land that will be equally inherited by their children. For 30 years she has been devoted to agriculture, the major difficulty she faces is the pests that affect the crops due to a lack of inputs. With the funding obtained she will buy fertilizers and inputs to apply to the crops, thus producing a better harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inputs and fertilizers to apply to crops.

loans.name: Ana Leticia

texts.es: Ana Leticia H. D. C. D. 48 años D. edad, resiD. en Soyapango junto a su esposo, su padre, tres hijos y un nieto. Ella posee una tienda D. productos comestibles como jugos, pan, desayunos, almuerzos, agua embotellada entre otras cosas más. Solicita un préstamo, ya que desea surtir más su tienda y D. esta manera obtener mayores ganancias las cuales beneficien a su familia, debido a que esta es muy extensa Ana debe esforzarse por mejorar las ganancias ya que es D. mucha importancia para ella contribuir con su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Ana Leticia H. D. C. is 48. She lives in Soyapango with her husband, her father, three children, and one grandson. She has a store selling food such as juice, bread, breakfast, lunch, bottled water, among other things. She is asking for a loan because she wants to stock her store with more products. This way she will get greater earnings, which will benefit her family. Due to the fact that her family is extensive, Ana needs to work hard to improve the earnings. It is very important to her that she contribute with her husband to the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more products

loans.name: Anastacia Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Anastacia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Semillas del Futuro”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno. Tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y madre de 03 hijos, posee estudios de educación superior completa (profesora de educación primaria), y vive en el Barrio Manto.

Hoy en día se inicia con el movimiento Manuela Ramos con un préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, para su negocio de compra y venta de abarrotes del cuál compara diversos productos como: fideos, harina, aceite, leche arroz y azúcar para surtir su tienda.

Su mayor sueño es poder ejercer su profesión.

A ella le gustan las facilidades de pago y la forma de trabajo de su banco comunal.
texts.en:
Anastacia belongs to the Semillas del Futuro Community Bank, which is located in the Puno district, Puno province, Puno department. She is 42, married, and has three children. She has a college education (elementary school teacher), and she lives in the Manto neighborhood. She is now starting with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos. Her initial loan of 500 PEN is for her business of buying and selling groceries. She will buy various products such as noodles, flour, oil, milk, rice, and sugar to stock her store. Her biggest dream is to be able to work in her profession. She likes the ease of payment and the way her community bank works.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries (flour, oil, milk, rice, and sugar) to stock her store

loans.name: Javier Antonio

texts.es: El señor Javier Antonio A. tiene 34 años de edad, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, soltero, vive con su mama, sus planes para su familia es hacer mejoras a su vivienda y poder gozar de una casa digna. El labora en una empresa de Zona franca desde hace cuatro años,  es un trabajo cansado y bajo de salario pero debido a la falta de empleo sigue luchando. Este es su sexto crédito en Afodenic el cual va invertir en materiales de construcción para hacer división de cuarto  en la parte interna de la casa. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo y beneficios para lograr sus objetivos en la mejora de su vivienda, entre otros planes es poder estabilizarse como pareja.
texts.en:
Mr. Javier Antonio A. is 34 years old, he lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood in the capital of Managua. He is unmarried and lives with his mother. He plans to make improvements on their family home so that they will be able to enoy a decent home. For four years he has worked for a company in the free Zone. It is a tiring, low-income job but due to lack of employment opportunities he continues to struggle. This is his sixth loan with Afodenic, which he will invest in construction materials in order to build a room division in the interior of the house. He thanks the institution for their support and assistance in helping him achieve his home improvement objectives, amongst other plans to become stable as a couple in his relationship.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to build a room division.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing maize

loans.name: Carmen Elena

texts.es: Carmen Elena C. D. C. D. 30 años D. edad, resiD. en Lourdes Colón junto a su esposo y dos pequeños hijos. Ella como toda madre trabajadora, trabaja día a día vendiendo perfumes para hombres y mujeres y D. esta manera ella contribuye con su esposo a los gastos del hogar. Carmen Elena solicita un préstamo con el fin D. poder comprar más mercadería, ya que muchos productos son pedidos por las clientas, los cuales ella no los posee, y con este préstamo ella obtendrá el dinero para poder comprarlos y luego venderlos a sus clientas.
texts.en:
Carmen Elena C. D. C. is 30. She lives in Lourdes Colón with her husband and two small children. She, like all working mothers, works every day. She sells men’s and women’s perfume. This way she can contribute, along with her husband, to the household expenses. Carmen Elena is asking for a loan to be able to buy more merchandise. She has orders from her customers for a lot of products that she does not have. She will use the loan to buy these products and sell them to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perfume

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Analisa

texts.en:
Analisa S. is from the town of Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 31 years old. Analisa is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Analisa owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store at Lumbia International Airport. She sells both food and daily-use products. Analisa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Analisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analisa is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used as additional working capital. This loan is Analisa's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. As her business grows, she want to gradually finish her house.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template so the field staff could continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional working capital

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Rosa Lucila

texts.es:
La señora Rosa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen de Urkupiña” ubicado en el distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chuchito, Departamento de Puno. Tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y madre de 4 hijos, posee estudios de educación superior (Profesora de secundaria) y vive en el Barrio Central.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desde la fundación del Banco Comunal, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de artículos de escritorio. 

Actualmente solicita un préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de cuadernos, lapiceros, hojas bond y otros artículos más para surtir su tienda.

Su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando.

A ella le gusta la confraternidad que existe en su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the "Virgen de Urkupiña" communal bank, located in the district of Yunguyo, Chuchito Province in the state of Puno. She is 43 years old, married and a mother of 4 children. She studied at the university level in education and lives in Barrio Central. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos organization since its start, with an initial loan of 300 Nuevos Soles to purchase office supplies. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 300 Nuevos Soles to purchase notebooks, pencil cases, paper, and other items to supply her store. Her biggest desire is to continue working. She likes the fellowship that exists in the communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase notebooks, pencil cases, paper, and other items to supply her store.

loans.name: Yasmín Evelisa

texts.es: Yasmín Evelisa R. de 30 años de edad reside en Lourdes Colón junto a sus dos hijos y su madre. Ella posee un bazar en su propia casa, negocio el cual les ha permitido seguir adelante junto a su familia. Yasmín solicita un préstamo ya que necesita surtir su negocio comprando ropa, cosméticos, perfumes y otros productos más. Ella desea mucho aumentar sus ganancias ya que es la única que trabaja en su hogar, ya que su madre es de avanzada edad y contribuye cuidando a sus nietos, es por ello que Yasmín solicita dicho préstamo ya que desea mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Yasmín Evelisa R. is 30 years old and lives in Lourdes Colón with her two children and her mother. She runs a store in her home that sells a variety of items. This business has allowed her and her family to keep moving forward.
Yasmín is requesting a loan because she needs to purchase clothing, cosmetics, perfume and other products to stock her business. She very much wishes to increase her earnings since she is the only one who works in her household now that her mother is older and helps by looking after her grandchildren.
This is why Yasmín is requesting this loan. She hopes to improve her business and sales.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics and clothing

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane B. is a food vendor in VRA Shama near Cape Cost. Jane has received a senior high education. She is married and has four dependants. Jane has being a food vendor since 2003. She uses all her income to feed her family. Her loan will be used to support her business by buying more food supplies and spices for preparing the food she she sells. She plans to reinvest the new profits into her business.

loans.use: To buy food supplies and spices

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica M. is a widow and has six dependants. She received schooling through the junior high level. Veronica sells plastic products such as bowls and other home utensils in Agona. She has been in this business since 1996. Veronica uses her income to feed her family. She will use the loan to buy more plastic products to sell. Veronica plans to reinvest the new profits into the business.

loans.use: To purchase more plastic products

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita M. is from the town of Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 35 years old. Elenita is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Elenita sells daily-use snack products such as biscuits, banana chips, and candies at Lumbia International Airport. Elenita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Elenita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elenita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP that she will use as additional capital to sustain her business. This loan is Elenita's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's education. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Alegria

texts.es:
La señora Alegría, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Ciudad de los Tres Pisos”, vive en el Jr. Junín Nº 164, Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 36 años y 2 hijos que aun dependen de ella ya que están estudiando.

Lleva años dedicándose a este tipo de negocio de venta de ropa usada y nueva, nos cuenta que le va muy bien es así que logro ahorrar su dinero que le permitió comprar  mas ropa variada, ya que tiene como meta implementar su negocio con ropas para damas, caballeros y niño. A su edad el trabajo que realiza no le causa mucha molestia y esta muy satisfecha con lo que hace. 

En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio y cuenta con una clientela ya fidelizada, en el barrio ya es muy conocida y es la única que cuenta con este tipo de negocio y esto le da mayores ventajas para sus ventas.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, lo invertirá comprando ropas como pantalones, polos, vestidos y blusas en fardos, tanto nuevas y de segunda mano.

Se siente muy contenta, tiene fuerzas aún para seguir a adelante y hasta que Dios lo permita, se esta asegurando una vejes tranquila, por lo que reconoce el gran apoyo que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos le viene brindando a ella y otras mujeres de la región San Martín.
texts.en:
Alegría belongs to the Ciudad de los Tres Pisos Community Bank. She lives on el Jr. Junín Nº 164, Lamas province, San Martín department. She is 36, married, and has two dependent children who go to school. She has worked in the business of selling new and used clothes for years. It is going very well for her. She has been able to save her money and buy more clothing. Her goal is to set up her business with clothes for women, men, and children. At her age, her work does not bother her, and she is very satisfied with what she does. She currently continues with the same business, and she has a loyal client base. She is well known in her neighborhood. One of her biggest sales advantages is that she is the only one in the neighborhood with this type of business. She will use this loan for 1,000 PEN to buy clothes like pants, polos, dresses, and blouses in bundles. She will buy new and second hand clothes. She is very happy, and she has the strength to keep going as long as God permits. She is assuring herself of a peaceful old age. She recognizes the great support that the Movimiento Manuela Ramos offers her and other women from the San Martín region.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a variety of clothing (polos, pants, dresses, and others) for greater sales

loans.name: Oscar Vicente

texts.es: El señor Oscar Vicente R. , tiene la edad de 33 años, habita en el barrio Buena Vista , junto a su esposa , la cual le poya con los gastos del hogar , la señora trabaja como comerciante en el mercado, ellos tiene dos hijos , de 12 y 7 años , actualmente estudiantes , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , desde hace 10 años , don Oscar se dedica a la agricultura ,  , el inicio esta actividad con sus propios esfuerzos y el de sus suegros , los planes hacia un futuro en el cultivo es poder diversificar el cultivo .Con el préstamo obtenido va a comprar insumos y fertilizantes para aplicar al cultivo y mejorar la producción.
texts.en:
Mr. Oscar Vicente R. is 33 years old, he lives in the Buena Vista neighborhood with his wife, whom he helps with household expenses. His wife works as a vendor in the market. They have two children, 12 and 7 who are currently students. They plan to improve their families' living conditions. For 10 years, Oscar has been devoted to agriculture. He began this activity through their own efforts and those of their in-laws, they plan to diversify crops in the future. With the loan obtained they will buy inputs and fertilizers to apply to the crops and to improve production.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inputs and fertilizers to apply to crops.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary M. sells bottled water in the fishing harbor in Takoradi. Mary has finished junior high. She is divorced and has 2 children. Mary has been selling bottled water since 1995. She is responsible solely for the feeding the children. Her loan will be used to support her business in water trading. She hopes to re-invest the new profit back into the business.

loans.use: To support her business in the water trading.

loans.name: Ronnie

texts.en:
Ronnie O. is from the village of Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 33 years old. Ronnie is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Ronnie owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where he sells canned goods and daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. He also retails gasoline. Ronnie has been engaged in his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ronnie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and to engage in business activities. Ronnie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ronnie is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP to be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Ronnie from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family and for the renovation of his house. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Elvira, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Ciudad D. los Tres Pisos”, vive en el Jr. Antonio Díaz Padilla S/Nº, Provincia D. Lamas, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 47 años y madre D. 02 hijos independientes.

Nos cuenta Rosita, que se inicio, con S/. 500.00 y que fue por iniciativa propia que decidió emprender su negocio D. elaboración y venta dulces.
Es ella misma, quien se encarga D. preparar y hornear sus rosquillas con dulce y con sal , budines, kekes y otros dulces más, en un ambiente construido en la huerta D. su casa, donD. cuenta con su principal herramienta D. trabajo que es su horno, también en este mismo local exhibe y venD. sus productos.

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio, nos cuenta que le va muy bien en sus ventas D. dulces, se encarga D. ofrecer en diferentes bodegas D. la cuidad y cuenta con una clientela ya fidelizada.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,000.00, lo invertirá, comprando insumos para la preparación D. sus productos como, azúcar y almidón en kilos (50), huevos en javas, manteca, harina en bolsas y otros mas.  

Rosa, toma las decisiones en las ganancias D. su negocio. En lo personal, nos cuenta que ahora es una mujer independiente, segura y responsable con el pago D. sus cuotas. Manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer, y también por ayudar a otras mujeres que sueñan con salir adelante.
texts.en:
Rosa Elvira belongs to the Ciudad D. los Tres Pisos Community Bank. She lives on Jr. Antonio Díaz Padilla S/Nº, Lamas province, San Martín department. She is 47, married, and has two children who are no longer dependent upon her. Rosita started her business of making sweets with 500 PEN and her own initiative. She prepares and bakes her “rosquillas” (a regional cookie specialty) with sweetener and salt, puddings, cakes, and other sweets in an area set up in the garden of her house. That is where she has her main working tool, her oven. This location is also where she shows and sells her products. She currently continues with the same business. Her sweets sales are going very well for her. She offers them to different mini markets in the city, and she has a loyal client base. With this loan for 2,000 PEN she will buy supplies to make her products. She will purchase supplies like sugar and starch in kilos (50), cartons of eggs, shortening, bags of flour, and more. Rosa makes the decisions about the earnings from her business. She is now an independent woman, self-confident and responsible about making her payments. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a businesswoman and as a woman. She is also grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping other women who dream of getting ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies (sugar, starch, cartons of eggs, shortening, and others) to prepare her sweets

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Manuel de Jesús Hernández Velásquez , tiene la edad de 50 años , habita en el barrio San Caralampio , junto a su compañera de vida , la cual le poya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen seis hijos , dos le apoyan con los trabajos agrícolas y cuatro estudian ,los planes hacia su familia es mejorar su cocina ya que esta muy vieja , don Manuel desde hace 25 años , trabaja como agricultor , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento y las plagas que afectan al cultivo .El inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de sus padres , los planes futuro hacia el cultivo es poder realizar acequias de ladera . Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo y poder lograr una buena cosecha y vender a mejor precio en elmercado.
texts.en:
Manuel de Jesús Hernández Velásquez is 50 years old and lives in the San Caralampio neighborhood with his life partner who helps him with household expenses. They have six children; two help with the agricultural work, and four study. For his family’s sake he hopes to make improvements to his kitchen that is too old. For the past 25 years, Manuel has worked as a farmer; the biggest difficulty that he faces is a lack of financing and the pests that affect his crop. He began working as a farmer with the support of his parents. His future plan for his crops is to be able to make irrigation channels. With the loan he will purchase fertilizers and supplies to apply to his crop to be able to harvest a good crop to sell for better prices in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies and fertilizer to apply to his crop to obtain a good harvest.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
La señora Irene, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Ciudad de los tres Pisos”, vive en el Jr. Alfonso Ugarte Nº 254, Provincia de Lamas Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 38 años, 01 hija pequeña que aun depende de ella.

Irene, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de panes, cuenta con su propia panadería y nos comenta que para empezar tuvo que pasar por muchas dificultades, empezó con pocos panes y ahora ya tiene un negocio establecido en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado tanto para ella como para sus clientes, esta muy orgullosa y contenta por haber salido adelante con el apoyo de Manuela Ramos que la ayudo bastante a mejorar su servicio.

En la actualidad continua con la venta de panes y tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden a su casa a comprar sus panes y es ella quien personalmente las atiende con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,800.00, lo invertirá comprando harina y azúcar en sacos, levaduras, manteca, huevos en javas y otros. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá pagando la cuota inicial de su amazadora eléctrica, herramienta principal para preparar sus panes.

Hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada y con el apoyo de su esposo salieron adelante y hoy se siente con ganas de hacer realidad sus demás sueños.
texts.en:
Mrs. Irene is a member of the communal bank “Ciudad de los tres Pisos.” She lives in Jr. Alfonso Ugarte # 254, in the Lamas province of San Martín. She is a 38-year-old mother of a small daughter. Irene bakes and sells bread for a living. She has her own bakery, but tells us that if was very difficult starting out. She was only able to sell a few loaves of bread at first, but now she has an established business located in her home. She has put in air conditioning, for both herself and her clients, and is very happy and proud to have come this far with Manuela Ramos’ support. Manuela Ramos really helped her improve her business. She continues to sell bread and has loyal clients who come to her house everyday to buy bread. She takes care of her clients personally with her habitual charm. With this loan of 1,800 soles, she will buy sacks of sugar and flour as well as baking powder, lard, eggs, and other things. She will also use part of the money to make the first payment for her electric mixer – a key appliance for baking bread. Today she feels like a very accomplished woman who together with her husband has gotten ahead. Now she wants to make her other dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprara insumos (harina y azúcar en sacos, manteca, levaduras y huevos en javas) para preparar sus panes.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana A. is married and has 4 dependants. She has received schooling through junior high. Juliana sells cookies and meat pies at Sekondi, which she has done since 1997. Her husband is a teacher. Juliana uses her income for feeding the family. Juliana will use the loan to support her business, towards the making of cookies. With the new profits from her expanded business, Juliana plans to reinvest into the business.

loans.use: To support her business in the making of cookies.

loans.name: Rossana

texts.es:
Rossana, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cuidad de los Tres Pisos”, vive en el la Cuidad de Lamas, Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 35 años y 01 hijo estudiante, que aún depende de ella.

Desde hace muchos años se dedica a la agricultura, nos cuenta que se inicio sembrando sus plantones de plátanos en su propia chacra.
Personalmente se encarga de cuidar sus plantones de plátanos, pero cuenta con peones que la ayudan a sembrar y cosechar sus plátanos. Se inicio con S/. 300.00 y poco a poco fue ahorrando, en la actualidad su chacra tiene más de doscientos plantones de plátanos, producto que en la selva se consume a diario en las familias.

Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00, comprara plantones de plátanos, abono especial para mejorar el crecimiento de los plátanos. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en el pago a sus peones que la ayudan a cosechar sus plátanos, ya que mensualmente le salen de 80 a 100 racimos de plátanos. 

Uno de sus sueños y metas por lograr, es implementar una bodega grande con abarrotes, para generar más sus ingresos y continuar aportando en la economía de su hogar.

Hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciarse en el trabajo que realiza y también a muchas mujeres que quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Rossana belongs to the "Ciudad de los Tres Pisos" Communal Bank. She lives in the city of Lamas, in Lamas province, Department of San Martín. She is 35 years old and lives with her common-law husband and her son, who is in school. For many years now Rossana has made a living through farming. She tells us that she started out by planting banana trees on her own farm. Rossana personally takes charge of caring for her banana trees, but she hires agricultural workers to help her plant and harvest the bananas. She started out with 300.00 soles and gradually saved her money. Currently her farm has more than two hundred banana trees; bananas are a product that families here in the rainforest consume daily. She will use this loan of 3,000.00 soles to purchase more banana trees, along with a special fertilizer that will improve the bananas' growth. She will also invest part of the money in paying the agricultural workers who help her to harvest the bananas, since every month they pick from 80 to 100 bunches of bananas. One of Rossana's dreams and aspirations is to set up a large grocery store so that she can generate more income and continue contributing to the household income. Rossana now feels that she is a very accomplished woman who wants to achieve and make her dreams a reality. She is grateful for the help that the Manuela Ramos organization gave her in starting her business, along with the many other women who want to grow their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing banana trees

loans.name: Akpene

texts.fr: Akpene M. est une jeune femme de 29 ans, mariée et mèré d’un enfant. elle est détentrice d’un bar à Lomé. Depuis 3 ans, l’ambition d’Akpene est de créer un dépôt de boissons. Avec ce crédit, Akpene réalisera ses ambitions. Ce secteur est très prometteur à cause de la forte demande.
texts.en:
Akpene M. is a young woman, 29 years old, married, and the mother of one child. She has a bar in Lomé. For three years, her ambition has been to establish a beverages outlet. With this loan, she will realize her ambitions. This field is very promising due to the strong demand.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To renovate and supply her business

loans.name: Latifatou

texts.fr: Latifatou S. est une jeune femme de  31 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. elle est revendeuse de tissus basins à Lomé. Latifatou exerce ce commerce depuis 5 ans. Avec ce premier crédit de FECECAV, elle souhaite améliorer la capacité de son activité en approvisionnant son magasin de nouveaux produits. Ce qui lui permettra de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Latifatou S. is a 31-year-old woman, young, married, and the mother of two. She is a retailer of damask fabrics in Lomé. She has been in this business for five years. With this FECECAV loan, she would like to improve her business capacity by stocking her store with new products. This will enable her to satisfy the demands of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics for resale

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Yawa T. est une femme de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. elle est revendeuse de tissus au grand marché de Lomé. Yawa exerce ce métier de puis 8 ans et maîtrise bien tous les rouages. Pour relancer son activité, Yawa désire avec ce crédit alimenter sa boutique avec de nouveaux produits. Cette aubaine lui permettra de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Yawa T. is a 38-year-old woman, married, and the mother of two. She is a retailer of fabrics at the grand marketplace of Lomé. She has been in this business for eight years and has a good command of all its fine points. To reinvigorate her business, she would like to use this loan to supply her shop with new products. This great opportunity will enable her to provide for family better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth for resale

loans.name: Rita Marina

texts.en: Mrs. Rita G. lives with Mr. Emmanuel Aguayo.  They are both excellent, hard-working people, who have opened up an internet café in their neighborhood. The café has eight computers set up for clients. They are trying to develop their business by buying more computers in order to satisfy the demand of their clients. Rita began working with three computers and is expanding her business to an excellent level.

loans.use: The purchase of computers.

loans.name: Bakary

texts.fr: bakary F. est un maitre tailleur marie habitant la cite shell n030 qui a fait plus de dix ans dans le metier.il travaille dans le marche de dalifot avec ses apprentis tailleurs.il emprunte 200 000frs et ce financement lui permetra d'acheter des tissus qui apres confection seront destines a la vente.cette innovation dans son activite lui permettra de gagner plus de 100 000frs par mois.par consequent bakary aura l'opportunite d'augmenter son capital et de mieux veiller a l'entrtien de sa famille.
texts.en:
Bakary F. is a master tailor, married and living in the Cite Shell n030 who has worked for more than 10 years in his trade. He works at the Dalifot market with his apprentices. He is borrowing 200,000 Frs and this loan will permit him to buy fabrics that he will make into garments which will then be sold. This innovation in his business will permit him to earn more than 100,000 Frs per month. Consequently, Bakary will be able to increase his working capital and better support his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying cloth to sew into garments for sale

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es: Flor D. María R. D. T. D. 43 años D. edad resiD. en Ciudad Delgado, vive junto a sus tres hijos y su esposo. Ella posee un negocio en el cual se encarga D.  hacer comida para vender, así también comercializa ropa para niños y adultos. Flor D. María solícita un préstamo el cual le permita comprar más verduras, granos básicos para la elaboración D. los alimentos, así también desea comprar más ropa, D. manera que pueda ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes. Su mayor deseo es poder aumentar sus ventas y poder mejorar su económica familiar.
texts.en:
Flor D. María R. D. T. is 43 years old and lives in Ciudad Delgado with her three children and her husband. She runs a business making and selling food, and also sells clothing for children and adults.
Flor D. María is requesting a loan that will allow her to purchase more vegetables and basic grains used in making her dishes, as well as more clothing so she can offer her customers greater variety.
Her greatest wish is to be able to increase her sales and improve her family’s economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables, basic grains and clothing

location.town: Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San  Salvador

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Mrs. Juliana is 69 years old and is married to Mr. Jasinto Rolon. They live in the Alegre neighborhood of the city Caacupe, and work together in a religious articles store. 

The business is located next to the Basilica de Caacupe, which is the large cathedral in the city. Their store has been open for more than 17 years, as it is in a strategic location. Mrs. Juliana has a lot of business on Sundays, but also has a well-established clientele in Asunción, where she sells her traditional Paraugayan thermoses, which are made out of leather.  
Mrs. Juliana travels twice a month to purchase her merchandise in Brazil, where the prices of her articles are much lower.  Even though her sales have decreased slightly in the past couple months because of the crisis, she is still earning a steady income, and likes to work. 

The credit she is given will be for the purchase of religious items, and she thanks the Fundación Paraguaya for trusting her with a loan.

loans.use: The purchase of merchandise such as religious articles, and traditional Paraguayan items.

loans.name: Bilda Marisol

texts.es: Bilda Marisol M. D. G. D. 36 años D. edad resiD. en Ilopango junto a su esposo y cuatro hijos. DesD. hace 12 años ella posee una pequeña librería y una venta D. perfumes y cosméticos, los cuales logra venderlos con mucha facilidad. Bilda solícita un préstamo ya que uno D. sus mayores sueños es poder surtir su librería y poder equiparla con todo lo que los clientes demanden, así también desea crecer más en el negocio D. los cosméticos es por esto que a través D. dicho préstamo espera comprar más D. estos últimos.
texts.en:
Bilda Marisol M. D. G. is 36 years old and lives in Ilopango with her husband and 4 children.
She has owned a bookstore for 12 years and also offers perfumes and cosmetics that sell well.
Bilda is requesting a loan because one of her greatest dreams is to stock her bookstore with everything her customers want. She also wants to expand her cosmetics business and she hopes that this loan will allow her to do so.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bookstore items and cosmetics

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Reyna Isabel R. de 48 años  de edad reside en San Martín junto a su esposo. Ella se dedica a la venta de jugos, golosinas, productos de uso personal, cereales, etcétera. Reyna solicita un préstamo ya que desea ver prosperar su negocio y aumentar sus ventas, ella desea comprar al mayoreo todos los productos que son  necesarios para surtir su tienda y mejorar sus condiciones de vida a través de las ganancias que obtenga.
texts.en:
Reyna Isabel R. is 48 years old and lives in San Martín with her husband. She sells juices, sweets, personal care products, cereals, etc. Reyna is requesting a loan because she wants to see her business prosper and increase her sales. She wants to buy products wholesale to stock her business and, through the earnings she gains, improve her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products to stock her store

loans.name: Mirna

texts.en:
Mirna is 30 years old and single. She started working as a traveling salesperson five years ago. She now has 400 clients with whom she works on credit. She provides merchandise according to what each client needs. Her father also worked in this trade, passing on the family business. 

With the loans she has received from Fundación Paraguaya, a Kiva partner, she has been able to expand her market and satisfy the needs of her clients. She has seen an increase in her income and has bought two motorcycles to help her work.  

Even though she is now living out of her parents’ home, she still contributes to her family’s expenses in order to cover any needs her younger brothers and sisters might have.

loans.use: For the purchase of garments for women, men and children

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.en:
Mr. Arnaldo M. is 27 years old, single and lives with his mother in the city of Carapeguá. At age 14 he began to sell mattresses that his mother made. Six years later he began his own business selling and delivering handicrafts to the cities of Altos, San Bernardino and Cordillera by a motorcycle that he was able to buy with income from his job.  He also has to support and care for his mother, who is dependent on him. 

He is applying for the loan in order to purchase merchandise.

loans.use: The purchase of merchandise such as comforters, sheets, hammocks, etc.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en: Mrs. Aurelia González is 59 years old and is married to Mr. Miguel Angel, with whom she has a 22-year-old son who is enrolled at the local university.  They live in their own home in the San José district of Carapeguá. More than 20 years ago, Aurelia started purchasing and raising farm animals.  She inherited this business from her father, and with much sacrifice and dedication, has managed to progress.  Now, her son manages the business, and is very successful.  The credit will be used to buy horses.

loans.use: To purchase horses

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Mr. Cesar B. is 30 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the city of Carapeguá. As he comes from a humble family and he has a strong desire to progress, he decided to begin his own small business.  He began selling clothes and shoes in the urban area of the city, and in just a small amount of time he became successful. 
He gathered a small amount of capital to begin to purchase a larger variety of articles to bring to sell in the capital of the country, Asunción, where he already has a well-formed clientele.  Thanks to his work and efforts, he was able to purchase a motorcycle that he uses to deliver his sales and get more clients. He applied for the loan in order to buy more merchandise to sell (comforters, tablecloths, and sheets).

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise (comforters, tablecloths and sheets)

loans.name: Cristian Rene

texts.es: El joven Cristian Rene R. B. tiene 30 años de edad. Es un hombre casado. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica es la venta de ropa y farmacos . Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio. Inicio por que no tenía un trabajo y decide ofrecer su ropa en las calles,ademas  Cristian ofrece medicinas para ofrecerles a sus clientes de ambos prodcutos, es una persona muy responsable por lo que recorre las calles con mucho entusiasmo. El financiamiento que solicita es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa nueva y medicinas para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. El deseo de Cristian es que su negocio se mantenga activo y proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Cristian Rene R. B. is 30 years old and married with 3 children.
He makes a living selling clothing and pharmaceuticals, and has done so for over 9 years. He started selling clothing as a street vendor because he was out of work. Cristian also sells medicines so that he can offer his customers a variety of products. He is a very responsible person which is why he goes about his work with great enthusiasm.
The loan he is requesting will be used as working capital to purchase new clothing and medicines to satisfy customer demand. Cristian hopes that his business continues to thrive so that he can make improvements on his home.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.en:
Mr. Carlos F. is from the city of Carapeguá and lives in the F. Isla district.  He has been selling articles typical of the area such as comforters and other products around the area of Ciudad del Este, Caaguazu and other neighboring cities. 
He has two deliverymen who help him provide his merchandise to about 300 different clients. 
Mr. Carlos is a very independent and hardworking person.  He appreciates the trust that the Fundación Paraguaya has given him, from the first moment until now, as without capital he could not do his job. 
He is applying for credit in order to buy comforters and clothes for the winter.

loans.use: To purchase comforters

loans.name: Ada Erlinda

texts.es: Ada Erlinda T. M. tiene 32 años de edad. Tiene 2 hijos. La actividad  económica de Ada es venta de comida. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio. Inicio este negocio estableciendo una pequeña mesa en las afueras de su vivienda por las noches, empezó con la elaboración de tacos, enchiladas, gallo pinto, huevos entre otras cosas, al ver que con este oficio su familia podía subsistir decide trabajar con los financiamientos para salir adelante y estos le han ayudado con su negocio. Es por eso que este financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materiales para cocina, granos básicos, frutas y verduras. El sueño de Ada es preparar a sus hijos y que su negocio sea el mejor.
texts.en:
Ada Erlinda T. M. is 32-years old and has 2 children. Ada's work activity is selling food, which she has done for more than 6 years. She started this business by setting up a table in front of her house at night and selling tacos, enchiladas, 'gallo pinto' (a dish of mixed rice and beans, called 'mottled rooster'), and eggs, among other things. Upon seeing that her family could live off the income from this work, she decided to seek financing to advance and help her with the business. This financing that she requests is for working capital, to buy kitchen materials, staple grains, fruits and vegetables. Ada's dream is to prepare her children and her business, so that they improve.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
La señora Rosmery, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cuidad de los Tres Pisos”, vive en Jr. Ancohallo Nº 216, Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 55 años, madre de 05 hijos ya independientes.
