Es docente de Inicial, en un principio estuvo trabajando y ejerciendo su carrera, pero nos comenta que dejo de trabajar, ya que se quedo sin puesto de trabajo.
Le nace la idea de independizarse y generar sus propios ingresos, así que decidió implementar su negocio de venta de comidas, poco a poco fue ganando experiencia en este tipo de actividad y haciéndose muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.  
En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio atendiendo a sus clientes que a diario acuden a su restaurant y es ella quien personalmente los atiende con su rica sazón y el carisma alegre que tiene. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando arroz y azúcar en sacos, diversas verduras,  huevos y pollos en javas. También comprará algunos utensilios de cocina, para reemplazar a los que tiene actualmente y así brindar un mejor servicio de atención a sus clientes. 

Rosmery, se siente muy segura y con ganas de seguir adelante y asegurarse una  vida tranquila y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Señora Rosmery belongs to the communal bank, "Cuidad de los Tres Pisos," and lives in the province of Lamas in the department of San Martín. She is single, is 55-years-old, and is the mother of 5 children who are already independent. She is a preschool teacher. At first she was working but she tells us that she stopped working since she lost her job. She had the idea to become independent and generate her own income, which is why she decided to start a business of selling food. Little by little she earned experience in this work and now she is very well-known and loved by her customers. Currently she continues with her same business attending to her customers who come to her restaurant daily. She personally attends to them with her good cooking and charisma. With this loan of 2,000 PEN, she hopes to invest in the purchase of rice and sugar in sacks, various types of vegetables, eggs, and chickens. She also will buy kitchen utensils to replace those she has currently and to be able to offer better service to her customers. Rosmery feels very certain that she will get ahead and has a strong desire to do so. She wants to secure a peaceful life, and she is thankful to Manuela Ramos for contributing to her being able to fulfill her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase supplies (rice, sugar, and various types of vegetables) to prepare her food.

loans.name: Edelio

texts.en: Mr. Edelio B. is from the city of Carapeguá and lives with Mrs. Maria, with whom he has a son.  He is a veterinarian and has been self-employed for more than 15 years. In the rural areas, he carries out vaccinations of animals and has many clients, so he travels for his job. The credit applied for will be used for the purchase of veterinary medicines.

loans.use: To purchase vaccines for animals

loans.name: Alicia Catalina

texts.es: Alicia Catalina Núñez tiene tiene 66 años de edad. Es una mujer casada.  La actividad económica es la venta de comida. Hace más de 30 años que se dedica a este negocio. Alicia inicio este negocio vendiendo 15 platos de comida al día, Alicia tiene que realizar los quehaceres de su casa y además tiene que realizar la compra en el mercado, y trasladar todos los productos hasta su vivienda, por lo que ella misma realiza la elaboración de la comida. Todos los días empieza su mañana con alegría al saber que realizara lo que mas le gusta la comida. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, carne, gaseosas, refrescos naturales y verduras. El sueño de Alicia es no poseer ninguna enfermedad par que le permita seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
Alicia Catalina Núñez is 66-years old and married. Her work activity is selling food, which she has done for more than 30 years. Alicia started this business selling 15 plates of food a day. She has to do household chores and shopping, then bring everything from the market to her house where she makes the food herself. Everyday she begins her morning happily, knowing that she will make good food. The financing she requests is for working capital, to purchase staple grains, meat, soft drinks, juice and vegetables. Alicia's dream is to say healthy so that she can continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador de 55 años de edad, siempre quiso tener una bonita boda, pero las circunstancias económicas no lo permitieron, por ello viene viviendo con su pareja con la que formó una familia con 3 hijos, de los cuales, uno de ellos ya formó su propio hogar fuera de casa. Desde hace muchos años se dedica a cultivar café y piña, pero los últimos 5 años ha preferido inclinarse por la compra y venta de frutas, por lo que diariamente madruga para ir en busca de las frutas, comprarlas a los mismo agricultores y venderlas, de ese modo acumula mayores ingresos para su casa. Los años de realizar esta actividad le han dado la posibilidad de conocer a los comerciantes mayoristas, por lo que ya no tiene que estar ofreciendo sus productos; sino que directo de las chacras entrega su carga a sus clientes. Su estrategia es de estar en constante contacto con los mayoristas, para no perder su capital de trabajo si alguno cambia de proveedor. Para un futuro cercano, Alejandro desea comprar un terreno en la ciudad para construir una casa con mayores comodidades para su familia. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, en los ciclos anteriores fue muy puntal en cada una de sus cuotas y espera poder serlo en este nuevo préstamo. Él es el integrante varón de mayor edad en su grupo, por tal, el más respetado por el resto de socios, siendo nombrado fiscal de su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita incrementará su capital de trabajo para su negocio de compra y venta de frutas y con otro tanto comprará fertilizantes para sus chacras de café.
texts.en:
Alejandro is a very responsible and hard-working 55-year-old man. He always wanted to have a beautful wedding, but because of economic circumstances, he wasn't able to. This is why he is living with his long-time girlfriend with whom he formed a family. They have three children, and one of them has formed his own family already. He has grown coffee and pineapple for many years, but in the last five years he has started to buy and sell fruit. He gets up very early every day to search for fruit, buying them from the same farmers so he can sell them. In this way he makes better income for his home. Because he has done this for many years, he has met wholesalers, so he doesn't have to go around selling his products anymore; he just goes directly to his wholesaler customers and delivers his products. His strategy is to be in constant contact with the wholesalers so he doesn't lose his working capital by one of them switching suppliers. In the near future, Alejandro hopes to buy some land in the city to build a house with more comfort for his family. This is his fifth loan with Microfinanzas Prismas. He is the oldest male member in his group, so he is very respected by the other members. He is the financial chairman of his communal bank. With the money he is requesting, he will increase his merchandise for his fruit business and will purchase fertilizer for his coffee fields.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his investment capital

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es: Felipe es el líder de su comunidad; tiene 54 años, está felizmente casado con la madre de sus 5 hijos, quienes viven fuera. Ahora se ha quedado al cuidado de su nieta de 6 años, que es su adoración y quien llena de felicidad los días de su vida. Conversando con él nos contó sobre su pena por el abandono de su nieta por parte de su hija, que cuando la niña pregunta por su madre, él se siente impotente ante la realidad. Por ello, busca en el trabajo una forma de olvidar esta circunstancia; junto a su esposa, atiende la bodega que tienen en su casa, que es la fuente de ingresos primordial para su familia, por lo que invierte, dentro de sus posibilidades, para el incremento de los productos que ofrece. Pero lo que más le gusta a Felipe son los trabajos agrícolas, aunque por ahora no pueda realizarlos, ha decidido entonces retomar su trabajo como carpintero, oficio que realizaba en su juventud. Para ello, al costado de su bodega, va a implementar un local muy amplio para su taller, donde pueda hacerse muy conocido y gane clientela rápidamente. Este es el quinto crédito que tiene con MFP, durante los periodos pasados demostró responsabilidad  de pago; asimismo su cargo como secretario lo ha cumplido cabalmente, siendo reelegido por sus compañeros, por lo que promete hacer cumplir todos los acuerdos escritos en el libro de actas de su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita lo va a invertir en la compra de abarrotes para su tienda y con otra parte, planea comprar madera para su carpintería.
texts.en:
Felipe is the leader of his community. He is 54 years of age and happily married to the mother of his five children who are living elsewhere. Now he has only to care for his six-year-old granddaughter who he adores and who fills each day of his life with happiness. Conversing with us, he told us about his sorrow at her abandonment by his daughter; how when she asked for her mother, he felt impotent in the face of this reality. And so, he seeks in his work a way of forgetting this situation. Together with his wife, he tends the store that they have in their house and which is the primary source of income for their family. He invests in it, within his abilities, in order to increase the products that they offer. But what pleases Felipe most are the agricultural jobs. Although for now he has not been able to do them, he has decided to resume his work as a carpenter, which he did as a young man. To do so, aside from his grocery store, he is going to set up a very large area for his workshop, where he can make himself well known and win customers quickly. This is the fifth loan that he has had with Microfinanzas PRISMA. During his past terms he was responsible in making payments. At the same time he fulfilled his duties as Secretary capably and was re-elected by his partners and he has promised to fulfill all of the written agreements in his Communal Bank's Minutes Book. The money that he is requesting will be used to purchase groceries for his store, and with part of it going to buy lumber for his carpentry.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his merchandise.

loans.name: Gerardo Andrés

texts.en: Mr. Gerardo is 22 years old, single and lives in the city of Carapeguá in the San José district.  He lives with his parents in their own home. After he finished high school, Gerardo started his own small grocery store, and with his income, he has been able to sustain the daily expenses of his family.  He has not been able to afford going to college, as it would require more money than he can save right now. With this credit, he will buy sugar and herbs.

loans.use: The purchase of sugar and herbs

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es: El Señor Gilberto C. R. tiene la edad de 50 años, es un hombre casado. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica de Gilberto es la compra y venta de cerdos. Primeramente se dedicaba a la venta de gallinas, posteriormente con las ganancias logro comprar un cerdo a un precio accesible, por lo que este negocio le gusto mas y las ganancias de eran mejores, el recorre las comunidades en busca de cerdos que le generen muy buenas ganancias, es por eso que puso todo su esfuerzo para no abandonar este trabajo que lo ayudo a salir adelante y proporciónale a su familia el alimento diario. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de compra de cerdos. Su sueño es preparar a sus hijo  con una excelente educación para que no pase por las dificultades que el atraveso.
texts.en:
Gilberto C. R., age 50, is married and has three dependent children. He makes his living buying and selling pigs. He started out selling hens. With the profits, he bought a pig that was affordable. He liked that business better, and it was more profitable.

He travels around buying pigs in the villages. The business is profitable and he worked hard to make it a success and put food on the table for his family. He wants the loan for working capital to buy pigs. His dream is to give his children an excellent education so that they don't have to face the difficulties that he experienced.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Leongina

texts.en: Mrs. Leongina is from the city Quiindy and is 50 years old.  She is married to Mr. Juan. He has helped her raise her children, who are now all older. Leongina has always worked selling milk and raising different types of animals that she later sells in the area.  She has more than thirty years of experience in this industry.  Today she has a well-formed farm that is named Granja E.. She is applying for a loan to buy more land for her animals to graze.

loans.use: To purchase more land for grazing

loans.name: Edmith

texts.es:
La señora Edmith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Ciudad de los Tres Pisos”, vive en la Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 45 años, 02 hijos, que están estudiando y aún dependen de ella.

Deseando ver profesionales a sus hijos y tener sus propios ingresos, decidió emprender su propio negocio de venta de comida. Nos cuenta que desde hace muchos años atrás viene dedicándose a este tipo de actividad y en su trayectoria paso por muchas dificultades, pero sus ganas de seguir adelante y su vigor que siempre la ha caracterizado, le ha valido para que hoy en día sea una madre responsable que se preocupa por sus hijos.
En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y le va muy bien, tiene sus clientes fijos y es muy conocida por la buena sazón de sus comidas.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00, lo invertirá comprando insumos para sus preparados como: sacos de arroz y azúcar, pollos y huevos en javas, plátanos en racimos, fideos y aceites por docenas, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  

Se siente con muchas fuerzas para seguir con sus ventas de comidas, sueña con implementar su propio Restaurant bien acondicionado para brindar a sus clientes un mejor servicio y atención. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Edmith belongs to the "Ciudad de los Tres Pisos" community bank and lives in the San Martín department. She is single, age 45, and has two children who are studying and depend on her. Out of a desire to give her children a profession and obtain her own income, she started up a business selling food. She has been in the business for a long time and has experienced many difficulties, but she succeeded because of her drive and hard work; she is now a hard-working mother who looks after her children. Her business is doing well now, and she has a stable client base; she is well known for her tasty food. She will use the $500 loan to buy ingredients for the food she cooks, such as: sacks of rice and sugar, chickens and eggs, bunches of plantain, noodles and oil, as well as cooking utensils to improve the quality of her service. She is very keen to maintain her food business, and her ambition is to open her own restaurant so as to provide her clients with better service. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos movement for helping her make her dreams come true and to achieve her goals.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients (rice, sugar, chickens and eggs, noodles, oil, etc.) for the food she cooks

loans.name: Alba Marina

texts.es: Alba Marina Z. P. tiene 51 años de edad, es una mujer casada. Tiene 4 hijos a su cargo y todos estudian con el duro esfuerzo que Alba realiza. Su actividad económica es una librería. Hace más de 28 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Sus inicios nacieron por que necesitaba proporcionarles a sus hijos el estudio para que ellos salgan adelante, y el día de mañana no pase por las dificultades que ella paso, además que esto no le impide salir adelante con su familia. Y es así como solicita este financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de más útiles escolares para su librería como cuadernos, lápices, lapiceros, borradores, reglas y marcadores. El sueño de Alba es mantener su actividad económica y mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Alba Marina Z. P. is 51 years old, and is a married woman. She is responsible for her four children, who are all in school, working with the same great effort as Alba. She has run a paper goods shop for 28 years, which she started because she needed to provide her children schooling so they would be able to get ahead and not undergo the same hardships that she did. She will use the loan requested as working capital to purchase more school supplies such as notebooks, pencils, pens, erasers, rulers, and markers. Alba's dream is to keep her business going and improve the quality of her life.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina tiene 40 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y madre de 9 hijos; de los cuales, 5 viven con ella en su casa, la cual construyó su esposo con la ayuda de ella. Su mayor anhelo, desde hace años atrás, es tener varias chacras cafetaleras, ahora con la ayuda de su esposo siente que está a punto de alcanzar su sueño, por lo que trabaja arduamente en sus plantaciones de café, plátano y piña. Para que le alcance el tiempo se levanta a las 4.00am para preparar el desayuno y el almuerzo, a eso de las 8.00am está partiendo a sus chacras en compañía de su esposo, lo que le parece muy placentero. A Marcelina le gusta realizar los trabajos agrícolas, ama a cada uno de sus cultivos, puesto que sabe que gracias a su dedicación y cuidado le resultarán muy rentables. Por ello inculca y enseña a sus hijos a trabajar con seriedad y responsabilidad, ya que mediante la agricultura adquirieron sus bienes materiales; tales como su casa y terrenos cultivables, asimismo les brindaron comodidad a sus hijos. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, durante los ciclos anteriores ha trabajado responsablemente en sus pagos, asimismo en el cargo de presidenta de su banco comunal. En este tiempo demostró rigor y seriedad en la cobranza de los montos de cada integrante, quienes la respetan mucho. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de nitrato y potasio (fertilizantes) para abonar sus chacras de café y de plátanos; con otro tanto piensa invertir en la compra de plantas nuevas de plátanos morados.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 40 years of age, a very hardworking woman and the mother of nine children. Five of them live with her in her house which her husband built with her help. Her greatest wish, over the past years, is to have several fields for coffee growing. Now with the help of her husband she feels that the time has come to realize her dream, and she is working hard at this in her fields of coffee, plantain and pineapple. In order to make hay while the sun shines, she gets up at 4am to prepare breakfast and lunch, so that by 8am she is leaving for the fields accompanied by her husband who always seems so agreeable. Marcelina likes doing agricultural work, she loves every one of her crops since she knows that thanks to her dedication and care they will turn out to be very profitable. And thus she instills in her children and teaches them to work seriously and responsibly since by means of agriculture the have acquired their materials rewards, such as their house and farmland and at the same time provided a comfortable life for her children. This is her fifth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and during the previous cycles, she has been responsible with her payments and also in her role as President of her Communal Bank. During this time she has been rigorous and serious in the collection of accounts from each participant, who all have great respect for her. The funds that she is requesting are for the purchase of nitrates and potassium fertilizers in order to fortify her coffee and plantain fields. A portion will also be invested in the purchase of purple plantain seedlings.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Desde los 16 años Maria vive con su pareja con quien tiene una pequeña niña, hace un mes cumplió 22 años y desde hace un año pudo construir su propia casa a base de madera. Durante los 6 años de convivencia con su pareja han venido trabajando ambos en las chacras de sus suegros, de ese modo han logrado realizar buenas cosechas de piña y plátanos que una vez comercializados le han generado muy buenas ganancias, que han sido el origen de comprar su terreno y construir su casa. Pero ahora, debido a que su hija está enferma Maria se queda en casa para su cuidado, por lo que extraña mucho su trabajo. Por esta razón están planeado implementar una tienda de abarrotes en su casa para que ella pueda atenderla sin descuidar el cuidado de su hija. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, con los préstamos anteriores ha ido creciendo en su negocio poco a poco, por ello estima mucho a su banco comunal que le ha brindado un apoyo incondicional, donde tiene la consigna de no fallar el pago de ninguna cuota. El dinero solicitado lo piensa invertir en la compra de abono para sus cultivos y golosinas para su tienda.
texts.en:
Maria has lived with her partner and their little daughter since she was 16 years old. Maria turned 22 last month, and a year ago was able to build her own wooden house. During the six years she's been living with her partner, they have been working on his parents' farm. They have had good harvests of pineapples and bananas, which have generated excellent profits and enabled her to buy land and a build a house. But now her daughter is sick and Maria is staying at home to take care of her. She misses working a lot, so they're planning to open a grocery store in their house so she can run it without neglecting her daughter. This is her fifth loan with MFP. She has used prior loans to build her business little by little. She really appreciates her communal bank, which has offered her unconditional support, and she has never missed a single payment. She will use the requested loan to purchase fertilizer for the fields and snacks for her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Dodith

texts.es:
La señora Dodith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Ciudad de los tres Pisos”, vive en la Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 48 años y 04 hijos, 01 aún depende de ella ya que es escolar.

En su mayor tiempo se dedica a la agricultura ya que cuenta con una chacra, donde tiene cultivos de diferentes tipos de verduras y frutas, que siembra en sus épocas de estación, para luego cosecharlas, y venderlas. Pero también comparte este negocio con la venta de leña seca el cuál lo ofrece a las panaderías para calentar los hornos.

Se inicio con 300.00,  con la idea de generar sus propios ingresos económicos en su hogar, por lo que hoy en día continúa con el mismo negocio pero ya en mayores cantidades y variedades de  productos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00, lo invertirá comprando semillas de frutas y verduras, para seguir sembrando y cosechando sus productos, es muy conocida por sus clientes, cuenta con un puesto en el Mercado de la Ciudad donde vende sus productos. Parte del dinero también invertirá, comprando tercios de leña, para luego venderlas.

Ella nos manifiesta su satisfacción por pertenecer al Banco Comunal de mujeres ya que le ha ayudado a superar dificultades que en algún momento tuvo que pasar pero que ahora los enfrenta con mucha fortaleza.
texts.en:
Dodith belongs to the "Ciudad de los Tres Pisos" (The Three Story City) Village Bank. She lives in the Province of De Lamas in the Department of San Martín. She's 48 and married with 4 children, one of whom is in school and still dependent. She earns her living primarily in agriculture; she has a farm where she grows different types of fruits and vegetables that she plants during their respective planting seasons and then harvests for sale. In addition, she sells dried firewood to bakeries so they can heat their ovens. Dodith started out with 300 soles, with thinking that she could generate her own income for her household. Nowadays she's still in the same business but she sells a greater quantity and variety of products. She plans to use this loan of 1000 soles to buy fruit and vegetable seeds so she can keep planting and harvesting her produce. She is very well-known by her clients; she has a stall at the City Market where she sells her products. She'll spend part of her loan on loads of wood to sell. Dodith says she is a satisfied member of her women's Village Bank since it has helped her overcome the difficulties she once had to endure but which she now faces with great strength.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetable seeds and loads of wood

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es: Marleny tiene 22 años, acaba da formar su familia y está esperando un hijo, por el momento están viviendo en la casa de sus suegros y tiene muchas ilusiones de emprender una nueva vida con su pareja. Al no contar con sus propias chacras, su madre le ha cedido una parte de sus tierras sembradas de café a punto de cosechar para que Marleny no pase carencias económicas. En consecuencia, ahora está esperando que el café se uniformice en sus frutos y proceda cosechar, mientras que va sembrando sus propios cultivos.  Durante toda su vida Marleny tuvo inclinación por los  trabajos agrícolas, ya que creció en este ambiente, además que considera que es una actividad muy rentable, a pesar de requerir mucha inversión, pero en las épocas de cosecha se recupera todo lo invertido. Con la siembra de sus propios productos planea ir ahorrando dinero para comprar sus propias tierras y terreno donde construir su casa. Para el futuro desea tener un negocio compra y venta de frutas muy próspero en la ciudad. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, se está integrando en el quinto ciclo de su banco comunal, por lo que hace compromisos de pagar responsablemente cada una de sus cuotas señalada por su asesora de crédito. Lo que más le atrae del trabajo con un banco comunal son los ahorros que realizan. El dinero que solicita lo utilizará para contratar peones que realicen la limpieza de las chacras donde sembrará sus primeras plantas cafetaleras.
texts.en:
Marleny is 22 and has just started her family, with a baby on the way. For the time being she and her husband are living with her in-laws, but she has hopes that they can start a new life together. Since she doesn't her own fields, Marleny was loaned some by her mother, planted with coffee that's just about ready to be harvested, so she won't be without income. Now she's waiting for the berries to ripen so she can harvest them, and in the meantime she's planting her own crops. For her entire life Marleny has had a penchant for farming since she grew up in that environment. Furthermore, she sees it as a very profitable business, and while it requires a big investment, that's all recouped at harvest time. By planting her own produce she plans to save money to buy her own land and a plot where she can build her house. In the future, Marleny hopes to have a thriving business in the city buying and selling fruits and vegetables. This will be her first loan with MFP, and she is joining her village bank's the fifth loan cycle, so she is committed to responsibly making each and every one of the payments scheduled by her loan advisor. What has attracted her most about working with a village bank are the savings she realizes. She plans to use her loan to hire laborers to clear the fields where she'll plant her first coffee bushes.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To hire laborers to clear her fields.

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: Rosa argentina Martínez S. tiene 39 años de edad. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Rosa se dedica a la actividad económica de venta de comida. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio. Inicio por sus hermanas ya que anteriormente, ellas se dedicaban al negocio pero ellas fallecieron y Rosa sabia muy bien el manejo de este negocio por lo que decide iniciar vendiendo comida en su vivienda, le fue muy difícil obtener clientes porque la dirección de la casa de Rosa es muy largo, pero esto no fue motivo para desanimarla, aun así Rosa conversa con sus clientes muy alegremente. Su deseo es establecer un restaurante para proporcionarle mas espacio a sus clientes y comodidad.
texts.en:
Rosa Argentina Martínez S. is 39 years old. She has three children. Rosa sells food for a living. She has been in this business for 7 years. The business was started by her sisters, but they passed away. Rosa knew how to manage the business well, so she decided to start selling food from her home. It has been very hard for her to attract customers because her house is very far away. However, this does not discourage her, and Rosa chats with her customers very happily. Her wish is to start a restaurant to provide more space for her customers' comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es: Rosalía acaba de cumplir 40 años, vive en su casa propia con sus 4 hijos que la apoyan en su negocio. Todos los días se acuesta muy tarde debido a que tiene un negocio de venta de comida al paso, en su carretilla pone las ollas de arroz chaufa y tallarines, bien abrigadas y se ubica en la calle principal de su pueblo donde las personas acuden a deleitarse con su sazón diariamente. Por las tardes, cuando el reloj marca a las 5.00pm ya es posible encontrarla en su lugar habitual, muy contenta conversando con sus clientes, ya que es eso lo que más le gusta de su negocio.  Rosalía anhela tener un espacio en su casa destinado para su negocio y de ese modo no pasar frió, además así les brindaría mayores comodidades a sus clientes. Ya son 15 años que lleva en este negocio y cree que es hora de crecer y mejorar su calidad de vida. En los 4 préstamos anteriores consecutivos con MFP no ha tenido ningún problema con sus pagos, ya que los ha cumplido con regularidad. En su banco comunal es muy activa y se preocupa por el bienestar de sus compañeros. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de un carrito salchipapero (estructura móvil dotada de una freidora de papas y pequeña parrilla), para que venda salchipapas (papas y salchichas fritas) en aras de captar mayores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Rosalia recently turned 40 years old. She lives in her own home with her 4 children who help run her business. Everyday she goes to sleep very late because she works as a fast food vendor. In her cart, arroz chaufa and noodles are kept warm in pots. She sells food on the main street of her town where people take delight in her daily flavorings. In the afternoons, when the clock strikes 5pm, you can find her in her usual spot, happily making conversation with her clients. This is the part of her business that she enjoys the most.

Rosalia longs to have a space in her home for her business, to no longer have to be outside in the cold and also be able to provide additional conveniences for her clients. It has been 15 years since she has started her business and she believes it is now time to expand and improve her quality of life. She has not had a single problem repaying each of the 4 previous consecutive loans that she received from MFP and has made her payments regularly. She is very active in her village bank and cares about the well-being of her peers. She is requesting a loan to purchase a salchipapas cart (a mobile structure equipped with a chip fryer and a small grill) so she can earn a higher income.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a food cart

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 45 años, vive desde hace 15 años con el padre de sus 4 hijos, quienes son el motivo de su trabajo y orgullo, ya que su hija mayor viene forjándose una carrera a base de mucha perseverancia. Los anhelos en su juventud eran de convertirse en una próspera comerciante en la venta de abarrotes, pero debido a las carencias económicas y al nacimiento de su primer hijo no pudo concretar su deseo. Desde entonces se dedica a las labores agrícolas en las tierras que heredó de sus padres, donde siembra plátanos, cítricos (naranjas, mandarinas) y piñas. Cuando hay cosechas de café trabaja como jornalera recolectando este fruto, por lo que le pagan 12 soles diarios; mientras que a su esposo 15 soles, ya que también transporta las fanegas de 60 kilos a los camiones. Pero cuando inicia su cosecha de piña, cada 15 días, retorna a sus chacras para  enviar sus frutas a los mercados de la ciudad de Lima. Yolanda es feliz con su trabajo, puesto  que gracias a éste acumula dinero para el sostenimiento de su hogar y de seguir con ese ritmo, tiene planificado comprar más terrenos para incrementar su producción y de ese modo hacer realidad sus sueños de juventud y mejorar su calidad de vida. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, durante los 4 ciclos pasados demostró puntualidad en cada una de sus cuotas, por ello que los demás integrantes le tiene mucha confianza, además es quien pone el orden en las reuniones de su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de 12 sacos de nitrato y urea (abono) para abonar sus chacras de piñas.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 45 years old and has lived with the father of her 4 children for 15 years. Her children are her driving force and also her pride; her eldest daughter is working hard to build a career for herself.
In her youth Yolanda dreamed of becoming a successful grocery shopkeeper, but due to a lack of funds and the birth of her first child she could not realise this dream. Since then she has worked the land she inherited from her parents, where she plants plantain, citrus fruits (oranges, tangerines) and pineapples.
During the coffee harvests she works as a day labourer picking coffee for 12 PEN a day while her husband makes 15 PEN since he also transports 60kg fanegas of coffee to the trucks. However, when her pineapple harvest starts, she returns to her farm every 15 days to send her fruit to the markets in Lima.
Yolanda is happy in her work because it generates enough money to support her household and maintain her life’s rhythm. She is planning to buy more lands to increase her production and thus make her childhood dream a reality and improve her quality of life.
This is her 15th loan with MFP. During her past 4 loan cycles she was punctual with each of her repayments and this is why her fellow communal bank members trust her to run their meetings. She will use the requested money to purchase 12 sacks of nitrate and urea fertilisers for her pineapple fields.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilisers

loans.name: Eddy Pantaleon

texts.es: Eddy Pantaleón A. C. tiene 44 años de edad. La actividad económica de Eddy es la venta y destace de cerdos. Hace más de 16 años que se dedica a este negocio. El inicio este negocio por su familia porque su Papa administraba y realizaba el destace de cerdo, y así como Eddy desde muy pequeño le gustaba el trabajo, con el paso del tiempo el logra comprar sus propios cerdos y destazarlos para la venta en su comarca, Eddy es muy famoso en su comarca por vender unos deliciosos nacatamales y conversa contento con sus clientes que es un trabajo muy difícil pero lo que mas le gusta es ver la cara de satisfacción de sus clientes. Y es así que decide realizar un financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de cerdos entre otros productos para la elaboración de sus nacatamales. El sueño de Eddy es tener su propio medio de transporte para sus animales.
texts.en:
Eddy Pantaleón A. C. is 44 years old. Eddy works selling and butchering pork. He has been dedicated to this business for more than 16 years. He began this business through his family because his father managed a business butchering pork and, from a young age, Eddy enjoyed the work. Over time, he was able to buy his own pigs and slaughter them for sale in his region. Eddy is very famous in his area for selling nacatamales (Central American tamales) and happily conversing with his customers. It is a difficult job but what he likes most about it is to see satisfied customers. As a result, he has decided to get a loan destined to be working capital for the purchase of pigs, among other products, so he can make his nacatamales. Eddy's dream is to have his own mode of transportation for his animals.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: San Ignacio Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Delia L. formed this committee after already being on one before.  She formed this committee with neighbors and friends who live close together.  They intially had 25 members, but lost a few members who moved to Spain.  Despite this loss, they still have a group savings of 3,200,000 Gs or about $700 U$D.  This group has been with the Fundación Paraguaya for over a year and are in their fourth cycle.

loans.name: Demecio Santiago

texts.es: Demecio Santiago B. Barrea tiene la edad de 45 años. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo y todos sus hijos estudian. La actividad económica es brindar el servicio de mecánica. Hace más de  22 años que se dedica a este negocio. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la agricultura pero perdió todo lo que tenia en una mala cosecha, luego sufrió un accidente y tuvo que permanecer hospitalizado para recuperarse por lo que tenia que vender todo lo que tenia para poder pagar los gastos de sus medicamentos, sin embargo Demecio no desistió de seguir luchando por obtener un trabajo fue entonces que empezó a trabajar con su hermano que el enseño todo acerca de mecánica y al notar que este seria un buen negocio decide establecer un taller en su vivienda. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de repuestos para motos, carros y bicicletas además la compra de más herramientas. El deseo es equipar su taller con todas las herramientas necesarias y los mejores servicios.
texts.en:
Demecio Santiago B. Barrea, 45, is raising two children who go to school. He has worked as a mechanic for over 22 years. He used to be a farmer, but he lost everything when he had a bad harvest. Then, he had an accident and had to be hospitalized to recover. He had to sell everything he had to be able to pay the medication costs. Nevertheless, Demecio did not stop fighting to get work. That was when he started to work with his brother who taught him everything about mechanics. He found that this would be a good business, and he decided to set up a shop at his home. The loan he is asking for is for working capital to buy replacement parts for motorcycles, cars, and bicycles. He will also buy more tools. His wish is to equip his shop with the necessary tools and the best service.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.en:
This committee is in its first cycle with the Fundación Paraguaya, and has 18 participants.  The committee members all work in different industries, and the loans they applied for will go toward merchandise and raw materials.  The committee has a good relationship and a deep respect between all of the participants.  Despite the fact that it is a new committee, the women are working hard and producing good results. 

Their goal as a group is to be able to proviD. their children with a good education, which will give them the opportunity to find a good job.  For this reason the women of this committee work twice as hard to be able to accomplish their goals.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Ana Isabel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Ciudad de los Tres Pisos”, vive en el Jr. Martín de la Riva S/Nº, Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 32 años, 01 hijo estudiante que aún depende de ella.

El espíritu luchador que siempre la ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes, ubicada en su misma casa, donde poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad. 

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio donde vende todo el día. Tiene años trabajando en este negocio y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, lo invertirá comprando abarrotes como: sacos de arroz y azúcar, paquetes de leche y aceite, también paquetes de gaseosas de diferentes sabores y tamaños e insumos para la limpieza del hogar e higiene personal y también frutas, así de esta manera mantener a sus clientes satisfechos y contentos. 
  
Anita, como le dicen de cariño, se siente muy tranquila y contenta con lo que hace y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Ana Isabel belongs to the Ciudad de los Tres Pisos. She lives on Jr. Martín de la Riva S/Nº, Lamas province, San Martín department. She is 32, single, and she has one dependent son who is a student. Her characteristic fighting spirit and the desire to get ahead by her own means have served her well in setting up her own business of selling groceries. The business is located in her house. Little by little she was getting well known by her customers. Things are now going very well for her in the business. She currently continues with the same business where she sells all day. She has spent many years in this business, and she is very happy with what she does. With this loan for 3,000 PEN she will buy groceries such as sacks of rice and sugar, packages of milk and oil, packages of different flavors and sizes of soft drinks, household cleaning supplies, personal hygiene products, and fruit. This way she will keep her customers happy and content. Anita, as she is affectionately called, feels very calm and happy with what she does. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to her being able to make her dreams and goals come true.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries like rice, sugar, milk, oil, and personal use products

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
La señora Consuelo, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Ciudad de los Tres Pisos”, vive en el Jr. Daniel A. Carrión cdra. 11, Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Es Viuda, tiene 64 años, 06 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes y con familia.

Se inició en la venta de pescado seco hace 15 años atrás, llevada por la intención de ayudar a su familia en sus ingresos económicos y hacer profesionales a sus hijos, contando para esto con un capital de S/. 800.00 que fue muy bien invertido, por lo que hoy en día continúa con el mismo negocio pero ya en mayores cantidades y variedad de especies.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprara pescado seco en sacos, tanto los que produce la región como los de la costa del país como: bocachico, fasaco, carbina, tucunare, palometas, toa, caballa, doncellas, arahuana, y también comprara 02 sacos de paiche seco, para así mantener surtido su negocio y satisfacer el exigente gusto de su clientela. 

Ella nos manifiesta su complacencia por pertenecer muchos años a un grupo de mujeres que le ha ayudado a superar dificultades que en algún momento tuvo que pasar pero que ahora los enfrenta con mucha fortaleza.
texts.en:
Señora Consuelo belongs to the Ciudad de los Tres Pisos (the City of Three Floors) Communal Bank. She lives on Daniel A. Carrión Avenue in Lamas Province, Department of San Martín. She is 64 years of age and a widow with six children, all of whom are out on their own with families. She began selling dried fish 15 years ago with the intention of helping her family's economic income and helping her children to become professional people. She had 800 Sols of capital that was very well invested since she is still in the same business to this day, but now she has greater quantities and a greater variety of species. With this loan of 3,000 Sols she will buy dried fish by the sack, both those produced in her region as well as those from the coast of Peru, such as: bocachico, fasaco, carbina (corvina), tucunare, palometas, toa (?), caballa, and arahuana (arowana). She will also buy two sacks of dried paiche so as to keep her business stocked and satisfy the discerning tastes of her customers. She expressed to us her satisfaction in having been associated for many years with a group of women who have helped her to overcome difficulties that confronted her at various times but which she can now face with great strength of spirit.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of different kinds of dried fish.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.en:
The participants of this committee work in different activities, and all of the women are heads of their households, where they are in charge of supporting the family and putting food on the table every day. 

This committee is now in its second cycle with the Fundación Paraguaya, which emphasizes the sense of responsibility and the desire to progress that each participant has.  Additionally, they are responsible in their payments.  Their main desire is that their children do not have the same educational and labor limitations that they had.  For this reason the women of this committee work twice as hard to be able to bring progress and opportunities to their children.

loans.name: Mariancit

texts.es:
La señora Mariancit, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Ciudad D. los Tres Pisos”, vive en el Jr. 02 D. Mayo, Provincia D. Lamas, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 66 años, 05 hijos ya independientes y casados.

Mariancit se inicio en el negocio con la venta D. plantas, cuenta con su propio vivero que se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, un lugar muy bien acondicionado, lleva varios años atrás ejerciendo este tipo D. trabajo, contando para esto con un capital D. S/. 200.00 que fue muy bien invertido por lo que hoy en día continúa con el mismo negocio pero ya en mayores cantidades y variedad D.  especies.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 3,000.00, comprara semillas D. diferentes plantas ornamentales, maseteros D. arcilla grandes y pequeños, insecticidas para evitar que las plagas malogren las flores, 30 bolsas D. tierra abonada especialmente para las flores. Con parte del dinero, también comprara plantones D. diversa variedad D. flores como: girasoles, Adán y Eva, dalias, orquídeas, jazmines y muchas otras plantas ornamentales mas.

Ella nos manifiesta su satisfacción por pertenecer muchos años a un grupo D. mujeres que la han ayudado a superar dificultades que en algún momento tuvo que pasar pero que ahora los enfrenta con mucha fortaleza.
texts.en:
Mariancit belongs to the "Ciudad D. los Tres Pisos” communal bank and lives on 2 D. Mayo Street in the province of Lamas in the state of San Martín. She is married, 66 years old and has 5 children that are married and independent. Mariancit started a business selling plants; she has her own plant nursery that is located in her house, a well air-conditioned location. She has been doing this type of work for several years using a loan of 200 Nuevos Soles that was well invested which is why she still has the business and currently has a large and varied product line. With this loan of 3,000 Nuevos Soles, she will buy seeds for various ornamental plants, large and small clay pots, insecticides to avoid the plants being ruined by pests, 30 bags of special fertilized soil for flowers. With part of the money she will also buy seedlings of various types of flowers such as sunflowers, "Adán y Eva", dahlias, orchids, jasmine, etc. She is very satisfied to belong for so long to a group of women that have helped her overcome difficulties that she has experienced but that she now confronts with great strength.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds, flower seedlings, insecticides and flower pots

loans.name: Mauricio Francisco

texts.es: Mauricio Francisco E. M. tiene 63 años de edad. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica de Mauricio es una pulpería. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que su negocio nació con el objetivo de apoyar en los gastos de su familia y de esta manera ayudar a sus hijos en los estudios, es importante resaltar que por medio de los financiamientos ha logrado mejorar los ingresos de su negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, refrescos naturales, gaseosas entre otras cosas. El Señor Mauricio tiene como sueño mantener esta actividad económica y obtener los recursos para su familia, por lo que su familia es su mayor prioridad.
texts.en:
Mauricio Francisco E. M. is 63 years old. He has two children whom he takes care of. Mauricio runs a grocery store and has been working in the grocery business for more than 3 years. He started his business because of his desire to be able to take care of his family's expenses and to help pay for his children's education. It is important to highlight that through the previous loans he has received he has been able to make his business more profitable. The loan he is requesting will be used as working capital to purchase sweets, fruit drinks, soft drinks, and other grocery items. Señor Mauricio dreams of continuing to run his business and making enough money to take care of his family; his family is his top priority.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Tekojoja Group

texts.en:
This committee is in its tenth cycle, and is an exemplary group.  It is made up of 16 women.  One of the participants, Mrs. Rogelia G., has five younger children, two of whom are in daycare and the other three stay at home while she works.  She works collecting recycling in Asunción.  On the weekends Rogelia participates in actitivities with the committee in order to create more group savings. Mrs. Rogelia G. is very dedicated to her children and does everything possible to help her partner with the living expenses of the family.  They have a small house, constructed by the government, in a marginal and dangerous neighborhood.
