loans.name: Maria Celedoña

texts.es: Ella es originaria de la comunidad de Chipuac del Municipio de Totonicapan su activida principal es la venta de productos de consumo diario lo viene ejrciendo dicha actividad cuando tenia quince años hoy con los ingresos que obtiene los ha invertido para la educacion de su hijos hoy necesita de un credito para la compra de productos basicos de la canasta basica y para la compra de tarjeta para telefono para surtir su pequeña tiena que tiene y donde tiene demanda de los clientes.
texts.en:
Maria Celedoña is a native of the Chipuac community in the Totonicapan municipality. Her principle activity is selling everyday products. She started this job when she was 15 years old. Now, with the income she has obtained, she has invested in the education of her children. Today she needs a loan in order to buy basic commodity products and to purchase telephone cards so she can stock the small store that she owns and where there is demand from customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital investment.

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.en:
One of the group members, Ana O., has been in the committee for two years.  She is 40 years old, has five children, and owns a small grocery store.  She started her business with only two shelves on which to put her merchandise.  Now she has many shelves, has expanded her house, and also sells meats and sausages.  Ana thanks the Fundación Paraguaya, as she is progressing and also helping her husband with the living and education expenses. 

1	Saturnina C. - 	Clothing sales 
2	Victoriana F. L.-  	Diner 
3	Maria A. R.-	Convenience store  
4	Maxima  R.-  	Traveling sales 
5	Maria A. A. M. - 	Vegetable sales 
6	Cristina R. P. -	Clothing sales 
7	Norma A. L. - 	Clothing sales 
8	Ana O. de V. -  	Small grocery store 
9	Norma E.P. M. - General store 
10	Olga D. B. de S. -  Fruit sales 
11	Lucila E.- 	Chipa (a local bread) sales 
12	Isabel Stela A. E - Empanada sales 
13	Angela Q. de G.- Medicinal remedies sales 
14	Betti D. A. B. -   	General store 
15	Juana P. M. -	Dressmaker 
16	Liliana F. P.- 	Lottery ticket sales 
17	Melania R. de B. - Food sales 
18	Benita A. V. - 	Jewelry and accessoy sales 
19	Nicacia D. de Q. - Chipa sales

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and raw materials

loans.name: Ida

texts.es:
IDA G. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES SOLIDARIAS”, vive en el Jr. Ricardo palma Nº 384 distrito de Calleria, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 59 años de edad y 04 hijos mayores.

Se inició en el negocio de artículos de belleza, con la venta de productos por catálogos. Con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró una pequeña vitrina para poder mostrarlos. Hoy ella ha progresado con su familia y el negocio ha mejorado

Con este préstamo de S/.2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en la compra de perfumes, cosméticos y nuevos productos.

Manifiesta que el movimiento Manuela Ramos es una ONG, que apoya a una gran cantidad de familias con pequeños prestamos que permite a las mujeres de la región a iniciar o a mejorar sus negocios y estoy contenta con esa ayuda” refirió.
texts.en:
Ida G. R. belongs to the "Mujeres Solidarias" (United Women) community bank. She lives in the Calleria district in the city of Pucallpa. She is 59 years old and has four adult children. She started in the cosmetics business selling catalog products. With the first loan of 300 new soles, she bought a small glass case so she could display her products. Today, she has progressed with her family and the business has improved. With this loan of 2,000 new soles, she will invest in the purchase of perfumes, cosmetics and new products. She says that the Manuela Ramos movement is an NGO that supports a great number of families with small loans that allow women in the region to begin or improve their businesses, and she added "I am happy with that help."

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase perfumes and different catalog products.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Doña Carmen es originaria de la comunidad de la zona uno del departamento de Totonicapán  ella su fuente de ingreso lo obtiene en la elaboracion de canastas con material de plastico ella inicio su trabajo cuando tenia diez años hasta la fecha cuenta con dos operarias  cada semana elaboran ocho docenas las cuales las entrega en la misma comunidad hoy necesita de un credito para la compra de materiales ya que tiene un pedido y para poder cumplir con el pedido necesita del credito para poder cumplir con su patron.
texts.en:
Carmen is from a community in the first zone of the Totonicapan department. She obtains income by making baskets with plastic material. She began this work when she was ten years old. So far, she has two operators. Each week she makes eight dozen baskets which she distributes in her community. Today, she needs a loan to purchase materials since she has an order. To meet this order from her customer, she needs the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.es:
ROSITA U. D., pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES SOLIDARIAS” domiciliada en el Jr. Cesar Calvo de Araujo N° 946 del distrito de Callería, tiene 50 años, 2 hijos mayores, y su esposo tiene trabajo como obrero de una empresa.

Tenía un negocio de productos de belleza y hace 3 años  obtuvo un primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con esto compro algunos cosméticos, pero por inconvenientes tuvo que dejar de trabajar con productos de belleza. Actualmente ella vende ropas como blusas, camisas, polo, etc.

Con este préstamo de S/.1000.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en la compra de ropas y para luego ofrecerlo a sus vecinos a amistades.

En los tres años que esta con Manuela Ramos se siente contenta por la ayuda que da a las mujeres trabajadoras para que así puedan salir a adelante.
texts.en:
Rosita U. D. belongs to the "Mujeres Solidarias" (United Women) community bank. She lives in the Calleria district and is 50 years old. She has two adult children and her husband is a worker at a company. She owned a beauty products business and three years ago, she obtained her first loan of 300 new soles. With this, she bought some cosmetics. However, as a result of some drawbacks, she had to stop working with beauty products. Currently, she sells clothing like blouses, shirts, polo-shirts, etc. With this loan of 1,000 new soles, she will invest in the purchase of clothing and then sell them to her neighbors and friends. In the three years that she has been with Manuela Ramos, she has felt happy from the support given to working women so they may get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase different types of clothing.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
ROSARIO G. D. P., pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES SOLIDARIAS” vive en el Jr. Pisqui Nº 362, en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, tiene 50 años D. edad y es madre soltera D. 03 hijos.

Se inició en el negocio D. perfumes y productos D. belleza, con el primer préstamo D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró perfumes para tener en stock y así poder mostrarlos, ella continua trabajando en ese rubro y cuenta con clientes.

Con este préstamo D. S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en la compra D. perfumes, cosméticos y nuevos productos.

 “Manuela Ramos es una ONG, que apoya a una gran cantidad D. mujeres trabajadoras, con pequeños prestamos que permite a las mujeres pucallpinas a iniciar o a mejorar sus negocios y estoy contenta con esa ayuda” refirió.
texts.en:
Rosario G. D. P. belongs to the "Mujeres Solidarias" Community Bank and lives in the Jr. Pisqui Nº 362 in the city of Pucallpa. She is 50 years old and is unmarried with 3 children. She started her perfume and beauty products business with her first loan of S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles. She used the loan to purchase perfumes to build her inventory and have testers for customers to try. She continues to improve her business and build her clientele. With the loan for S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles she will purchase perfumes, cosmetics, and new products. She was referred by the field partner, Manuela Ramos, an ONG that endorses a large quantity of working women. Manuela Ramos provides the women of Pucallpa with small loans that allow them to start or improve their business and is happy to be able to proviD. support.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase perfumes, cosmetics, and new products.

loans.name: Edy Fernando

texts.es: El Joven Edy Fernando es originario D. la zona cuatro del departamento D. Totonicapan actualmente trabaja el juzgado civil del mismo municipio como oficial segundo, el necesita D. un credito para poder terminar su carrera univesitaria en la elaboracion D. su exame privado ya que en su trabajo se le obliga en ampliar su conocimientos para poder fortalecer algunos caso judiciales que se tiene o que se le exige diariamente.
texts.en:
The young man Edy Fernando comes from zone four of the Totonicapan department where he currently works as a deputy officer at the civil court. He needs a loan in order to finish his university career by preparing for a private exam. His work requires that he increases his knowledge to strengthen various judicial cases that he works with on a daily basis.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Course fees

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es: Karla Patricia U. Gutiérrez tiene la edad de 37 años, tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica de Karla es una pulpería. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. Karla inicio este negocio ofreciendo los servicios de venta de recargas telefónicas, para celulares al ver que su demanda mejoraba, decidió invertir en bisutería y con el apoyo de su esposo han logrado salir adelante con su negocio, ya que el la ayuda a trasladarse en bicicleta a la vivienda de cada uno de sus clientes y juntos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos naturales, jugos y gaseosas. El sueño de Karla es ampliar su negocio para que sus hijos tengan un futuro para el día de mañana.
texts.en:
Karla Patricia U. Gutiérrez is 37 years old, and has 2 children under her care. Karla runs a neighborhood store. She has dedicated herself to this business for over 4 years. Karla started this business by offering services in the sale of pre paid phone cards for cellular phones, and once she noticed that her demand improved, she decided to invest in costume jewelry. With the support of her husband they have been able to move forward with this business, given that he would help her get to the homes of each of her clients on his bike; they did this together. The loan that she is requesting will be used as work capital to purchase basic grains, sweets, natural drinks, juices, and soft drinks. Karla’s dream is to expand her business so that her children have a future.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital (to purchase basic grains, sweets, natural drinks, juices, and soft drinks).

loans.name: Ma. De Los Dolores

texts.es:
La señora Ma. De Los Dolores C. tiene ya mas de 14 años en la venta de alimentos (De tacos), este negocio es la fuente de ingreso se su familia.
Tiene el deseo de invertir en un nuevo negocio que es la venta de alimentos en diferentes partes de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo. 
Le están ofreciendo un puesto móvil a buen precio pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder adquirir está oferta, por tal motivo solicita un préstamo y así tener un ingreso mas para su familia.
texts.en:
Ma. De Los Dolores C. has over 14 years working in the sale of food (tacos); this business in the only source of income for her family. She wishes to invest in a new business in the sale of food in different parts of the city of Nuevo Laredo. They have offered her a mobile food stand at a good price but she currently does not have the necessary money to be able to take this offer, for that reason she is requesting a loan which will allow her to gain an additional income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a mobile food stand to sell food.

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
La señora Concepción C. labora es una dama emprendedora que logró montar su propia panadería en la ciudad de Masaya donde atiende a diario a sus clientes que le visitan para comprar el pan de cada día.

Ella ha decidido acudir a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de harina, leña, sartenes, manteca y otros para la elaboración del pan. Por esta razón es que ella espera muy confiadamente en Ceprodel para que se le brinde su crédito y de esta manera mejorar su situación económica y sacar adelante su panadería.
texts.en:
Concepción C. is an enterprising woman who was able to open her own bakery in the city of Masaya where she attends to her clients who visit daily to purchase her bread. She has decided to seek out Ceprodel to solicit a loan to purchase flour, wood, pans, butter, and other items needed to make bread. For this reason she waits confidently for Ceprodel to grant her a loan to be able to improve her economic situation and move her bakery forward.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase flour, wood, pans, butter, and other items.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
DOLORES M. M., pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES CON FUTURO”, con domicilio ubicado en el Jr. Apurímac Nº 409, tiene 63 años de edad, un hijo mayor y su esposo es pescador.

Tiene 10 años en Manuela Ramos y el primer préstamo que obtuvo fue de S/ 300 Nuevos Soles, el cuál lo utilizó para comprar combustible y redes para luego ir a pescar junto a su esposo. En la actualidad ella compra y vende sabanas.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500. Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en el arreglo de una máquina de coser y comprará materiales para confeccionar y diseñar sabanas.

Se encuentra agradecida con Manuela Ramos, porque nunca alguna entidad le otorgó un crédito mientras que Manuela sin tanto papeleo, confía en ella y la motiva a ser responsable en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Dolores M. M. belongs to the Communal Bank “Women with a Future”; she is 63 years old, has one older child, and her husband is a fisherman. She has been with Manuela Ramos for 10 years, and the first loan that she acquired was of 300 PEN, which she used to purchase fuel and fishing nets to fish with her husband. Currently she purchases and sells sheets. With this loan of 1,500 PEN, she will invest in fixing a sewing machine and will purchase materials to make and design sheets. She is thankful for Manuela Ramos, because no other entity ever granted her a loan, while Manuela Ramos, without a great deal of paperwork, believes in her and motivates her to be responsible in her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to make sheets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a room at the rear of the house

loans.name: Valentin Rafael

texts.es: El Señor Valentin Rafael G. G. es originario del cantón chiyas del departamento de Totonicapán, casado con dos hijos actualmente trabaja como construcctor de obras desde hace mas de cinco años hoy necesita un credito para terminar su construccion y aprovechar que el hierro ha bajado de precio, para que en esta epoca de invierno, no le pueda afectar y poder tener una vivienda digna para toda su familia
texts.en:
Valentin Rafael G. G. is a native of Cantón Chiyas in the Totonicapán department. He is married and has two children. He has been a construction worker for over five years. He needs a loan to finish his construction and take advantage of the fact that iron has gone down in price. Then this winter will not affect them, and his family will have a decent place to live.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials

loans.name: Sara Amparo

texts.es:
En el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Sara M. desde hace varios años se dedica a su negocio de venta de verduras como ayotes, tamarindo, limones, entre otros.

Con el propósito de mejorar sus condiciones económicas, ha buscado la manera de salir adelante  y ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de las verduras y de esta manera mejorar su condición económica y salir adelante en el negocio.
texts.en:
For many years, Mrs. Sara M. has had a business selling vegetables such as pumpkins, tamarinds, lemons, etc. in the Mayoreo market in the city of Managua.

In a bid to improve her financial situation she has looked for a way to move forward and approached Ceprodel in order to ask for a loan to buy vegetables and so to improve her financial situation and move her business forward.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Oralia Enriqueta

texts.es:
La señora Oralia Enriqueta J. tiene ya mas de dos dedicándose a la venta de ropa usada y nueva lo tiene afuera de su casa para no descuidar a sus hijos. 
Al negocio le está haciendo falta más variedad de mercancía de temporada de verano pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder surtir el negocio.
 Es por eso que solicita el préstamo para surtir el negocio ya que es la fuente de ingresos de su familia.
texts.en:
Oralia Enriqueta J. has been selling used and new clothing for more than two years. She has the business in front of her house so that she can take care of her children. The business is in need of a greater variety of summer clothing. However, she doesn’t have the money necessary to stock her business. She is requesting the loan so that she can stock her business because it is the source of income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seasonal clothing

loans.name: Cleotilde Del Carmen

texts.es:
Cleotilde G. es una dama muy trabajadora cuya labor es la venta de frutas comercializadas en su establecimiento en el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua ofreciendo todo tipo de frutas como lo son melones, papayas, granadillas, entre otros. 

La razón por la que la señora Cleotilde ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de las frutas y de esta manera comercializarlas en su localidad y así salir adelante en su negocio que tanto requiere de inversión.
texts.en:
Cleotilde Garcia is an industrious lady who sells fruit from her stall at the Mayoreo market in the city of Managua. She stocks all types of fruit such as melons, papaya, passion fruit, amongst others.

Mrs. Cleotilde has come to Ceprodel in order that she can benefit from a loan to buy fruits and then sell them in her local area and thus move forward with her business, which is in such need of investment.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: Felipa tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 15 y 12 años en su casa propia. Desde hace 19 años se viene dedicando a la elaboración de calzado, incursionó en este negocio porque trabajó en un pequeño taller al lado de su esposo, quien también se dedica al mismo oficio, decidiendo entre los dos tener algo propio y los años de experiencia les dieron los conocimientos necesarios para dedicarse independientemente a ello. Felipa dice sentirse muy contenta con su negocio, ya que le gusta la libertad que tiene, puesto que puede elegir las horas en las cuales trabajar y las horas que tiene que dedicarle a su familia. Además, trabaja al lado de su esposo, quien es el que cose los zapatos dándole los acabados necesarios y por su parte ella corta el cuero con los moldes respetivos. Ambos reciben pedidos en cantidad de varios mercados del lugar y también realizan zapatos personalizados, ya que aquel cliente que en los mercados no encuentre un zapato de acuerdo a su gusto, puede recurrir al pequeño taller de Felipa, para que le fabriquen el calzado a su gusto, cobrando un mayor precio por ello. Ella y su esposo tienen mucha fe en seguir progresando, quieren comprar más cantidad de máquinas y poner un taller muy bien equipado para que se les facilite la producción de sus zapatos. Este es su 9no préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y el grupo al cual pertenece es muy unido y trabajador, es por ello que se siente feliz de pertenecer a él. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de cuero, para elaborar zapatos cerrados para la temporada de invierno.
texts.en:
Felipa, 42, lives in her own house with her husband and two children ages 15 and 12. She has been making footwear for 19 years. She started this business because she worked in a small shop by her husband’s side (he does the same work), and they decided to have something of their own. Their years of experience gave them the necessary knowledge to work at it independently. Felipa feels very happy with her business. She likes the freedom she has, since she can decide the hours she works and the hours she has to spend with her family. Also, she works at her husband’s side. He sews the shoes and gives them the necessary finishings. She cuts the leather with the appropriate molds. They both receive orders in quantities from various markets in the area. They also make custom shoes. A customer in the market who cannot find shoes they like can go to Felipa’s small shop, and for a greater charge, they will make a shoe the customer likes. She and her husband have a lot of faith that they will continue to make progress. They want to buy more machines and set up a very well equipped shop to make shoes. This is their ninth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. The group they belong to is very united and hard working. That is why she feels happy to belong to the group. She will use the money to buy a greater quantity of leather to make closed shoes for the winter.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy leather for making shoes

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es: Jessica tiene 40 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 15 y 12 años en su casa propia. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a la fabricación de calzado para niños, alentada por su esposo quien ya tenía experiencia en esta actividad por trabajar en talleres desde muy joven. Juntos deciden implementar su propio negocio, el cual les costó mucho sacrificio, pero que actualmente es su principal fuente de ingresos. Jessica ayuda a su esposo en las labores menos duras, ya que la fabricación de calzado es un trabajo muy duro, teniendo que coser, cortar y pegar, pero en grandes cantidades por los pedidos que le realizan. Ellos fabrican, al día, 12 pares de zapatillas, lo cual no es nada fácil, ya que trabajan solos y no pueden parar puesto que al final del día los doce pares deben enviarse a los comerciantes del centro comercial de Gamarra (uno de los más conocidos en la ciudad de Lima), que es de donde más pedidos tienen. Jessica se siente muy contenta porque gracias a este trabajo ha logrado construir su casita y va mejorando poco a poco, además le gusta mucho realizar zapatillas para niños, ya que son mucho más vistosas y pueden alternar modelos y colores. Para el futuro, espera seguir produciendo y contar con un taller más grande y una tienda donde mostrar y vender su producción. Jessica es una clienta muy antigua en Microfinanzas PRISMA, este es su 9no préstamo y siempre ha sido muy puntual en todos sus pagos, al igual que sus compañeras de grupo. Con el dinero que esta vez solicita comprará cuero en grandes cantidades y plantillas de zapatillas para cubrir los pedidos que le hicieron actualmente.
texts.en:
Jessica is 40 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and her two sons who are 15 and 12 years old. For the past 20 years, she has been making children's shoes. She was encouraged by her husband who had experience in this line of work because he had worked in shoe-making shops from the time he was very young. Together they decided to begin their own business, which has meant much sacrifice. But now it is their main source of income. Jessica helps her husband in the less difficult tasks. Shoe-making is very difficult work, requiring sewing, cutting, and gluing, and in large quantities because of the number of orders they fill. Each day they make 12 pairs of small shoes, which is no easy feat since they work alone and they can’t stop because by the end of the day they have to deliver the shoes to the Gamarra shopping center (one of the best-known in Lima), which is where they get the most orders. Jessica is very content because thanks to this job she has been able to build her house, which she is improving little by little. She also likes making children’s shoes because they are nicer looking and they can alternate styles and colors. In the future she hopes to continue producing and to have a larger workshop where they can show and sell their shoes. Jessica has been a borrower with Microfinanzas PRISMA for a long time. This is her 9th loan and she has always been very punctual in all her payments, as have the other members of her group. With the money that she is requesting this time, she will buy a large amount of leather and shoe soles to cover the orders she currently has.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy leather for making children's shoes

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
YOLANDA L. P., pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS SIRENITAS”, vive en el Jr. José Gálvez Mz.100 Lt.16, en el distrito del Yarinacocha, tiene 53 años de edad. Es madre soltera, se dedica a la venta de ropa, oficio con el que educó a sus hijos y la cuál la llenan de orgullo y felicidad.

Tiene 2 años en Manuela Ramos y el primer préstamo que obtuvo fue de S/ 300 Nuevos Soles, el cuál lo utilizó para la compra de algunas prendas. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en la compra de ropas de verano, ya que esta cerca la fiesta de San Juan.

Se encuentra agradecida con Manuela Ramos, porque nunca alguna entidad le otorgó un crédito mientras que Manuela Ramos se lo dió sin tanto papeleo, confía en ella y la motiva a ser responsable en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Yolanda L. P. belongs to the Community Bank “Las Sirenitas”. She lives on Jose Galvez street in the Yarinacocha district. She is 53 years old. She is a single mother and sells clothing for a living, a job by which she educates her children who fill her with pride and happiness.

She has been with Manuela Ramos for 2 years. The first loan she obtained was for 300 Peruvian soles, which was used to buy clothing.

With this loan of 1,000 soles she will buy summer clothes as it is nearly the San Juan public holiday.

She is grateful to Manuela Ramos because no other organisation offered her a loan yet Manuela Ramos did and without too much paperwork, trusting in her and motivating her to be responsible with her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy summer clothes

loans.name: Maritza Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Maritza C. es una dama con muchos deseos de superar su negocio de pulpería el que posee en la ciudad de Managua específicamente en el mercado Mayoreo donde se desempeña en su negocio.

Hoy en día la señora Maritza ha acudido a Ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para la compra de los productos de pulpería para comercializarlos y de esta manera salir adelante en su negocio el que requiere de su apoyo para desarrollarse.
texts.en:
Mariza C. is a woman with a great desire to succeed in her small grocery business, which she has in the whole-sale market in Managua. Maritza has come to Ceprodel to request a loan to buy grocery products to sell in her store. This way she can get ahead in her business, which requires your support to further develop.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery merchandise

loans.name: María Ofelia

texts.es:
A la edad de 60 años, la señora María Ofelia C. labora en su actividad de elaboración de tortillas las cuales son vendidas por ella misma en su localidad en el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua.

Actualmente ella ha reconocido que necesita invertir en la compra de la materia prima como lo es el maíz y leña y es por esto que espera en que Ceprodel le brinde el crédito para la compra de dicha materia prima y así continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
María Ofelia C., 60, makes tortillas. She sells them in the Mayoreo market in the city of Managua. She currently needs to buy raw materials such as corn and wood. That is why she hopes that Ceprodel will give her a loan to buy these raw materials and continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials to make tortillas

loans.name: Aristides

texts.es:
En el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, el señor Aristides M. se dedica a su negocio de venta de bisuterías como cargadores de baterías, anteojos, relojes, controles de televisores, entre otros.

El señor Aristides ha decidido acudir a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de las bisuterías con el fin de continuar comercializándolas en su localidad en el mercado Mayoreo.
texts.en:
In the Mayoreo market, in the city of Managua, Aristides M. sells miscellaneous products such as battery chargers, glasses, clocks, television controls, and other items. Aristides has decided to come to Ceprodel for a loan to buy jewelry to sell in his location the Mayoreo market.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy jewelry

loans.name: Rogelia Mercedes

texts.es:
ROGELIA MERCEDES C. T., pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES SOLIDARIAS” vive en el distrito de Calleria, tiene 58 años de edad, 03 hijos mayores de edad y su esposo se dedica a la avicultura.

Inició el negocio de comidas por las tardes y noches, tales como juanes, tacacho y pescado asado. Con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, implemento con una parrilla e insumos para su negocio ya que vive en una zona bien concurrida y el negocio le ha salido muy bien.

Con este préstamo de S/.2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá para construir un galpón de pollos y está realizando compras como listones, clavos, etc, el cuál servirá para criar pollos.

Dice que Manuela Ramos es la única identidad que da préstamos con bajos intereses y da facilidad de obtener un préstamo.
texts.en:
Rogelia Mercedes C. T. is a member of the "Mujeres Solidarias" (Women United) Village Bank. She lives in the District of Calleria. She is 58 and has 3 grown-up children. She and her husband earn their living as poultry farmers. Rogelia started an afternoon and evening business selling foods like juanes (chicken and rice wrapped in banana leaves), tacacho (crushed bananas in olive oil), and grilled fish. She used her first loan of 300 soles to get a grill and supplies for her business. She lives in a busy area so business has gone very well. Rogelia plans to use her loan of 2,000 soles to buy wood planks, nails, etc., to build a coop for raising her chickens. She says that Manuela Ramos is the only institution that offers low-interest rates and makes it easy to get a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wooden planks, nails and other materials to build a coop for her chickens.

loans.name: Rosa Lily

texts.es:
ROSA LILY R. D. M., pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES SOLIDARIAS”, vive en el Jr. Ricardo palma Nº 225, tiene 65 años D. edad,  4 hijos mayores y su esposo es albañil.

Tiene 8 años en Manuela Ramos y el primer préstamo que obtuvo fue D. S/ 300 Nuevos Soles, el cuál lo utilizó para comprar ropas usadas para posteriormente venderlo por la carretera Federico Basadre y así poder seguir desarrollando su pequeño negocio.

Con este préstamo D. S/ 1,500. Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en la compra  D. todo tipo D. ropa usada para luego ir a venderlo en la ciudad D. Neshuya y Curimana.

Se encuentra agradecida con Manuela Ramos porque le otorgó un crédito sin tanto papeleo, confía en ella y la motiva a ser responsable en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Rosa Lily R. D. M. is a member of the "Mujeres Solidarias" (Women United) Village Bank. She lives at 225 Jr. Ricardo D. Palma. She is 65 and has 4 grown children. Her husband is a bricklayer. She's been with Manuela Ramos for 8 years. She used her first loan, for 300 soles, to buy used clothing to sell along the Federico Basadre highway, allowing her to continue developing her small business. Rosa plans to use this loan of 1,500 soles to buy all kinds of used clothing to take to sell in the cities of Neshuya and Curimana. She is grateful Manuel Ramos for giving her a loan without too much paperwork, trusting her, and motivating her to be responsible with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different kinds of used clothing.

loans.name: Gladys Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Gladys, pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES SOLIDARIAS” su negocio está ubicado en el Jr. Salaverry  N° 793, Distrito de Calleria, tiene 36 años y 3 hijos menores.

Su negocio esta su casa, el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con el que invirtió en la compra de algunos abarrotes, para surtir su pequeña bodega y desde 2 años está trabajando con Manuela Ramos, ha su negocio ha ido creciendo cada vez más y por eso le ha sido necesario subir el monto de sus préstamos.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá comprando más abarrotes para surtir su pequeña bodega.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ser una institución que sirve a la comunidad con el servicio que da a las mujeres de esta región.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gladys belongs to the “Supportive Women” Communal Bank. Her business is located on Salaverry Street in the district of Calleria. She is 36 years old and has 3 minor children. Her business is located in her home and the first loan that she received from Kiva partner Manuela Ramos was for 300 new soles. She invested in the purchase of groceries to stock her small grocery store. Since she began working with Manuela Ramos 2 years ago, her business has been growing, and for this reason she has needed a larger loan. With this loan of 1,500 new soles she will invest in the purchase of more groceries to stock her small grocery store. She thanks Manuela Ramos for being an institution that serves the community with the service that it provides women of this region.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Danilza

texts.es:
DANILZA G. D. L., pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES SOLIDARIAS”, vive en el Jr. Ricardo palma Nº 383, tiene 55 años D. edad, es madre soltera y se dedicaba  a la venta D. golosinas en la escuela  “El Arenal”.

Tiene 5 años en Manuela Ramos y el primer préstamo que obtuvo fue un monto D. S/ 300 Nuevos Soles, el cuál lo utilizó para comprar golosinas para su pequeño negocio. En la actualidad, se dedica a la venta D. ropas, el cual le genera mejores ingresos que el trabajo anterior.

Con este  préstamo D. S/ 1,200.00, lo invertirá en la compra D. ropas para damas y caballeros ya que después ofrecerá a sus vecinos y amistades.

Se encuentra agradecida con Manuela Ramos porque le otorgó un crédito sin tanto papeleo,  confía en ella y la motiva a ser responsable en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Danilza G. D. L. belongs to the “Supportive Women” Communal Bank. She lives on Ricardo Palma Street, is 55 years old, a single mother, and used to work selling sweets in the “El Arenal” school. She has worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for 5 years and the first loan that she received was for 300 new soles, which she used to buy sweets for her small business. Currently she works selling clothing, which makes her a better income than her previous job. With this loan of 1,200 new soles, she will invest in the purchase of clothing for women and men and then sell them to her neighbors and friends. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos because they gave her a loan without so much paperwork. They trusted her and this motivated her to be responsible in her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy different clothing for women and men

loans.name: Adilia Judith

texts.es:
ADILIA JUDITH, pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUIJERES VALIENTES” vive en el Jr. Coronel Portillo Nº 836, en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, tiene 45 años D. edad, 2 hijos y su pareja es técnico agropecuario.

Se inició en el negocio D. venta D. productos “UNION” y el primer préstamo D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró algunos productos para venderlos a sus vecinos, también está ingresando al negocio D. la venta D. productos D. belleza.
Hoy, ella ha progresado con su familia y el negocio D. la venta D. productos D. belleza ha mejorado. 

Con este préstamo  D. S/.1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en la compra D. perfumes, cosméticos y nuevos productos.

“Manuela Ramos es una ONG, que apoya a una gran cantidad D. familias, con pequeños préstamos que permite a las mujeres D. esta zona a iniciar o a mejorar sus negocios, y estoy contenta con esa ayuda” refirió.
texts.en:
Adila Judith belongs to the “Brave Women” Communal Bank and lives on Coronel Portillo Street in the city of Pucallpa. She is 45 years old, has 2 children, and her husband is an agricultural worker. She started selling “Union” products and with the first loan of 300 new soles she bought some products to sell to her neighbors. She is also starting a business selling beauty products. Today she has maD. progress with her family and the beauty products business has improved. With this loan of 1,200 new soles, she will invest in the purchase of perfumes, cosmetics and new products. She said, “Manuela Ramos is an NGO [Non-governmental organization] that supports a great number of families with small loans that allow women of this area to start or improve businesses and I am happy with this assistance.”

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perfumes, cosmetics, and new beauty products

loans.name: Sahadira

texts.es:
La señora Sahadira, pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS VICTORIOSAS” su domicilio  está ubicado en el Distrito de Calleria, tiene 28 años, 2 hijos menores y su esposo es mototaxista.

Ella tiene una pequeña bodega, trabaja hace 4 años con Manuela Ramos con un primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con el que invirtió en la compra de una congeladora de segunda y su negocio ha ido creciendo cada vez más y por eso le ha sido necesario subir el monto de sus préstamos.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,300.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes para surtir su tienda.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ser una institución que sirve a la comunidad con el servicio que da y que contribuye con las mujeres de esta región.
texts.en:
Sahadira belongs to Las Victoriosas Community Bank. She lives in the Calleria district. She is 28 and has two minor children. Her husband is a motorcycle taxi drive. She has a small store. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for four year. With her first loan of 300 PEN she bought a second hand freezer. Her business has been growing more and more. This has made it necessary to increase the amount of her loans. With this loan for 1,300 PEN she will buy groceries to stock her store. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for being an institution that serves the community and contributes to the women of this region.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various groceries to stock her store

loans.name: Palccaraqui Group

texts.en:
Palccaraqui is a group of 14 neighbors and family members who live and work in Urubamba, a small town an hour from Cusco. The group name means “The Path of the Sticks” in Quechua, the indigenous language spoken throughout the Sacred Valley. The group members are using the loan to fund their own businesses such as making fireworks, buying restaurant supplies and transporting goods for sale.

Lucas, the group leader, is 52 years old and has 7 children with his wife. He is an elected official in his town, and was recently reelected for a second term to serve in the mayor’s office. Lucas works as a bricklayer part-time, but also runs his own fireworks business. With his loan, he plans to buy powder to make the fireworks for local parties and events. A 14 kg bag costs about 300 soles (approx. 100 USD). As group leader, Lucas makes sure that group members are accountable for making timely payments.

Irma is 43 years old, married and has 4 children. She runs her own restaurant near the main square in Urubamba. She will use the loan to purchase supplies and food. Every Wednesday she spends 300 soles to purchase sodas and other bottled drinks from a regional distributor.

Ivan is 20 years old and drives commercial vehicles to distribute food and building supplies throughout the Sacred Valley. It took him two years to receive his commercial driver’s license after passing driving and written tests. With the loan he hopes to buy extra goods that he can transport on the vehicles and sell for extra income. He currently works for a local transport company, but hopes to own his own truck one day.

Palccaraqui is grateful for the loan. They have been working with Asociación Arariwa for over a year, and are familiar with the loan process and repayment schedule expected of them. Members guarantee each other in groups of 3 to 4 people to hold each other accountable.

loans.use: To buy powder to make fireworks and to purchase merchandise for other small businesses

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
ROSA F. S., pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES VALIENTES” vive en el Distrito de Calleria, tiene 61 años, 6 hijos mayores y su esposo es obrero.

Ella  tiene una bodega y el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con el que invirtió en la compra de algunos abarrotes para surtir su pequeño puesto y desde hace 4 años que está trabajando con Manuela Ramos su negocio ha ido creciendoo cada vez más y por eso ha sido necesario subir el monto de sus préstamos.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en la compra de más productos para surtir su tienda y de esta manera dará mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ser una institución que sirve a la comunidad con el servicio que da y con la ayuda que da a las mujeres de esta región.
texts.en:
Rosa F. S. belongs to the "Mujers Valientes" communal bank and lives in the District of Calleria. She is 61 years old, has 6 adult children and her husband works as a laborer. She has a store and the first that she received from the Manuela Ramos organization was 300 Nuevos Soles, which was invested in the purchase of groceries to stock her small store. In the 4 years that she has been working the Manuela Ramos organization her business has grown larger and larger and for this reason she finds it necessary to increase the amount of her loans. With this loan of 1,000 Nuevos Soles, she will invest in the purchase of more products to stock her store to be able to provide a better service to her customers. She is thankful to Manuela Ramos for being an institution that serves the community and for the help it provides to the women of the region.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products to stock her store

loans.name: Lucy Milagros

texts.es:
LUCY MILAGROS P. V., pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS VICTORIOSAS,” tiene 21 años, 1 hijo y su esposo es mototaxista.

Ella  vendía ropas y el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual lo invirtió en la compra de algunas prendas para luego venderlo a sus vecinos.Actualmente tiene una pequeña bodega.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes para surtir su tienda.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos, por ser una institución que sirve a la comunidad con el servicio que da, y con la ayuda que da a las mujeres de esta región.
texts.en:
Lucy Milagros P. V. belongs to the "Las Victoriosas" communal bank. She is 21 years old, has one son and her husband is a moto taxi driver. In the past she sold clothing and witht the first loan that she received from the Manuela Ramos organization was for 300 Nuevos Soles, which was invested in the purchase of clothing to sell to her neighbors. She currently has a small grocery store. With this loan of 1,000 Nuevos Soles, she will invest in the purchase of groceries to stock her store. She is thankful to Manuela Ramos for being an institution that serves the community and for the help that it gives to the women in the region.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various grocery items to stock her store

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena O. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 61 years old. Elena is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Elena owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Elena has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Elena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elena is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Elena from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad H. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 53 years old. Natividad is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Natividad owns & operates a business selling vegetables. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of vegetables. Natividad has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Natividad joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Natividad has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Natividad is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Natividad from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline A. is from the town of Katipunan. She is a 42 year old widow with four school-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Evangeline joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC, which she used to purchase additional products to sell. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase more products to sell and to buy a piglet to raise. This loan will be her 8th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support the immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell and a piglet to raise.

loans.name: Ma. Flora

texts.en:
Ma. Flora S. is from the town of Katipunan. She is 48 years old and married with four adult children. To make a living, Ma. Flora provides mechanical services to local community members. She's been engaged in her business for over 24 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Ma. Flora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to purchase materials needed to provide her service. Ma. Flora is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase construction materials for house repair. This loan will be her 8th loan from PMPC. She plans to have a comfortable shelter for the family. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for house repair

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn C. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 31 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Jonalyn raises pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Jonalyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC, which she used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. Jonalyn is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP to expand the shelter for her livestock. This will be her 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the shelter for her livestock.

loans.name: Carmen Ruth

texts.es:
La señora Carmen Ruth Martínez Z. tiene 62 años, vive en el Distrito de La Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Superior  Secretariado Ejecutivo,  no tiene  hijos que depende económicamente de ella.
Carmen se dedica a la Elaboración de Carteras y Almohadones bordadas en cintas y tejidos, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Nueva Esperanza  II, lo invirtió en la compra de materiales como cintas, hilos, broches, lentejuelas y telas.
El crédito de 500 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de  materiales como cintas, hilos, broches, lentejuelas y telas para implementar su negocio.
Carmen tiene como sueño aprehender más manualidades como bisutería para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Carmen Ruth Martínez Z. is 62 years old and lives in the La Esperanza District of Trujillo Province in the state of La Libertad in Peru. She studied to be an executive secretary. She doesn't have any children that are economically dependent on her. Carmen works making bags and cushions embroidered with ribbons and weavings; her business is located in her house. With the first loan of 300 Nuevos Soles that she received from the "Nueva Esperanza II" communal bank she invested in the purchase of materials such as ribbons, threads, brooches, sequins and fabric. This loan of 500 Nuevos Soles will be invested in the purchase of ribbons, threads, brooches, sequins and fabric to expand her business Carmen's dreams is to learn more trades, such as making costume jewelry , to be able to grow as a micro entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of materials such as ribbons, threads, brooches, sequins and fabric to expand her business

loans.name: Timotea Irene

texts.es:
La señora Timotea Irene C. Rubiños tiene 45 años, vive en el Distrito de La Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Secundaria Incompleta,  no tiene  hijos que depende económicamente de ella.
Timotea se dedica a la venta de Productos de Belleza, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Nueva Esperanza  II, lo invertirá en la compra de productos de Belleza como colonias, cremas, champús, lápices labiales para implementar su negocio.
Timotea tiene como sueño implementar su restaurante para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Timotea Irene C. Rubiños is 45. She lives in the Esperanza district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She went to high school, but did not finish. She does not have dependent children. Timotea sells beauty products in her house. With her first loan for 300 PEN, which she received from her Community Bank, Nueva Esperanza II, she will buy beauty products like colognes, creams, shampoos, and lipsticks to increase her business. Timotea’s dream is to set up a restaurant to grow as a small business woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products like colognes, creams, shampoos, and lipsticks to set up her business

loans.name: Niria Nereyda

texts.es:
La señora Niria Nereyda Briceño M. tiene 42 años, vive en el Distrito de La Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Secundaria Completa,   tiene 3  hijos que depende económicamente de ella.
Niria se dedica a la venta de antenas, cortadores de vidrios, su negocio lo desarrolla en las esquinas de la ciudad de Trujillo.
Con su primer crédito de 200 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Nueva Esperanza  II, lo invirtió  en la compra de productos como cortadores de vidrios.
El crédito de 1700 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de  antenas, enciclopedias ilustradas y con CD para implementar su negocio.
Niria tiene como sueño implementar su ferretería para crecer como microempresaria
texts.en:
Mrs. Niria Nereyda M. is 42 years old, lives in the district of La Esperanza, in the province of Trujillo, in La Libertad, Peru. She has completed secondary school. She has 3 children, who depend economically on her. Niria sells antennas, cut from glass. She develops her business on the corners of the city of Trujillo. With her first loan of 200 soles that she received from the New Hope II Community Bank, she invested in the purchase of products, like cut glass. With this loan of 1700 soles, she will invest in the purchase of antennas and illustrated encyclopedias with a CD to stock her business. Niria dreams of stocking her hardware store so that it grows as a micro-enterprise.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy antennas and illustrated encyclopedias with CD to stock her business

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina A. is from the village of Rizal,Jimenez,Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old and married with five adult children. To make a living, Divina owns and operates a business weaving and selling nipa (palm) products to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 1,600 PHP a month.

In 2008, Divina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC, which was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture nipa products. She is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional nipa leaves to weave. This will be her third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase nipa leaves to weave.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma S. is from the village of Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old and married with three adult children. To make a living, Alma owns and operates a "sari-sari" or general store selling daily-use products like shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Alma has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Alma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Alma is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP to purchase more products. This will be her fifth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and supplement her family's needs.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Ni Kadek Suastini

texts.en:
Ni Kadek Suastini - (DNR.M-0696) is a 37-year-old female living in the town of Manistutu - Melaya.  She is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Ni Kadek Suastini owns & operates a service-based business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing hairdressing & beauty services to local community members.  Ni Kadek Suastini has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 1,500,000 IDR a month from these activities.


In 2007, Ni Kadek Suastini joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ni Kadek Suastini has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000,000 IDR from DINARI.  This previous loan was used to invest in renovating the business.  Ni Kadek Suastini is now requesting a new loan of 4,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase equipment to improve the business.  The loan will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from DINARI.  Ni Kadek Suastini plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.


About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Ni Kadek Suastini - (DNR.M-0696) merupakan 37 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Manistutu - Melaya.  Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia sekolah.  Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Kadek Suastini memiliki & menjalankan usaha.  Bisnis beroperasi di sektor jasa.  Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah mengoperasikan usaha berbasis jasa.  Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari menyediakan layanan rias rambut & kecantikan bagi anggota masyarakat setempat.  Ni Kadek Suastini sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 7 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Kadek Suastini menghasilkan sekitar 1,500,000 IDR sebulan.


Dalam 2007, Ni Kadek Suastini bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Kadek Suastini meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI.  Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk berinvestasi dengan merenovasi bisnis.  Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 4,000,000 IDR.  Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli peralatan untuk meningkatkan bisnis.  Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 3rd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI.  Ni Kadek Suastini berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis  untuk mendukung keuangan anggota keluarga langsung peminjam.


Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. .  Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam  Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Chuluunbat

texts.en:
Chuluunbat M. is 48, married, and the father of two daughters. His family lives in a "ger" (nomadic housing tent) district on the plot of land he owns in Uvurhangay, one of Mongolian central provinces. His eldest daughter, Pagamsuren, 19, is a university student in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city. His youngest daughter, Nanjidmaa, 9, attends an elementary school.

In 2002, Chuluunbat started running a retail business selling men’s and women’s apparel at a local market. For the first few business years, he was renting an outdoor stall. Since his business was successful, he has bought an indoor stall at the same market and he also expanded his house last year. He goes to an Ereen, a Chinese border city, twice in every month to purchase men’s and women’s apparel at wholesale prices.

Chuluunbat is a humble and mostly quiet person. During the interview with credit staff, he says “I'm working hard to pay for my daughter's university tuition. My wish is a better life for my children.” With this loan, he will purchase variety of summer clothes to increase his business inventory.

loans.use: To buy more men's and women's apparel

loans.name: Dulamragchaa

texts.en:
Dulamragchaa S. is 46, and is a single mother who has two daughters. Her family lives in Uvurhangay, one of the Mongolian central provinces.

Dulamragchaa has been running a retail business for the last twelve years. She began her business selling salt. After a few years she started working as a saleswoman at others' food stalls and sold rice and flour. Since she became experienced in selling those food products, she has rented a stall at the local food market to sell rice and flour. Her eldest daughter, Altantsetseg, 26, who lives with her, helps her mother’s business. Her youngest daughter, Dolgorsuren, 19, is an Arts and Culture university student in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city.

Dulamragchaa purchases rice and flour at wholesale prices from the wholesale food center and bags them to sell at retail prices. She says "I really wanted my eldest daughter to become educated. Unfortunately I didn't have enough funds to pay for her tuition. Thus, I’m working hard and saving small amounts to pay for my youngest daughter’s university tuition. My dream is to have my own food stall and have a sufficient amount of working capital."

With this loan, Dulamragchaa is planning to go to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city, to purchase more rice and flour at cheap prices. Thanks to her open, friendly, and hard working personality, she should do well.

loans.use: To buy rice and flour at wholesale prices
