Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari menanam & memanen kakao (coklat) untuk dijual. Ni Luh Suerni sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 4 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Luh Suerni menghasilkan sekitar 1,500,000 IDR sebulan.

Dalam 2007, Ni Luh Suerni bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Luh Suerni meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk berinvestasi dengan mengembangkan bisnis. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 5,000,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk berinvestasi dengan mengembangkan bisnis. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 3rd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Luh Suerni berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk mendukung keuangan anggota keluarga langsung peminjam.

Tentang DINARI:
Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. . Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva. ."

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Erdenebat

texts.en:
Erdenebat B. is a 29-year-old married father of two sons. His family lives in a 'ger' (nomadic housing tent) district in Uvurhangay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. He works as a security guard for a small local company. As his salary is not enough to feed his family, he also runs a retail business making furniture.

In 2007, Erdenebat started renting a room to run his furniture-making business. He makes a variety of wooden furniture for gers, such as chairs, tables and beds. Ger furniture is a bit smaller than house furniture. Most of his customers are local residents who live in the ger district. Erdenebat purchases planks at wholesale prices and dries them for 15 to 30 days, depending on how sunny it is. He says, "My dream is to open a big furniture factory in the future." With this loan, he will buy planks and boards for his business.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for his business

loans.name: Gulguu

texts.en:
Gulguu C. is 49, married, and the mother of three. Her two youngest daughters are university students in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her eldest daughter has just graduated from university and came back home.

Besides running a small family cafe, Gulguu, together with her eldest daughter, started running a copy center in a small rental place. She says that "My eldest one just graduated from the university. Now my two youngest ones are university students. It is hard to pay all our profit for their tuition for many years. I and my husband have been working hard for the last ten years. Although we invested all our profit in our children's future, I hope that one day our living conditions will be improving."

With this loan she will buy a new copier machine and raw materials for her business.

loans.use: To buy a Canon copier machine and raw materials

loans.name: Парвиз

texts.ru: Парвиз – молодой человек 1984 года рождения. Холост. Занимается продажей детских игрушек на втором этаже рынка «Панчшанбе» города Худжанда, магазин № 226. Парвиз привозит товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан а часть из города Бишкека Республики Киргизии. Он ездит за товаром 3 раза в город Истаравшан и 1 раз в месяц в Бишкек. Парвиз планирует расширить бизнес и закупить партию роликовых коньков для мальчиков и девочек. Сейчас наступили каникулы и все дети хотят кататься на площади на самокатах и роликовых коньках. Поэтому он просит кредит для осуществления его планов.
texts.en:
Parviz is a young man, born in 1984. He's single, and earns his living selling children's toys at store number 226 on the second floor of the Panchshanbe market in Khujand. Parviz gets some of his goods from the wholesale market in Istaravshan and some from Bishkek in the Kyrgyz Republic. Every month he goes to Istaravshan 3 times and once to Bishkek for his merchandise. Parviz is planning to expand his business and buy roller skates for little boys and girls. The summer break is here now, and all the kids want to go skating and ride their scooters on the square, so Parviz is seeking a loan to carry out his plans.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pairs of roller skates

loans.name: Zyodullo

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Умаров  Зиёдулло – молодой  человек  29  лет,  женат,  имеет  2-х  детей.  Год  назад  он  вернулся  из  Российской  Федерации,  куда  он  ездил  на  заработки.  На  заработанные  деньги  он  решил  арендовать  прилавок  на  продуктовом  рынке  Джаббор-Расуловского  района  и  торговать  продуктами  питания.  Два  раза  в  неделю  он приезжает  за  товаром  в  город  Худжанд,  где  расположены  оптовые рынки.  Его  младший  брат  помогает  ему  в  реализации  товаров.  Накопив  немного  денег,  Зиёдулло  собирается  построить  собственный магазин.
texts.en:
Zyodullo U. is young man, 29-years-old, and married with two children. Last year he came back from the Russian Federation, where he had gone for work. To make money, he decided to rent a stall at the Jabbor-Rasulov produce market and sell food products. Two times a week, he goes to Khujand, where they have wholesale markets, to get supplies. His younger brother helps him sell his goods. Once he's saved some money, Zyodulo plans to build himself a store.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food products

loans.name: Мунаввар

texts.ru: Мунаввар Ашурова – женщина 39 лет. Замужем и мать 2-х детей. Имеет среднее образование. Занимается продажей мужской и детской одежды на рынке Фаровон города Гафурова. Мунаввар закупает свой товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан. Мунаввар хотела, бы расширить ассортимент своего товара, потому, что хороший ассортимент привлекает больше клиентов. Мунаввар кредитуется в нашей организации с 2004 года. Она очень надежный и аккуратный клиент. Всегда целенаправленно использует свой займ. В этот раз Мунаввар предпочла взять займ для закупки летней мужской и детской одежды.
texts.en:
Munavar Ashurova is a 39-year-old woman. She's married with 2 children and has a middle-school education. She earns her living selling men's and children's clothing at the Farovon Market in the city of Gafurov. She buys her goods at the wholesale market in Istaravshan. She would like to increase the selection of goods she sells because a good selection draws a greater clientele. Munavar has been borrowing from our organization since 2004. She is a very dependable and punctual woman. She always makes good use of her loans. Munavar is seeking a loan at this time to buy men's and children's summer apparel.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy men's and children's summer apparel

loans.name: Mehri

texts.ru: Мехри – 50 лет. Замужем и мать 4-х детей. Она занимается продажей разных тканей хлопчатобумажной, ситец, марли и прочих тканей.  Она торгует на рынке Бунафша находящийся в районе «Панчшанбе» города Худжанда. В пятницу она выходит на рынок «Джума-базар», а в воскресенье на рынок «Якшанбе-базар». Мехри закупает товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан, и часть товара в городе Бишкек Республики Кыргызстан. Она ездит за товаром  2 раза в город Истаравшан и 1 раз в месяц в город Бишкек. Мехри за свой кредит хочет закупить партию летней ткани штапель.
texts.en:
Mehri is 50 years old, married and the mother of 4 children. She is engaged in the selling of various cotton, chintz, gauzes and other fabrics. She trades at the Bunafsha market located in the Panchshanbe region of the city of Khujand. On Fridays, she comes to the Juma-Bazaar market, and then on Sundays to the Yakshanbe-Bazaar market. Mehri purchases some goods from wholesale markets in the city of Istaravshan, and others in the city of Bishkek in the Kyrgyz Republic. She travels for goods twice per month to the city of Istaravshan and once to the city of Bishkek. With her loan, Mehri wants to purchase a lot of summer cotton rayon fabric.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase light summer fabrics (rayon) for women's dresses

loans.name: Saboat

texts.ru: Сабоат – 53 лет. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Она занимается продажей дорогих национальных тканей.  Она торгует на рынке Бунафша находящийся в районе «Панчшанбе» города Худжанда. В пятницу она выходит на рынок «Джума-базар», а в воскресенье на рынок «Якшанбе-базар». Сабоат закупает товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан, и часть товара в городе Бишкек Республики Кыргызстан. Она ездит за товаром  3 раза в город Истаравшан и 1 раз в месяц в город Бишкек. Сабоат за свой кредит хочет закупить партию летней дорогой ткани шифон для национальных платьев.
texts.en:
Saboat is a 53-year-old, married mother of three children. She is engaged in selling varied traditional fabrics. She sells in the Bunafsha market located in the Panchshanbe region of the city of Khujand. On Fridays, she comes to the Djuma-Bazaar market and on Sundays to the Yakshanbe-Bazaar market. Saboat buys some goods from wholesale markets in the city of Istaravshan and others in the city of Bishkek in the Kyrgyz Republic. She travels for goods three times per month to Istaravshan and once per month to Bishkek. With her loan, Saboat wishes to buy bundles of different chiffon fabrics for traditional dresses.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various summer fabrics and chiffon for traditional dresses

loans.name: Surayo

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 



Сурайё Абдуллоева имеет 4 летний стаж работы в предпринимательской деятельности, Сурайе торгует на рынке, продает пищевые продукты (сахар, различные виды круп, и зерновые продукты)  Товар ей привозит муж Уктам. 
 Сурайе хочет расширить ассортимент своего товара и поэтому запрашивает сумму в размере 2000 сомони. На эту сумму она хочет купить 60 кг  гороха, и продавать ее вместе с другими товарами.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Surayo A. has four years of experience in retail business. She sells food products on the market such as sugar and different kinds of cereals. Surayo wants to increase the assortment of her goods and this is why is asking for a loan for 2,000 somoni. She wants to buy 60 kilograms of peas and sell it together with other goods.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 60 kilograms of peas

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлуда – женщина 50 лет. Замужем, имеет 3-х детей. Её муж разнорабочий. Зарабатывает не так уж хорошо. Мавлуда занимается продажей сладостей и кондитерских изделий. Кондитерские изделия ей поставляет сестра а также дочка Мавлуды помогает печь кондитерские изделия. Мавлуда старается расширить свой бизнес и закупать импортные конфеты и сладости, для расширения своего ассортимента. Этим она хочет увеличить свой семейный доход.
texts.en:
Mavluda is a 50-year-old woman. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a handyman. He does not make terribly much money. Mavluda is engaged in selling sweets and candy products. Her sister supplies her with sweets and Mavluda's daughter also helps to bake sweets. Mavluda is trying to grow her business and to buy imported sweets and candies, in order to expand her assortment. In this way, she wants to increase her family's income.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase imported sweets

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Гулнора Отаева проживает в Ганчинском районе. У нее маленькие дети, мальчик и девочка. Муж Гулноры вот уже 2 года, как уехал на заработки в Россию. Каждый месяц он посылает оттуда 200-300 сомони на пропитание семьи.
 Сама Гулнора преподавательница. Работает в средней школе №38 Ганчинского района. 
 Как и множество сельских женщин Гулнора занимается животноводством. Дома у нее несколько голов домашнего скота. Овцы, козы и корова, которая два раза в день дает до 10 литров молока. Гулнора доит корову, перерабатывает молоко, производит из него масло, кефир и творог. Ее маленькие дети любят молочные продукты. Гулнора утверждает, что когда дома есть корова, то всегда есть свежее молоко и кефир для ее детей. 
 Гулнора хочет получить займ, для того чтобы купить еще одну дойную корову и продавать полученное от нее молоко на рынке. Для этого ей требуется займ в размере 1200 сомони.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Gulnora O. lives in the Gonjy region. She has small children, a boy and a girl. Gulnora's husband is already two years working in Russia. He sends 200-300 somoni from there every month to support the family. Gulnora is a teacher. She works in the secondary school #38 of the Gonjy region.

Gulnora does animal husbandry as many other village residents. She has several heads of cattle at home - sheeps, goats and a cow which gives up to 10 liters of milk twice a day. Gulnora milks the cow, processes the milk and makes butter, buttermilk and cottage cheese from it. Her little children love milk products. Gulnora says that when there's a milk cow at home, there's always fresh milk available and buttermilk for her children.

Gulnora wants to get a loan to buy one more milk cow and sell the milk that she will get on the market. She needs a loan for 1200 somoni for this purpose.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Mukharram

texts.ru: Мухаррам - женщина 1967 года рождения. Вдова и мать 3-х детей. Её муж умер несколько лет назад. Теперь она одна растит своих детей. Она трудится сколько хватает сил, чтобы растить своих детей в достатке. Мухаррам работает в столовой поваром. Она готовит разные блюда. А также печет пирожки на улице возле ёё столовой. Её столовая находится не далеко от нашей организации. В этом районе есть множество организаций и банков. Все сотрудники ходят обедать в ее столовую. Она готовит очень вкусно. Мухаррам просит новый займ для закупки сырья для ёё столовой.
texts.en:
Mukharram was born in 1967. She is widowed and is the mother of three. Her husband died several years ago and now she raises her children alone. She works as much as she can in order to support her family. She works as a cook in a cafeteria where she prepares different dishes. She also bakes pies that are sold on the street in front of her cafeteria. Her cafeteria is not far from our organization -- and is in a district where there are many organizations and banks, and the staffs of these organizations and banks take their lunch at her cafeteria. She cooks well. Mukharram requests a new loan to purchase products for her cafeteria.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products for a cafeteria

loans.name: Bal Qeis Group

texts.en: Bal Qeis is the leader of Bell Qeis group. There are three members in this group and each of them wants to take out a loan for her business. Bell Qeis wants a loan for her husband's fruit and vegetable shop. Allyia wants a loan for her husband's car parts shop. Soeiullah wants a loan for her tailoring business. They are requesting a group loan of 20,000 AFN and they are very thankful to AFS and to Kiva lenders who support entrepreneurs all over the world.

loans.use: For expanding business

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
 Замира Нематова имеет собственный продуктовый магазин. Поставляет туда товар, но продавцом в нем работает сестра ее мужа, так как у Замиры дома есть несколько голов крупнорогатого скота. Откормив купленный ею молодой скот, она хорошо его откармливает и продает.  И получает хорошую прибыль от этого бизнеса.
 В этой сфере деятельности ей помогает муж Шухрат.
 Замира подала заявку на получение кредита в размере 1000 сомони и хочет купить  дополнительно в свое домашнее стадо еще одного бычка.
texts.en:
Zamira N. owns her own grocery store. She keeps the store, and has her husband's sister working as a clerk there, while Zamira tends to cattle which she keeps at home. She feeds her young cattle and then sells them off, as it is a profitable business for her. She helps her husband, Shukhrat this way. Zamira applied for a loan of 1000 somoni and wishes to purchase more cattle.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: puchase of cattle

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
The woman pictured here is Rehana, a daughter of A.. She is a resident of Kabul, Afghanistan, and currently lives in the 12th district. She is married with 4 children, two daughters and two sons. All of them are students.

Rehana wants to assist her husband in his general store. They have a shared business and they would like to support each other in their daily life. Rehana requested this loan for 40,000 Afghani so she can advance the business by purchasing necessary materials and items that are in high demand from customers. She is thankful to the Kiva lenders for the worldwide support.

loans.use: To buy materials for her store

loans.name: Fatama Group

texts.en:
Fatama is the group leader of the Fatama group. There are four members in this group. Each of them wants to take a loan to progress her business, so they have requested a group loan of 40,000 afghani. 

Fatama wants a loan for her husband, who has a metal-working shop. Sabera wants a loan for her son, who is a taxi driver. Raema wants a loan for her husband, who has veil-selling shop. Salma wants a loan for the business of carpet weaving. They are very happy to have this lending process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: For expanding business

loans.name: Bebe Hiasha Group

texts.en: Bebe Hiasha is the group leader of Bebe Hiasha group. There are four members in this group. Each of them wants to take a loan for her/his business. Bebe Hiasha wants to take a loan for her husband who is a taxi diver. Geta also wants to take a loan for her husband who is a taxi diver. Najellah wants to take a loan for the business of tailoring. Shellah wants to take a loan for her son who is a painter. They are requesting a group of loan for 58800 Afghani. So they are very thankful from AFS and Kiva lenders that can support all entrepreneurs.

loans.use: For business progress.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita T. is a hopeful and determined 75-year-old woman trying to rise from poverty. She hails from the Municipality of Teresa, Rizal Province, in the Philippines. She is widowed and strove hard to nurture her children until they grew up. Looking at her age, she still has the will to continue her business, a general store where she sells basic commodities and goods for her neighbors’ consumption in their village. She has been doing this type of business for 18 years already.

In 2006, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines. She was happy, because since joining ASHI, she has had access to capital. She used her previous loans in her general store as well.

Now on her 6th loan, Teresita has proposed a loan for the amount of 30,000 pesos so she can have additional capital for her business. The amount will be used to purchase bulk stock for her general store.

She dreams to help her grandchildren with their school expenses and to expand her general store to a bigger one.

loans.use: Additional capital for general store

loans.name: Abdul Qudis

texts.en:
Abdul Qudis is the son of S. M.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 50, married, and has 6 children. He has 10 years experience in the field of farming and he works hard on his land to earn money for the completion of his family member’s requirements because all of them benefit from the income he generates. 
He would like to take an individual loan of 30000 Afghani to expand his business in order to support his family members in a better way and to purchase seeds and the other required tools for his land.
Finally, he would like to mention that Kiva is such an effective process that can support the entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and required materials for farming.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam P. is from the village of Buenavista, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old, and is married with four adult children. To make a living, Meriam owns and operates a business in the agriculture sector raising pigs. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Meriam has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Meriam joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC. Meriam is now requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase feed. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. Meriam plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther O. sells cooked food like rice, eba (a fried cassava dish), moi-moi (a steamed-beans cake) and drinks. She has been in this business for a long time. She is married with four children and she is 53 years old.

Esther hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and a deep-freezer to enable her to sell cold drinks. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and a deep-freezer

loans.name: Otunoy

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Отуной кредитуется для расширения своего бизнеса продажи обуви.Она благодаря своей кредитной истории смогла увеличить свой доход и улучшить семейное положение.
texts.en:
Otunoy is requesting a loan to expand her business selling shoes. Because of previous loans, she has been able to increase her income and improve her family's situation. MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

Абдуллоева Матлюба женшина 48 лет.Замужем имеет 4-х детей. Матлюба занимается продажей моющих средств. Она торгует на рынке "Панчшанбе" 6 лет. Раньше у неё было небольшой магазин и торговала она батарейками, свечками и мылом. Первый кредит получив на расширение ассортимента. Благодаря очередному кредиту она имеет большой магазин и благодарит за подержу кива.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. Matluba A. is 48 years old, married, and has four children. She sells cleaning goods, and has been selling them at the "Panshanbe" market for the last six years. Before, she had a small store where she sold batteries, candles, and soaps. With her first loan, she diversified her stock and because of a subsequent loan, she has opened up a big store, and she is grateful to Kiva for their support.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: puchas of cleaning goods

During our visit, she was on a trip to the capital, Bishkek, to purchase more products, and her daughter was minding the store.

Чахонгир Фаттоев женат имеет 2 дочек. Проживает он вместе со своей семьей в Ганчинском районе. Жена Чахонгира домохозяйка она занимается воспитанием детей и обязанностями по дому.
 Чахонгир вот уже 10 лет занимается откормом скота в домашних условиях. Покупает коров и овец, откармливает их и продает, получая при этом прибыль. На сумму дохода от продажи домашнего скота, он покупает еще скот.
Чахонгир обратился  в нашу организацию, для того чтобы получить кредит и использовать его для закупа корма для скота. Запрашиваемая сумма 1800 сомони.
Дополнительный семейный доход ему приносит сельское хозяйство. Он выращивает лук.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. Chahongir F. is married and has two daughters. He and his family live in Ganchinski district. His wife stays at home and raises his daughters. Chahongir has 10 years of experience raising domestic cattle. He buys cows and sheep, feeds them, and sells them for profit. With his profit, he buys more cattle. Chahongir has requested a loan from us of 1800 somoni to buy feed for the cattle. Additionally, he supports his family through agriculture, growing onions.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cattle feed

Маннонова  Тожихон – женщина  1948  года  рождения,  замужем,  имеет  3-х  детей,  образование  высшее.  Чтобы помочь  мужу  прокормить  семью,  она  решила заняться  бизнесом.  С  этой  целью  три года  назад  она  арендовала  маленький  продуктовый  магазинчик  и  начала  торговать  продуктами  питания.  В  данное  время  тей  помогают  невестка  и  внук.  Тожихон  очень  рада,  что  обратилась  в  нашу  организацию  за  кредитом.  Это  помогло  ей  расширить  свой  бизнес  и  увеличить  ассортимент  товаров.  Она  благодарна  нашим  партнерам  по  KIVA.
texts.en:
Tozhihon M. was born in 1948. She is married and has three children. She has a higher education. To help her husband support the family, she decided to start a business. Three years ago, she rented a small grocery store and began selling food. Today, her daughter in law and grandson help her fun the store. Tozhihon is very pleased that our organization is giving loans -- these loans have helped her expand her business and enable her to sell a wider range of products. She is grateful to Kiva's partners.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of flour and sugar

Каримова Зухро женщина 44 лет. Замужем имеет 3-х детей. Занимается продажей парфюмерии и хозяйственным товаром. Зухро от соседей узнав о нашей организации и решила кредитовать. Она за товаром ездить в Китай, чтобы увеличит товарооборот. Зухре помогает старшая дачка Зебо. Её дочка также торгует на другой точке мужской одежди.
texts.en:
Zukhro K. is 44 years old. She is married has three children. She sells perfume and household items. Zukhro learned about our organization from her neighbors and decided to take out a loan. She travels to China to purchase goods in order to increase her trade turnover. Her older daughter, Zebo, helps her in her business and also sells men's clothing at a different place.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam M. is a 43-year-old married mother of two school-aged children and is from Oroquieta City. To make a living, Meriam owns and operates a 'sari-sari' ('various kinds') store business in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Meriam has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Meriam joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Meriam is now requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and for use as working capital. This loan will be her sixth from PMPC. Meriam plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for use as working capital

Бахтиёр Нуров родился в 1974 году, проживает с женой, тремя детьми и родителями в кишлаке Басманда Ганчинского района.
Жена Бахтиера Навбахор домохозяйка, помогает мужу перерабатывать молоко. 
Бахтиер занимается животноводством  в домашних условиях. Стаж работы в сфере животноводства у него 8 лет. Дополнительно к этой сфере деятельности, он занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур.
Клиент хочет получить кредит  в размере 1600 сомони для закупа корма для скота.

He would like to take out a loan in the amount of 1600 somoni, to purchase feed for his livestock.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


  Наби  Маъмуров  воспитанный вежливый мужчина 44 лет. Проживает и работает в Ганчинском районе. 
Дома имеет 7 голов крупнорогатого скота, в откорме которого ему помогает жена Каромат. У Наби и Каромат 3 детей.  Сейчас они учатся. Через несколько лет родителям нужно женить и выдавать их замуж. В нашей стране это является прямой обязанностью родителей. Вырастить, выучить, женить и поддерживать своих детей пока родители в состоянии их поддержать.
Наби получив впервые кредит в нашей организации, потратил его на откорм домашнего скота. После получения дохода, он смог увеличить количество своего скота до 7 голов.
 Теперь он еще раз хочет получить кредит и постепенно увеличить количество своего скота до 11 голов. Что будет приносить ему еще больше прибыльности, и позволит прийти к поставленной цели относительно своих детей.
Запрашиваемая сумма 800 сомони для откорма скота.
texts.en:
Nabi M. is a polite, mild-mannered man. He is 44 years old and lives and works in Ganchinski district. In his home, he has seven cattle, and his wife, Karomat, helps him raise them. Nabi and Karomat have three children, who are all now studying at school, but in a few years, will be married off. In Tajikistan, it is the responsibility of the parents to raise the children, teach them, marry them off, and support them as long as they are able to. Nabi, with his first loan from our organization, raised his cattle. And with the increase of his income, he was able to increase the number of cattle he has up to seven heads. Now, he would like to take out another loan and gradually increase the number of cattle to 11 heads, which will increase his profit-making ability and ability to support his children. He is requesting 800 somoni to feed his cattle.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for cattle fodder

texts.fr:
Yaya B. vend de l’huile de palme et au miel qui est une activité très rentable au sud du pays dans la région de la Casamance qui est le lieu d’importation de ces produits. Les revenus tirés de cette activité lui permet d’entretenir sa famille.
Avec le prêt qu’il sollicite, il veut acheter des quantités importantes pour l hivernage car en hivernage la zone est difficile d’accès.
texts.en:
Yaya B. sells palm oil and honey which is a very profitable business in the south of the country in the region of Casamance which is where these products are imported from. The income from this business allows him to support his family.

With the loan he is asking for, he wants to buy larger quantities to stockpile for the rainy season, because in the rainy season, this area is difficult to access.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying larger quantities to  stockpile for the rainy season

loans.name: Mame Diarra

texts.fr: Mame Diarra  F. est restauratrice propriétaire d’un « fast Food » à Mbour sur la route de Kaolack. Ce prêt lui servira à l’achat  d’une machine pour « chawarma » qui va participer à renforcer ses activités et augmenter ses revenu. Les tirés de son activité lui permettent de renforcer son activité  qu’elle vient de démarrer mais aussi de préparer son mariage
texts.en:
Mame Diarra F. owns a « Fast Food » restaurant in Mbour on the road to Kaolack. This loan will be used to buy a machine to make « chawarma » (that is, to buy a rotisserie) which will bolster her business and increase her income. The profit from her business allows her to improve the business which she has just gotten up and running, and also to prepare for her marriage.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a spit to roast meat

loans.name: Arif

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Ариф  Гайбуллоев,  как и большинство его односельчан занимается животноводством. Эта сфера деятельности считается более прибыльным в сельских местностях.
К примеру, взять корову. Корова дает нам мясо, молоко, теленка если родит. Из молока мы производим молочные продукты. И это делают у нас  в домашних условиях. Даже рога коровы наши мастера используют для изготовления рукоятки ножей. И получается очень красиво. 
Вот и Ариф имеет дома коров и овец и получает хорошую прибыль от откорма этих домашних животных. В откорме скота и переработке молока ему помогает жена Мавлуда. Они вместе ежедневно подготавливают корм для коров и овец, поят их водой,  доят коров.  У них 5 детей: 2 дочери и 3 сына.
Ариф запрашивает сумму в размере 1200 сомони для закупа корма для  скота.
texts.en:
Just like many of his neighbors, Arif G. is involved in animal husbandry. This field is considered to be more profitable in agricultural locales. Take a cow, for example. It gives us meat, milk and possibly a calf. We make dairy products out of milk at home. Even cow horns are used for making knife handles by our master craftsmen. And it comes out very nice. So Arif has cows and sheep at home and makes a good profit from feeding these domestic animals. His wife, Mavluda, helps him with feeding livestock and processing milk. They prepare feed for the cows and sheep every day, give them water and milk the cows. Arif and Mavluda have 5 children: 2 daughters and 3 sons. Arif is requesting a loan in the sum of 1200 somoni in order to buy feed for the livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock feed

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa A. is 60 years old and she is a widow with six children. She has a store where she sells provisions. She hopes for the loan of N40,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.en: Alfonso P. is from the village of Western Poblacion, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. He is 63 years old, is married, and has seven adult children. Alfonso owns and operates a business raising and selling pigs. He has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Alfonso joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Alfonso is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase feed for his growing pigs. This loan will be his third from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig-feed

location.town: Western Poblacion, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mamadou D. est un enseignant dans une école privée dans le quartier de Château d’Eau Nord à Mbour  sa ville natale. Il habite la maison familiale  avec sa femme, ses enfants et sa mère. Avec le prêt qu’il sollicité, il veut réfectionner le toit et décor intérieur. 
.
texts.en:
Mr. Mamadou D. is a teacher in a private school in the Château d’Eau Nord neighborhood in Mbour, his native town. He lives in the family home with his wife, his children, and his mother. With the loan that he is requesting, he wants to repair the roof and the interior decor.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: repairing his home

loans.name: Gorgui

texts.fr:
MBTH/17026
Gorgui B. habite la ville de Mbour située à 70 km de la capitale sénégalaise Dakar il est marié et père de famille. Il vit toujours dans la maison familiale  avec le prêt qu’il sollicite, il veut démarrer la construction d’un appartement.
texts.en:
MBTH/17026 Gorgui B. lives in the town of Mbour situated 70 km from the Senegalese capital, Dakar. He is married and the father of a family. He still lives in his family home, and with the loan that he is requesting, he wants to start building an apartment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction

loans.name: Amelie

texts.fr: Madame Amelie S.  vend des produits tels que l’huile de palme, les jus de citron, du pain de singe, des balaies et du miel. Chaque mois elle parcoure plus 700km pour aller chercher ses produits en Casamance  au sud du Sénégal. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer ses activités commerciales les revenus génères par le commerce lui permettent de participer à la dépense quotidienne et à l’entretien du ménage.
texts.en:
Mrs. Amelie S. sells products such as palm oil, lemon juice, monkey bread, brooms, and honey. Every month she travels over 700 km to go and buy her products in Casamance, in the south of Sénégal. She is asking for this loan to bolster her little business. The income from this business permits her to share in covering daily expenses and household upkeep.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of palm oil

loans.name: Olmahon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Олмахон  Рузиматова  после смерти мужа осталась с четырьмя детьми. Ей надо растить детей. И вот она решила продолжить деятельность своего мужа, который занимался животноводством. Хоть и трудно ей приходилось, но своими усилиями и с помощью своих детей она справляется с этой работой неплохо. Получив прибыль от животноводства она открыла маленькую торговую лавку рядом со своим домом, где торгует  хозяйственными товарами ( мыло, стиральный порошок и т.д.)
 Олмахон услышав о нашей организации и ознакомившись с условиями кредитования, подала заявку на получения кредита в размере 1600 сомони, для откорма скота.
texts.en:
After her husband’s passing, Olmahon R. was left with four children. She needs to raise her children. And so she decided to continue her husband’s business, which is animal husbandry. Although it has been tough, Olmahon, with the help of her children, was able to handle this work well. Once she made a profit from animal husbandry, she opened a small retail stand near her house, where she sells household products (soap, laundry detergent, etc.). Once Olmahon found out about our organization and learned about our financing terms, she requested a loan in the sum of 1600 somoni for livestock feeding.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock feeding

loans.name: Marusya

texts.en:
Marusya S. is a widow and lives with her two children in Ovorhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces.

She has a small business in carpentry. She used to run the carpentry business on the plot of land of her neighbor. This year, with help of her two children, she moved the carpentry business to her own land after building a small shelter.

In addition to her carpentry business, she runs a small convenience store that sells a number of food items, including soft-drinks, chewing gums, biscuits, etc.

She keeps herself busy with her two businesses for most of the time. In the future, she hopes to expand her businesses and would like to build a small house on the plot of land that she owns. She requests a loan to purchase more wood and food products for her two small businesses.

loans.use: To buy wood and food products for her businesses

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace I. is 49 years old and is married with five children. She has a store where she sells bush meat. She hopes for the loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more bush meat to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bush meat to sell

loans.name: Nyamsuren

texts.en:
Nyamsuren C. lives with his wife and three children in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His two oldest children both go to private high schools and the youngest daughter goes a local kindergarten.

Nyamsuren runs a small factory that produces concrete blocks for construction in the city. His factory is located in Tolgoit, one of the suburban areas of Ulaanbaatar, connected to the city by a paved road. His factory currently has three employees and he plans to expand the factory as the demand for construction materials in the city picks up soon.

Nyamsuren works hard in order to be financially able to meet his family's ever increasing expenses. His two children both go to private schools and it significantly adds up to the family expense. He stressed the importance of education for his children and hopes to keep supporting their education as long as he can. Nyamsuren requests a loan to purchase raw materials for his concrete-block-making business.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as sand and small rocks

loans.name: Abdul Qudis

texts.en:
Abdul Qudis is the son of S. M.. He lives in Kabul Afghanistan. He is 50, married, and has 6 children. He has 10 years experience in the field of farming and he works hard on his land to earn money for the completion of his family member’s requirements because all of them benefit from the income he generates. 
He would like to take an individual loan of 30000 Afghani to expand his business in order to support his family members in a better way and to purchase seeds and the other required tools for his land.
Finally, he would like to mention that Kiva is such an effective process that can support the entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and required tools for farming

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.en: A. Mukaddas is 32 years old and married with four children. For the last nine years, Mukaddas has been selling jewelry in the local market. She started her business having only $300 in turnover. Gradually her business expanded and, currently, Mukaddas has $3,000 of working capital. Mukaddas sells jewelry of the oriental style. The national earrings, rings and bracelets are very beautiful and popular in Tajikistan. Any woman has at least one set of jewelry probably inherited from her grandmother. Mukaddas has lots of clients and her business is rather successful and generates a stable income for the family. Today, Mukaddas requests $3,000. She is going to purchase new items of jewelry to increase her range of goods to sell. She thanks all for support and promises to pay the loan on time. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new items of jewelry for increasing her range of goods

loans.name: Orgildalai

texts.en:
Orgildalai B. lives with his wife and two-year-old daughter in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His family lives in one bedroom of his cousin's three-bedroom apartment in the city. Since 2007, Orgildalai has operated a small printing shop where he mainly makes large advertising posters that are often displayed on the streets of Ulaanbaatar. His previous experience working for a large printing company has attracted some regular clients. The photo shows Orgildalai with the metal rods he uses to create large advertisement posters.

His chief financial goal is to buy his own house so that his family does not need to live in a tiny bedroom in someone else’s apartment. He requests a loan to purchase ink and paper for his printing business.

loans.use: To buy ink and paper for his business.

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Фарход Отабобоев  занимается животноводством и переработкой молока. Проживает он в Ганчинском районе вместе со своей семьей. Фарход женат и  у него 2 детей. Жена Фархода Шукринисо помогает ему в откорме скота.
     Получив кредит в первый раз Фарход смог получить хорошую прибыль и увеличить количество своего скота.
Благодаря результатам программы кредитования  нашей организации он подал вторично заявку на получения кредита для откорма скота.
texts.en:
Farhod O. is involved in animal husbandry and milk processing. He lives in the Gonjy district with his family. Farhod is married and has 2 children. His wife, Shukriniso, helps him with livestock feeding. Having obtained his first loan, Farhod was able to make a good profit and increase the quantity of his livestock. Thanks to the results of our organization’s lending program, he requested his second loan for livestock feeding.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock feeding

loans.name: Samba

texts.fr:
MR SAMBA K. est un membre de la mutuelle depuis deux ans ;il est agent de facturation à la société des eaux de thiès et parallèlement à ses activités il fait du commerce ;par un intermédiaire il achète des produits comme l'huile de palme et la pate d'arachide qu'il place auprès de la clientèle
avec le pret qu'il sollicite il veut renforcer son fonds de roulement
texts.en:
Mr. Samba K. has been a member of the credit union for 2 years. He works in billing in the water company in Thiès, and at the same time, he works as a merchant. He has someone buy products such as palm oil and peanut butter for him and he gets them to the customers.

With the loan, he hopes to increase his working capital.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying and selling products

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary E. is 37 years old and is married with four children. She has a store where she sells foodstuffs and fruit. She hopes for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and fruit to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and fruit to sell

loans.name: Mavlyuda

texts.en: Mavlyuda is married and has five children. A college graduate, she runs a small business selling men’s clothing in the central city market in Dushanbe. She believes that one of the biggest advantages of her work is a flexible schedule that gives her the opportunity to take good care of her children. Mavlyuda has been in business for five years. She has promptly repaid a total of two loans from IMON International. Her attentiveness and creativity have helped her develop a good understanding of what her clients need and want. They always feel complimented when she goes out of her way to help them with their selections. This has naturally boosted Mavlyuda’s sales and led to growth in her business. Mavlyuda is requesting a loan of $3000 to enable her to significantly expand her business by purchasing a new vending facility. She is hoping to reinvest the generated income into further expansion of her business. She believes that consistent growth will help her provide a stable source of income and continue to secure her family’s well-being. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase a new vending facility

loans.name: Mohammad Nahim

texts.en:
Mohammad Nahim is the son of K. W.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 52 and father of 6 children. He has been working as a farmer for more than 10 years and he is a really hard working man. He is very interested in his business and grows different kinds of seeds to have a harvested land. He has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for purchasing seeds that are not available in his land. 
He would like to say that the small loan process is really effective for business progress.

loans.use: Buying new kinds of seeds.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce S. is married and has three children. She has received schooling through primary education. Her husband is a fisherman who fishes on a small scale.

Joyce sells smoked fish in Abortoase. She uses all her income in taking care of the children and other parental responsibilities. She will use the loan to purchase fish on a large scale, process them by smoking and sell to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Joyce plans to reinvest.

loans.use: To purchase fish on a large scale

loans.name: Tsetsgee

texts.en:
Tsetsgee D. is 48 and the single mother of three children. Her eldest daughter, Herlen, 19, is a university student in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Tsetsgee's family lives in Baganuur, a small town located 210 kilometers from the capital city.

In 2002 Tsetsgee started running a vegetable stall at her sibling's grocery store. Besides running a stall, she used to work as a cleaner at the same store. After her husband's death, she stopped working as a cleaner and started expanding her tiny vegetable selling business to earn more profit since her income wasn't enough to live on. To help her family’s living expenses, Tsetsgee's only son, Hureltulga, 18, started working at the same store as a security guard and is paid 108,000 tugrugs per month ($1 USD-1450 MNT).

Now, Tsetsgee's business is running successfully. Her average daily income from sales is 20,000-40,000 tugrugs. She plans to run another food stall to sell meat. With this loan, she will be purchasing vegetables, mostly onions and potatoes, at wholesale prices. Tsetsgee says that "With the profit, I’m saving small amounts for my eldest daughter's university tuition. My hope is to have my own land to live on." Thanks to her hard working personality, Tsetsgee should do well.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for her business at wholesale prices

loans.name: Malika

texts.en: Malika is a lovely 32-year-old woman who lives with her three children. She runs a small fabrics-selling business where she offers at the market a variety of types of fabric for different tastes and ages. Malika is asking for this loan so that she can buy a larger quantity of goods. The extra capital will enable her to expand her merchandise and thus improve her business and increase her profits. Her dreams are to have her own large store one day—but most importantly, enable her children to have a better future, one where they can continue to study at the university, become professionals, and lead healthy and comfortable lives. On behalf of Malika and everyone here at IMON International, thank you for your support! To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new fabrics for increasing her range of goods

loans.name: Osato

texts.en: Osato O. is 43 years old and is married with ten children. She sells loaves of bread. She hopes for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more loaves of bread to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more loaves of bread to sell

loans.name: Soda

texts.fr:
soda F. est une femme commerçante qui habite au quartier cité lamy de thies ,elle est mariée et est mère de trois enfants;son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des parfums et de l'encens
elle sollicite ce pret pour renforcer son fonds de roulement
texts.en:
Soda F. is a merchant who lives in the Cité Lamy district of Thies. She is married and the mother of 3 children. Her business consists in buying and selling perfumes and incense.

She is requesting this loan to bolster her working capital.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling perfumes

loans.name: Oimniso

texts.en: S. Oimniso is 45 years old and a very good entrepreneur. She is married and the loving mother of two children. Her husband has no fixed job and this is the reason why, twenty-five years ago, she decided to start her own business. Oimniso started with very little merchandise but, little by little, her business grew and she also started to sell clothes with excellent results. She is very clear about the secret of success in a business. She knows it is the variety of products that she offers because if a client is looking for something that she does not have, he or she may never return to her. For this reason, she tries to always be with good stock. Oimniso is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase merchandise and new clothes for the season. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and new clothes for the season

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary G., married with seven dependents, received schooling through junior high. She sells fresh and smoked fish while her husband is a fisherman with small fishing accessories. Mary uses her income to pay for all the financial requirements of the children. She is requesting the loan to purchase fish to smoke and sell and plans to reinvest the new profits from her expanded business.

loans.use: Mary will use the loan to purchase fish to smoke and sell.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en: B. Mavluda is 44 years old and is married with three children. She dedicates herself to raising livestock. Her earnings have helped her to purchase more animals to raise, which she has done over a period of eight years. In one month’s time, she sells them at the Sunday market. Now she decided to request a loan of $750 to purchase two bulls. She is very content with her work because, together with her husband, she carries out her enterprise. Her dreams include buying food for her livestock and providing an education for her children. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase two bulls

loans.name: Liala

texts.en:
This is Liala, daughter of A. S.. She lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. She is 37, married, and has 5 children. She lives in a house that needs to be repaired. In last year’s winter, she and her family members had lots of problems living there. When she found AFS (Ariana Financial Services), she has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani to repair her house and to buy the needed constructive materials to live comfortably. 
She admires this effective process.

loans.use: For buying construction materials.

loans.name: Khurshida

texts.en: R. Khurshida is a hardworking mother who, since she got married, has been working in the business of breeding and selling cattle. She is quite efficient in this kind of activity thanks to the experience she has acquired year after year. She works very hard to support her dear children with education. The desire of this virtuous mother is to grant her children the opportunity to finish their studies, an opportunity that she never had due to the scarce economic resources of her family when she was young. Khurshida is requesting a loan to achieve her goals. She will use the capital to invest in her daily activity in order to obtain a bigger profit from selling her animals. Let's help Khurshida and her beautiful family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Ousseynou

texts.fr: ousseynou D. est un imprimeur de profession qui a son bureau chez lui aux parcelles assainies de thies ;son activité consiste à faire des photocopies ,des plastifications,des reliures et des traitements de texte avec l'aide d'un de ses amis;avec le pret ,il veut acheter du matériel comme du papier ,des feuilles de plastification et de l'encre pour améliorer sa marge bénéficiaire
texts.en:
Ousseynou D. is a printer by trade, and he has his office in his home in the Parcelles Assainies neighborhood of Thies. His work consists in making photocopies, laminating, binding, and word processing with the help of one of his friends. With the loan, he wants to buy materials such as paper, laminating sheets, and ink so as to improve his profit margin.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of materials he needs to do his work

loans.name: Rukhsat

texts.en: Rukhsat is the 51 year old married mother of three children. Her husband is an entrepreneur and Rukhsat started her business ten years ago in order to support her family. All year she sells fruit that she buys from local farmers. With the loan of $475 from Kiva, she plans to increase the range of her goods and to buy more fruit to sell. Rukhsat strives to give her children a better life than they have, including supporting them through a good education. Rukhsat is a well spoken, friendly business woman who is worthy of the support of Kiva lenders. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase the range of her goods and to buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Chioma

texts.en: Chioma E. is 38 years old and is married with three children. She sells cooked foods and drinks. She hopes for the loan of N150,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Khanifa

texts.en:
Khanifa I., 27 years old, is the married mother of two children. Her lack of a stable job and the slow productivity of her husband's business as an ecologist didn't leave enough money to pay the expenses of the family, so Khanifa decided to start her own business five years ago selling the fabrics of the national dresses. Little by little she has made her business grow, and by offering her clients the option of paying in installments, her orders are getting bigger. Now her business is running normally but she would like to continue bettering herself and her business so her situation will be stable in the future. She is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy seasonal fabrics for the national dresses. The power to help her business grow is in your hands.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes: its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seasonal fabrics to increase her range of goods.

loans.name: Zumratbi

texts.ru: Зумратби Абдурахимова проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст 65 лет. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. По профессии Зумратби педагог. В данный момент она занимается животноводством. Она откармливает и продает крупно рогатый скот. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 10 лет. Муж находится в России, на заработках. Клинтка просит кредит, чтобы купить скот.
texts.en:
Zumratbi Abdurakhimova lives in Kulyab city. She is 65 years old, married, and has five children. By profession, Zumratbi is a teacher, but she is making a living at this time raising livestock. She raises cattle which she sells, and has been doing this for over 10 years. Her husband works abroad in Russia to support the family back Home. She is requesting a loan to buy cattle.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort G., married with six dependents, received education through primary school. She sells fresh foodstuffs such as fresh tomatoes in Abortoase while her husband fishes on a domestic basis but earns little income for a living. Comfort uses her income to cover the financial needs of the children and the family at large. She is requesting the loan to purchase a variety of fresh foodstuffs to sell, and with the new profits from her expanded business, plans to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: Comfort will use the loan to purchase a variety of fresh foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Olambi

texts.ru: Оламби Курбонова проживает в городе Душанбе. Возраст 51 год. Замужем, имеет 2 детей. Оламби более 11 лет занимается торговлей, она имеет торговую точку на рынке, где торгует одеждой. Ее муж работает водителем маршрутного такси. Клиентка проаит кредит, чтобы увеличить товараоборот.
texts.en:
Olambi K. lives in Dushanbe city. She is 51 years old, married, and has two children. She has over 11 years experience trading and has a shop in the market where she sells clothing. Her husband is a taxi driver. She is requesting a loan in order to increase her trade turnover.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase trade turnover

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Cette femme est une résidente du quartier de djidjolé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes, elle a récemment associé à cette activité le commerce de produits de première nécessité. Son stock de pagnes a baissé de même qu’une partie des produits de première nécessité a péri, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 15 pièces de pagnes, et divers produits de première nécessité.
texts.en:
This woman is a resident of the Djidjolé neighborhood which is an outlying district of the city of Lomé. She is married and the mother of 3 children. She earns her living selling "pagnes" (brightly colored lengths of African print cloth). She has recently added on the sale of staples.
